Body Text: a security guard thrust open the door of antony blinken 's armoured car and the u secretary of state strode out down a line of yellow barricade . `` we 're working to get them home , `` he declared , gripping the hand of israeli protester in tel aviv calling for a deal to release the hostage held by hamas . it wa a striking moment but not altogether spontaneous . the street had by now been buzzing with security official readying his route towards the protester . those of u in the travelling press were told to expect the interaction in the 20 minute or so leading up to it . it wa firmly caught on camera . this wa a strong message from america 's top diplomat to both the israeli public and it prime minister - the u wa committed , engaged and pushing everything to get a ceasefire-for-hostage-release deal over the line . in other word the message is : the u is trying to stop the war - albeit with firm condition . washington ha been under growing domestic and international pressure due to the unprecedented crisis unfolding in gaza and the catastrophically high number of civilian killed . president joe biden and mr blinken have spent week now publicly ramping up pressure on israel to surge more aid in , and they want to develop a plan to secure the territory 's long-term future . but a the crisis deepens , the limit of american influence have become increasingly clear . just hour before the moment filmed at the barricade , the u had resorted to a vote in the un security council to try to shape the action of it ally . this wa a sign of president biden 's growing exasperation . the american-drafted text called on israel to surge more aid into gaza amid un warning of imminent famine . it endorsed the current process mediated by qatar to get a ceasefire in return for the release of hostage by hamas . but it also warned israel against a military assault on the city of rafah , home to more than 1.4 million displaced palestinian , saying an offensive could violate international humanitarian law . the resolution failed . it wa vetoed by russia and china . speaking at ben gurion airport on friday afternoon , mr blinken castigated those who voted it down . he implied they did so for reason that had nothing to do with the substance , while also warning that a rafah offensive could leave israel without international support . `` it risk killing more civilian , it risk wreaking greater havoc with the provision of humanitarian assistance , it risk further isolating israel around the world and jeopardising it long term security and standing , `` he said . amid the growing rift between washington and the israeli leader , mr netanyahu struck back at mr blinken 's assessment . `` i told him i hope we 'll do it with the support of the united state , `` said the prime minister , `` but if we have to , we 'll do it alone `` . this wa a superpower being pushed back , despite it pressure . i 've seen the phenomenal force of u diplomacy at close quarter this week , trailing mr blinken on a time-zone shattering tour of europe , asia and ending in the middle east trying to stem the current crisis . to america 's critic the paradox is clear : the u is sending weapon to a key ally , while at the same time urging it , without success , to do much more to alleviate the civilian suffering the military action ha unleashed . a un-backed food security assessment this week said 1.1 million people in gaza were struggling with catastrophic hunger and starvation , adding that a man-made famine in the north wa imminent between now and may . a growing number of u politician have also spoken out . this week a group of democratic senator and nearly 70 former u official , diplomat and military officer said president biden should consider cutting weapon supply to israel if it keep restricting humanitarian aid to gaza . israel blame the un for a failure to distribute supply . the un categorically reject this but israel insists that checkpoint restriction and attack on police securing aid convoy have been a necessary part of it campaign to eliminate hamas . i asked mr blinken in manilla whether the security vacuum in gaza wa a harbinger of it future . how could he convince israel to accept the his proposal ? hamas could end the suffering tomorrow , he said , if it surrendered . but he reiterated that more humanitarian aid had to be allowed in . answering my question , he gave a u endorsement for the first time to a un-backed measure on hunger , saying `` 100 % of the population in gaza is at severe level of acute food insecurity . that 's the first time an entire population ha been so classified . `` much of mr blinken 's trip wa crisis management . trying to get aid into gaza , get the hostage out and secure an end to the conflict , which the u say must ensure hamas 's attack on israel on 7 october `` can never happen again `` . at the same time it is trying to shape a post-war future . washington want the palestinian authority running gaza . it is the entity formed during the 1990s oslo accord and driven out of gaza by hamas in 2007 . the american think they can patch together a grand bargain for the middle east . they want to pursue the long sought-after independent state for palestinian in the west bank , east jerusalem and gaza - albeit demilitarised - alongside a secure israel : the so-called two-state solution . gaza , rebuilt , would be governed by the internationally-backed palestinian authority , which is revitalised with money and security force trained by arab state , including saudi arabia . added to this riyadh would recognise israel , a long-sought after goal for the israeli that would further integrate it into the region . in return the saudi would get advanced american weapon , a security pact with washington and a us-backed civilian nuclear power programme . it sound impossibly ambitious , and perhaps it is . the american are not naive about the chance of achieving the most illusive of goal in the middle east , amid some of the worst bloodshed in the region 's modern history . but just a he did at the barricade , mr blinken think he can use a moment of crisis to grasp the initiative .

Body Text: the first uk-funded field hospital in gaza aim to be fully functioning in day , with treatment for everything from minor illness to bullet wound . it ha been set up by the aid organisation uk-med , which deploys many nh staff to international emergency . the facility is based near rafah , where 1.5 million palestinian are crammed in , having fled other part of gaza . `` the scale of the need is simply staggering , `` uk-med 's chief executive david wightwick told the bbc he wa speaking over the noise of hammering and banging a construction continued in the desert sand of al mawasi . `` there are very few service of any kind and the health service have been eroded to the extent that if you are sick , if you are ill , if you are wounded , you are in a very difficult situation . `` the field hospital - which wa despatched from manchester - will eventually cover the size of two football field , but getting started ha n't been easy . when the uk-med truck were held up at the border , david and his team began building with local timber from destroyed building . `` it took a lot of negotiation to get land , and it took a lot of negotiation to get thing across the border , `` he said . `` it 's been a challenge to find staff . it ha been a challenge to communicate , none of the phone work , none of the internet work , and everything somehow ha to be made to work in order to bring essential urgent life-saving service to people . `` the team are already seeing about 100 outpatient a day at the field hospital and expect to double that soon . uk-med is already running mobile clinic that go out into the community in gaza . `` they have definitely seen case of acute malnutrition in very young child , `` david said . a surgical team from the aid group ha been working in the chaos of the al aqsa hospital - the only hospital functioning in the centre of the gaza strip . the ward and corridor are teeming with patient , and with family seeking shelter , who have bedded down on the floor . it 's hard to get a trolley through , but when we visited , a 12-year-old boy called ana wa on his way to surgery with a broken leg and wound to his face . ana said that he wa playing when his neighbourhood wa bombed . he wa injured , and his mother and six-month-old baby brother were killed . `` may god have mercy on their soul , `` he said . uk-med orthopaedic trauma surgeon saba papuashvili wa waiting for ana in the operating room . `` he 's a brave boy , `` he said . the surgery went well . ana will recover but the team have seen some of the worst that war can do , according to anaesthetist judith kendall . `` i have worked in many warzones over the past nine year , `` she told the bbc . `` i think what shocked me about this particular context is the number of child injured that we are seeing , and the extent of those injury . they are life-changing injury that a child will have to live with . `` gaza 's hospital are n't just overwhelmed . they are often under attack from israeli force . israel claim that hamas used hospital a cover - a claim denied by health official and medical staff . the uk-med team understand the danger , said mark shaw , from west yorkshire , who ha previously worked in ukraine . `` we recognise the risk , and we accept the risk which is why we are here in a humanitarian sense , `` he said . `` the worst injury we are seeing are the amputation , and blast injures , especially in young child . `` back in al mawasi , more truck have arrived , and another hangar ha been erected . if there is ground invasion in rafah - title: first uk-funded field hospital open in gaza - bbc news

Body Text: the first uk-funded field hospital in gaza aim to be fully functioning in day , with treatment for everything from minor illness to bullet wound . it ha been set up by the aid organisation uk-med , which deploys many nh staff to international emergency . the facility is based near rafah , where 1.5 million palestinian are crammed in , having fled other part of gaza . `` the scale of the need is simply staggering , `` uk-med 's chief executive david wightwick told the bbc he wa speaking over the noise of hammering and banging a construction continued in the desert sand of al mawasi . `` there are very few service of any kind and the health service have been eroded to the extent that if you are sick , if you are ill , if you are wounded , you are in a very difficult situation . `` the field hospital - which wa despatched from manchester - will eventually cover the size of two football field , but getting started ha n't been easy . when the uk-med truck were held up at the border , david and his team began building with local timber from destroyed building . `` it took a lot of negotiation to get land , and it took a lot of negotiation to get thing across the border , `` he said . `` it 's been a challenge to find staff . it ha been a challenge to communicate , none of the phone work , none of the internet work , and everything somehow ha to be made to work in order to bring essential urgent life-saving service to people . `` the team are already seeing about 100 outpatient a day at the field hospital and expect to double that soon . uk-med is already running mobile clinic that go out into the community in gaza . `` they have definitely seen case of acute malnutrition in very young child , `` david said . a surgical team from the aid group ha been working in the chaos of the al aqsa hospital - the only hospital functioning in the centre of the gaza strip . the ward and corridor are teeming with patient , and with family seeking shelter , who have bedded down on the floor . it 's hard to get a trolley through , but when we visited , a 12-year-old boy called ana wa on his way to surgery with a broken leg and wound to his face . ana said that he wa playing when his neighbourhood wa bombed . he wa injured , and his mother and six-month-old baby brother were killed . `` may god have mercy on their soul , `` he said . uk-med orthopaedic trauma surgeon saba papuashvili wa waiting for ana in the operating room . `` he 's a brave boy , `` he said . the surgery went well . ana will recover but the team have seen some of the worst that war can do , according to anaesthetist judith kendall . `` i have worked in many warzones over the past nine year , `` she told the bbc . `` i think what shocked me about this particular context is the number of child injured that we are seeing , and the extent of those injury . they are life-changing injury that a child will have to live with . `` gaza 's hospital are n't just overwhelmed . they are often under attack from israeli force . israel claim that hamas used hospital a cover - a claim denied by health official and medical staff . the uk-med team understand the danger , said mark shaw , from west yorkshire , who ha previously worked in ukraine . `` we recognise the risk , and we accept the risk which is why we are here in a humanitarian sense , `` he said . `` the worst injury we are seeing are the amputation , and blast injures , especially in young child . `` back in al mawasi , more truck have arrived , and another hangar ha been erected . if there is ground invasion in rafah - a israel is threatening - the british field hospital could be crucial .

rafah crossing with the enclave . he also called on israel to give `` total , unfettered `` access to humanitarian good throughout gaza . a un-backed food security assessment this week said 1.1 million people in gaza were struggling with catastrophic hunger and starvation . it added that a man-made famine in the north wa imminent between now and may . mr guterres , who said he had come to rafah `` to spotlight the pain of palestinian in gaza `` , wa speaking a day after russia and china blocked a u draft resolution put to the un which called for a ceasefire tied to the release of hostage held in gaza . `` it 's time to truly flood gaza with life-saving aid . the choice is clear : either surge or starvation . blocked relief truck on the egyptian side of border are a moral Body Text: who would n't want a house on the beach ? for some on israel 's far-right , desirable beachfront now includes the sand of gaza . just ask daniella weiss , 78 , the grandmother of israel 's settler movement , who say she already ha a list of 500 family ready to move to gaza immediately . `` i have friend in tel aviv , `` she say , `` so they say , ' do n't forget to keep for me a plot near the coast in gaza , ' because it 's a beautiful , beautiful coast , beautiful golden sand `` . she tell them the plot on the coast are already booked . mr weiss head a radical settler organisation called nachala , or homeland . for decade , she ha been kickstarting jewish settlement in the israeli-occupied west bank and east jerusalem , on palestinian land captured by israel in the 1967 middle east war . some in the settler movement have cherished the dream - or pipedream - of returning to gaza since 2005 , when israel ordered a unilateral pullout , 21 settlement were dismantled and about 9,000 settler were evacuated by the army . ( reporting from gaza at the time , i saw many who were literally dragged out . ) many settler saw all this a a betrayal by the state , and a strategic mistake . opinion poll suggest that most israeli oppose resettling gaza , and it is not government policy , but since the hamas attack on 7 october it is being talked about out loud - by some of the loudest and most extreme voice in israel 's government . mr weiss proudly show me a map of the west bank with pink dot indicating jewish settlement . the dot are scattered all over the map , eating away at land where palestinian hope - or hoped - to build their state . there are about 700,000 jewish settler in these area now and settler number are rising fast . the vast majority of the international community considers settlement illegal under international law , including the united nation security council . israel dispute this . we meet daniella at her home in the west bank settlement of kedumim , where red-roofed house are spread over hilltop and valley . she 's in constant motion despite having an arm in plaster . her vision for the future of gaza - now home to 2.3 million palestinian , many of them starving - is that it will be jewish . `` gaza arab will not stay in the gaza strip , `` she say . `` who will stay ? jew . `` she claim that palestinian want to leave gaza and that other country should take them in - although in a lengthy interview , she rarely us the word `` palestinian `` . `` the world is wide , `` she say . `` africa is big . canada is big . the world will absorb the people of gaza . how we do it ? we encourage it . palestinian in gaza , the good one , will be enabled . i 'm not saying forced , i say enabled because they want to go . `` there is no evidence that palestinian want to leave their homeland - although many may now dream of escaping temporarily , to save their life . for most palestinian , there is no way out . the border are tightly controlled by israel and egypt , and no foreign country have offered refuge . i put it to her that her comment sound like a plan for ethnic cleansing . she doe not deny it . `` you can call it ethnic cleansing . i repeat again , the arab do not want , normal arab do not want to live in gaza . if you want to call it cleansing , if you want to call it apartheid , you choose your definition . i choose the way to protect the state of israel . `` a few day later , daniella weiss is selling the idea of a return to gaza over cake and popcorn at a small gathering , hosted by another settler in their living room . she ha a projector , showing a new map of gaza , complete with settlement , and leaflet entitled `` go back to gaza `` . `` people are asking me what the odds are this will happen ? `` she say . `` what were the odds back then when i came to these dark mountain and made it into this heaven ? `` the handful in attendance seem already convinced . `` i want to go back immediately , `` say sarah manella . `` when they call me , i will go back to gush katif [ the former israeli settlement bloc in gaza ] . `` what about the people who live there , we ask . `` the area is empty now , `` she reply . `` now you do n't need to think where to put the settlement , you only need to come back and put a new settlement . `` gaza is far from empty , but much of it ha been erased after almost six month of relentless israeli bombardment . it is the `` greatest open-air graveyard `` in the world , in the word of the eu 's foreign policy chief , josep borrell . more than 32,000 palestinian have been killed , according to the hamas-run health ministry in gaza , most of them woman and child . the world health organization regard the ministry 's data a credible . for some in the israeli cabinet , the palestinian territory - now drenched in blood - is ripe for resettlement . that includes israel 's hard-right national security minister itamar ben gvir - a settler himself . in late january , he made his way through a packed conference hall , slowed by embrace and handshake . he wa among friend - about 1,000 ultranationalists pushing for a return to gaza at the event entitled settlement brings security . mr ben gvir , who favour `` encouraging emigration `` , wa among a dozen cabinet minister in attendance . `` it 's time to go back home , `` he said from the stage , to loud applause . `` it 's time to return to the land of israel . if we do n't want another 7 october , we need to return home and control the land . `` in the shade of a sprawling tree , yehuda shimon is playing with his two young son , who are in hammock , hanging from the branch . he ha raised 10 child here in a settler outpost in the west bank called havat gilad , or gilad 's farm , near the palestinian city of nablus . all around him there are palestinian village , the nearest 500m away . there is no contact between them , he say . shimon ha lived in gaza in the past and claim a god-given right to return . `` we must do it . it 's part of israel area , `` he say . `` this is the land that god gave u , and you could n't go to god and tell him , ' ok you gave me , and i gave to other people . ' no . i believe in the end we will go back to gaza . `` i ask what this mean for the palestinian . `` they have 52 other place to go in the world , `` he say , `` 52 muslim country `` . he say the new gaza will be `` another tel aviv `` . outpost like his are multiplying in the west bank , along with larger settlement , fragmenting palestinian territory and stoking tension . settler attack on palestinian have surged since 7 october according to the un , which ha long condemned settlement a `` an obstacle to peace `` . and now settler organisation have their eye on gaza once again . is there a real prospect of settler reaching the beachfront in gaza ? a seasoned israeli journalist told me it wo n't happen . `` call to resettle gaza wo n't be translated into policy , `` he said . then he added : `` famous last word . `` additional reporting by wietske burema , goktay koraltan and ariel tagar

Body Text: from the first shout of `` fireball `` the crew of hm diamond have just two minute to react . in that time they have to work out whether the missile , travelling at more than three time the speed of sound , pose a direct threat to their ship and nearby merchant vessel . we were the first medium on board hm diamond since she joined the us-led operation to protect merchant shipping in the red sea . we witnessed the threat first-hand a she prepared to run the gauntlet of houthi drone and missile being fired from yemen . the captain of hm diamond say the houthis are now using more advanced and more lethal weapon . cdr pete evans say when the ship first entered the red sea in december , one-way attack drone , or uavs , were the main threat . but he say the houthis have `` moved much more into conventional and ballistic missile which are harder to defend against and cause much more damage `` . we began our voyage a the crew made the final check to the ship 's weapon system . it main sea viper missile were already primed , hidden in a silo at the front of the ship - with scorch mark still visible from previous launch . each missile cost more than â£1m ( $ 1.3m ) . they are the ship 's main line of defence . but diamond also ha phalanx machine gun and 30mm cannon on each side of the ship - close-in weapon . the phalanx can fire more than 3,000 round a minute . for the very first time the crew have also used the 30mm cannon to successfully shoot down a drone . diamond 's main task in the red sea ha been to protect merchant ship travelling through this key trade route . but for this mission she 'd be escorting a naval task force of uk support ship sailing towards the indian ocean - with two u destroyer providing additional protection . up on the bridge the navigator , lt josh tyrie , showed the route we 'd be taking - past houthi-controlled territory in yemen , through the narrow bab al-mandab strait and out into the gulf of aden . they call this the high threat area - where the houthis have been focusing their attack on both merchant shipping and coalition warship . `` there 's a regular drumbeat of drone and missile , so there 's a good possibility that will happen , `` lt tyrie said . by now the entire crew had changed from their blue uniform to fire-resistant white overall . we 'd all been issued anti-flash hood and glove to wear in case the ship wa hit . the upper deck were declared out of bound - with dim red lighting in the ship 's passageway . photo of iranian-designed drone , which might be used against the vessel , are displayed along the deck . we waited inside the operation room - the ship 's nerve centre - where the crew stare into row of monitor and screen . with the ship 's powerful radar they can track multiple object simultaneously for hundred of mile . at 20:35 came the first blast of a whistle with a shout of `` fireball `` - the code for a detected missile launch . the ship 's alarm sounded to alert the rest of the crew with the word : `` air threat warning red - missile inbound . `` a they tracked the missile 's flight path they issued update . the air threat wa lowered from red to yellow and then white . the tension eased and sailor removed their anti-flash hood and glove . it wa the first of four anti-ship ballistic missile fired by the houthis that night . lt cdr martyn harris , diamond 's executive officer , explained they had just two minute to react to launch , with the missile travelling at more than three time the speed of sound . `` yes it can feel a bit intense if someone is potentially trying to shoot something at you , `` he said . diamond ha been targeted by the houthis in the past - Body Text: israel ha cancelled a meeting in washington after the u declined to veto a un security council resolution calling for a ceasefire in gaza . the resolution , which also called for the release of all hostage , followed several failed attempt at similar measure since the 7 october attack . israeli prime minister benjamin netanyahu accused the u of having `` abandoned `` it previous policy . meanwhile intense fighting rage between israel and hamas in gaza . the un security council 's first resolution demanding an immediate ceasefire came after call for urgent action to avert a famine in gaza . since the start of the conflict , the u ha used it veto power to block three security council resolution calling for pause in the fighting or a ceasefire . another two have been vetoed by both russia and china . on monday , the u abstained on a resolution that called for an `` immediate `` ceasefire for the rest of the month of ramadan - two week - and the `` immediate and unconditional release of all hostage `` . the 14 other member of the council , including the uk , voted in favour , meaning the resolution passed . while washington ha taken an increasingly tougher stance on israel it insisted it abstention did not mark a shift in policy . but mr netanyahu said the un resolution did not make the demand for a ceasefire conditional on the release of the hostage , a the u and israel had both argued it should . israel belief hamas and it ally are still holding about 130 hostage in gaza , including 33 presumed dead . `` today 's resolution give hamas hope that international pressure will force israel to accept a ceasefire without the release of our hostage , thus harming both the war effort and the effort to release the hostage , `` mr netanyahu 's office said in a statement . it added that , `` in light of the change in the u position `` , a visit by an israeli delegation to the u this week would not go ahead . israeli and u official had been due to meet to discus israel 's planned offensive in the southern gaza city of rafah , where some 1.5 million palestinian have sought shelter , having fled the fighting elsewhere in gaza . u secretary of state antony blinken ha said publicly that a ground operation in rafah risk killing more civilian and is `` not the way `` to defeat hamas . on the ground there wa no indication of a let up in hostility , a israeli warplane continued to bomb rafah . fierce gun battle also raged around hospital in nearby khan younis and gaza city . rocket warning siren also sounded in israeli border town . responding to mr netanyahu 's decision to cancel the israeli delegation 's visit to washington , u national security council spokesman john kirby said it wa `` disappointing `` but reiterated the u view that `` a major ground offensive in rafah would be a major mistake `` . mr kirby said that scheduled meeting between israeli defence minister yoav gallant and u national security advisor jake sullivan would go ahead a planned . yair lapid , israel 's opposition leader and former prime minister , criticised mr netanyahu 's decision , described the episode a `` unnecessary `` and said mr netanyahu had been `` irresponsible `` . `` bad for israel . bad for security , bad for the economy , `` he said on x , formerly twitter . `` sometimes you have to say ' no ' to the american . israel is indeed an independent country , and we do not need anyone 's permission to defend ourselves . [ but ] it is better to keep the quarrel in closed room . `` un security council resolution are widely considered to be legally binding on un member state , although the u ha said it doe not consider monday 's vote to be binding on israel . mr gallant ha said israel will not stop the war in gaza while hostage are still being held there . the hostage were seized when hamas attacked southern israel on 7 october , killing about 1,200 people , most of them civilian . the palestinian representative to the un , riyad mansour , welcomed the resolution but said it wa overdue . `` it ha taken six month , over 100,000 palestinian killed and maimed , two million displaced , and famine , for this council to finally demand an immediate ceasefire , `` he said . hamas ha welcomed the vote , but also told mediator it wa sticking to it original demand for a comprehensive ceasefire which include the withdrawal of israeli troop from gaza and a return of displaced palestinian to the north of the strip . the israeli prime minister 's office described this a `` unrealistic . `` talk between israeli and hamas representative continue via mediator in qatar . report suggest that a deal currently being proposed would see 40 israeli hostage released in exchange for 800 palestinian prisoner . monday 's resolution came amid huge concern over the dire humanitarian situation in gaza . last week , mr blinken warned that the entire population of gaza wa experiencing `` severe level of acute food insecurity `` . the un world food programme ha also warned that , in gaza 's two northern governorates , famine is expected to set in by may unless the flow of aid into the territory is increased . following monday 's vote , un secretary-general antónio guterres said the resolution `` must be implemented `` and that `` failure would be unforgivable `` . early on tuesday , the british government announced that it had carried out it first airdrop of food into gaza . it said the royal air force drop included 10 tonne of supply : water , rice , cooking oil , flour , tinned good and baby formula . it also repeated call on israel to allow more aid in via gaza 's port and to open more land crossing into the territory .

Body Text: a un human right expert say she belief israel ha committed `` act of genocide `` in gaza . francesca albanese , the un special rapporteur on human right in the occupied palestinian territory , presented her report to un member state in geneva on tuesday . but israel ha already dismissed her finding . this come amid growing international pressure on israel to stop the war or to do much more to protect civilian . m albanese concluded that `` there are reasonable ground to believe that the threshold indicating the commission of the crime of genocide against palestinian a a group in gaza ha been met `` . before m albanese even got to her foot , her finding had been dismissed by israel , whose ambassador described it a `` an outrageous distortion of the genocide convention `` . israel ha for year been angered by the un human right council 's agenda , which permanently devotes an entire section - item 7 - to scrutiny of the situation in `` palestine and the other occupied arab territory `` . the agenda item wa approved not by the un itself , but by un member state , decade ago , and ha never expired . no other country in the world ha permanent scrutiny like this , and israel view it a discriminatory , and aimed at delegitimising israel . it refuse to attend the council when item 7 is under discussion . but many country , in particular those in the middle east , argue that the situation - in the absence of self-determination for palestinian through a two-state solution - requires ongoing investigation , and now that there is another conflict , all the more so . since hamas 's brutal attack on israel on 7 october , m albanese ha called for the release of the hostage , and doe so again in this report . in it she `` firmly condemns the crime committed by hamas and other palestinian armed group in israel on 7 october `` . but she ha also been outspoken in her criticism of israel 's conduct of the war in gaza . that 's why her report ha been awaited with both impatience , and trepidation . m albanese 's choice of a title for it : ' anatomy of a genocide ' wa not exactly diplomatic . many member state , especially those traditionally supportive of israel , will be uncomfortable . but un special rapporteur , while tasked by the un to examine and advise on specific situation , are independent of it . genocide is a specific legal term , and m albanese 's report suggests some of the legal criterion have been fulfilled . she cite what she say appears to be israel 's intention to destroy palestinian a a group `` in whole or in part `` , a key clause in the convention against genocide . she mention in particular three element which point to possible genocide : the death toll in gaza , currently well over 32,000 according to gaza 's hamas-run health ministry , the bombing of densely populated area , and the restriction on aid supply ( which , the un say , have brought gaza to the brink of famine ) , are all proof , the report claim , of intent to destroy the group . basel alsourani , of the palestinian centre for human right , welcomed the report . he suggested international law had been violated by all side in this conflict , but argued that genocide wa such a serious crime the international community could not ignore it . `` allowing genocide to happen doe n't only affect palestinian … , it affect all human being around the world , `` he said . `` if now israel is committing genocide without accountability , tomorrow we do n't know which country will claim that genocide ha been committed by israel , and [ therefore ] i can commit genocide with no accountability . `` tala nasir , a palestinian human right lawyer who also travelled to geneva to hear the report , hoped it would draw more attention to the fate of what she said were thousand of people detained by israel since 7 october . `` they have arrested more than 7,700 palestinian , `` she said . `` eighty per cent of them are being held under administrative detention which mean they are not presenting any charge against them . `` their family , she pointed out , had no contact with them , and no idea where they were . not surprisingly , israeli diplomat are angry . it ambassador to the un in geneva , meirav eilon shahar , described the report a `` an obscene inversion of reality `` , and accused m albanese of questioning israel 's right to exist . many israeli , too , are likely to be shocked . and the suggestion of genocide , towards a state which wa founded a a direct result of nazi germany 's genocide of jew , will cause deep offence . in the wake of 7 october attack , and the fact that so many israeli family are still waiting for news of loved one taken hostage , hearing such outspoken condemnation is hard . noam peri , whose father chaim wa taken hostage , also travelled to geneva . her focus , naturally , is that her father not be forgotten . `` my father wa kidnapped from his own home , `` she said . `` he 's an 80-year-old person that wa sitting in his home with my mother , and he wa brutally taken from there , and ha essentially disappeared since . he ha no communication , with no-one in the world . `` but , a this week 's vote for an immediate ceasefire at the un security council show , member state are growing impatient with israel 's conduct of the war . too many well-respected un aid agency have warned that nowhere in gaza is safe , that family are now eating animal feed , or grass , that amputation are being performed on child without anaesthetic . they all say israel is restricting vital aid supply , and government have begun to doubt israel 's claim that the un is to blame for the delay . many will not like francesca albanese 's choice of word , but the content of her report will add to the pressure on israel to change it strategy .

which monitor event in syria from the uk - said the aleppo attack had led to the highest number of dead ( 36 ) among syrian force in a single such `` israeli attack `` . it also said six hezbollah fighter were killed . citing two security source , reuters news agency said five hezbollah fighter were among the dead , putting the death toll at 38 . syria 's defence ministry said civilian and syrian military personnel had been killed . it said the air strike were carried out `` in conjunction with `` drone attack by `` terrorist organisation `` against aleppo city and the surrounding area , though it did not give any further information . israel 's military told the bbc it would not comment on foreign medium report . the sohr , which us an extensive network of contact in syria , said the alleged israeli strike also caused multiple injury , some serious . it said that the strike hit the weapon warehouse in jabrin area , near aleppo international airport , and targeted syrian air defence force facility in al-saferah , about 20km ( 12.5 mile ) , south-east of aleppo city . it also said explosion were heard in the kafr joum area of western aleppo . in recent year , israel ha launched hundred of strike on syria against hezbollah or iranian asset there . it ha vowed to prevent iran - hezbollah 's most important backer - from transferring advanced weaponry to the lebanese group or from building up it own military presence in syria . both iran and hezbollah - syrian ally - oppose israel 's existence . alleged israeli strike on syria have increased since hamas , which is also supported by iran and hezbollah , carried out the 7 october attack on israel , which triggered the war in gaza . cross-border attack between hezbollah in lebanon and israel have also escalated . on wednesday , israeli air strike on southern lebanon killed 16 people , including hezbollah fighter and other militant , marking the deadliest attack of their kind since hezbollah began launching rocket at israel in support of hamas on 8 october . hour after the first israeli strike , a hezbollah rocket barrage killed a 25-year-old man in northern israel . additional reporting by christy cooney and robert greenall

Body Text: israel 's high court ha issued an order in the long-running dispute over ultra-orthodox military exemption , deepening a crisis in the government . it instructed a funding freeze for ultra-orthodox , or haredi , educational institution whose student are eligible for conscription . haredi party in the government have reacted angrily , while a secular party ha threatened to quit over the issue . ultra-orthodox exemption are opposed by a majority of israeli . the haredi community comprises about 12 % of the population but those in full-time torah study are exempt from mandatory military service . conscription applies to almost all other israeli , apart from israeli arab , from the age of 18 for both men and woman . the government is debating a bill which reportedly seek to strike a compromise by allowing exemption with limitation . but the draft plan is fiercely opposed by haredi party . two of those party - shas and united torah judaism ( utj ) - hold 18 seat in the 72-seat emergency government . on the other hand , the secular , centrist national union party , which hold eight seat , is insisting exemption are scrapped altogether . the party 's leader , benny gantz , a former army chief of staff , ha threatened to pull out of the government over the current plan . `` the people will not tolerate it , the knesset will not be able to vote in favour of it , and my associate and i can not be part of this emergency government if this law pass , `` he said on monday . while some ultra-orthodox jew of army service age serve in the israel defense force ( idf ) , the vast majority do not , devoting their life to torah study in the religious institution , or yeshivot . the high court ruled that fund to yeshivot whose student qualify for conscription since 1 july 2023 when a previous law on deferral expired but who have not yet enlisted , will be frozen . it is reported to affect about 50,000 yeshiva student . the ruling is due to come into effect on 1 april , a day after a deadline for the government to draft a new law expires . the head of utj , yitzhak goldknopf , called the ruling `` a stain and a disgrace `` . critic object to the exemption , arguing that all jewish israeli should serve without exception . the issue ha intensified since the start of the war in gaza on 7 october , in which 254 soldier have been killed . a former adviser to shas leader ariyeh deri , barak seri , told israel public radio that `` from the moment that the court ruled , the haredi party have been in utter shock `` . `` they were stunned by the ruling that funding will stop this monday . the accusation are flying in all direction , at the likud [ party which lead the government ] , at [ prime minister benjamin ] netanyahu , at the fully right-wing government , at their representative . . . this is the worst situation the haredi have ever been in . ``

Body Text: three united nation observer and a translator have been wounded by shelling in rmeish , southern lebanon , the un peacekeeping mission said . lebanon 's state news agency reported that an israeli drone strike wa behind the explosion , but the israeli military denied it wa responsible . the un mission , unifil , said those hurt were receiving treatment and that it wa investigating the blast 's origin . it come after rising tension along the unofficial israel-lebanon border . in a statement , unifil said a shell had exploded near the group who had been on a foot patrol along the un-demarcated blue line that divide southern lebanon from israel . it described the targeting of peacekeeper a `` unacceptable `` . unifil spokesman andrea tenenti told the bbc that location deeper inside lebanon were increasingly being chosen a target , which `` could potentially trigger a much wider conflict `` . no detail have been given about the nationality of the observer or their condition . the lebanese translator is reported to be stable . lebanon 's state run national news agency said israeli `` enemy drone `` raided the area in southern lebanon where the observer were wounded . israel 's military denied this , saying in a statement : `` contrary to the report , the idf [ israel defense force ] did not strike a unifil vehicle in the area of rmeish this morning . `` in recent day , tension have again picked up along the unofficial border between israel and lebanon , with casualty on both side . mr tenenti from unifil told the bbc 's newshour programme that targeted and lethal shelling wa now happening `` pretty far away from the blue line `` in lebanon . israel and the armed group hezbollah trade almost daily strike across the border , which began with the start of the israel-gaza war following the 7 october hamas attack on israel . hezbollah is a lebanese shia muslim militant group with close tie to iran and an ally of hamas . on friday , israel 's defence minister yoav gallant said the idf would increase it attack against the group in lebanon , `` shifting from repelling to actively pursuing hezbollah `` . `` wherever they are hiding we will reach them , `` he said . meanwhile , israel ha come under pressure from the u after it said it `` can not support `` an anticipated large-scale ground offensive in rafah on gaza 's border with egypt , where there are more than a million displaced people . u president joe biden 's administration ha been raising concern about rising civilian death in gaza and humanitarian access to the territory , which the un say is on the verge of famine . on saturday , the idf admitted killing two palestinian men and burying their body with a bulldozer in `` two different incident `` in gaza . it come after al jazeera published an edited video purportedly showing the incident on wednesday . the bbc ha not independently verified the video . the israeli military said the two men approached their force `` in a suspicious manner `` and did not respond to a warning shot . they were killed and buried with a bulldozer over concern the men carried explosive , the idf added .

Body Text: despite a week of tension with israel over it conduct of the gaza war , washington is reported to have authorised arm transfer to it ally worth billion of dollar . these include more than 1,800 mk84 2,000lb ( 900kg ) bomb and 500 mk82 500lb bomb , a well a 25 f35a fighter jet , the washington post and reuters news agency have said . the larger bomb have previously been linked to air strike in gaza causing mass casualty . washington give $ 3.8bn ( £ 3bn ) in annual military assistance to israel . but the latest package come a the biden administration ha been raising concern about rising civilian death in gaza and humanitarian access to the territory , which the un say is on the verge of famine . the administration ha also said it `` can not support `` an anticipated large-scale israeli ground offensive in rafah on the egypt border , where there are more than a million displaced people . the palestinian ministry of foreign affair in ramallah criticised the u for inconsistency in it position . in a post on x , formerly known a twitter , it said : `` demanding [ israeli prime minister benjamin ] netanyahu to stop killing civilian and supplying him with weapon is an unprecedented principled and moral contradiction `` . news of the arm transfer emerged on the same day that president joe biden spoke of `` the path being felt by so many in the arab-american community with the war in gaza `` . the arm transfer have also been strongly criticised by some senior member of the president 's democratic party who have been calling for u military aid to be limited or conditional on change in how israel conduct military operation . the u state department told the bbc that it wa unable to confirm potential or pending u arm transfer before congress wa formally notified . quoting pentagon and state department official , the washington post reported that the extra warplane being sent to israel were initially approved a part of a larger package by congress in 2008 and had been requested last year - in advance of the deadly 7 october attack by hamas which triggered the gaza war . when israel 's defence minister yoav gallant went to washington last week , it wa said he had taken a long list of u weapon his country wanted to receive in an expedited manner . during the war israel , though itself a major weapon exporter , ha been heavily reliant on american air defence and munition . ten of thousand of bomb have been dropped on gaza , with military expert saying the aerial campaign ha been one of the most intense and destructive in recent history . late last year , analysis of bomb crater from satellite imagery drew major u news outlet to conclude that israel had routinely used it biggest 2000-pound ( 900kg ) bomb . the new york time quoted explosive expert who said that while bomb of that size were used by several western military , they were almost never dropped by u force in densely populated area anymore . meeting top u official , mr gallant stressed the need to preserve his country 's qualitative military edge in the middle east and prepare for a possible escalation in fighting with the powerful lebanese armed group , hezbollah . he also sought to ease tension with his country 's most important ally , which had sunk to their lowest point of the gaza war after the u abstained from a key un security council vote on monday . the israeli prime minister , benjamin netanyahu , reacted angrily when this allowed a resolution calling for an immediate ceasefire to pas . in the wake of the vote , white house spokesman john kirby had rejected claim that the u had changed it position and denied that it wa ready to start conditioning aid to israel . `` it 's not about trying to use some sort of power dynamic here with our good friend and ally , israel . it 's about helping them defend themselves , `` he told journalist . `` we still have israel 's back . a you and i are speaking , we are still providing tool , capability , and weapon system so that israel can defend itself against what we agree is still a viable threat [ from ] hamas . `` since the new arm transfer were reportedly given the green light , there have been sign that relation between israel and the u have eased . a high-level israeli delegation is now expected to travel to washington to discus possible alternative plan for operation against hamas in rafah . the trip had previously been cancelled by mr netanyahu in response to the un security council ceasefire vote . in another step likely to be welcomed by the u , israel ha also agreed to send senior intelligence official back to egypt and qatar for renewed talk to try to release it hostage a part of a possible truce deal with hamas .

border would go ahead , despite the united state saying it would not support the operation . mr netanyahu told a news conference that the offensive in rafah , where there are more than a million displaced people , `` is essential to victory `` . meanwhile , thousand of israeli protestors gathered in jerusalem for the largest anti-government demonstration since the start of the gaza conflict . protest against the israeli government 's handling of their release . the word mark a significant escalation in some of the hostage ' relative rhetoric against the government . since israel launched it retaliatory operation , saying it wa aimed at destroying hamas , a total of 32,782 palestinian have been killed and 75,298 injured , according to the hamas-run health ministry . earlier this month , u defence secretary lloyd austin said that , of those killed , more than 25,000 were woman and child .

Body Text: iran 's revolutionary guard say seven officer have been killed in an israeli strike on the iranian consulate building in syria 's capital , damascus . brig-gen mohammad reza zahedi , a senior commander of the elite quds force , and brig-gen mohammad hadi haji-rahimi , his deputy , were named among the dead . iran and syria 's government condemned the attack , which destroyed a building next door to the iranian embassy . the israeli military said it did not comment on foreign medium report . however , it ha acknowledged carrying out hundred of strike in recent year on target in syria that it say are linked to iran and allied armed group which are armed , funded and trained by the revolutionary guard . the israeli strike have reportedly been stepped up since the start of the war in gaza in october last year , in response to cross-border attack on northern israel by hezbollah and other iran-backed group in lebanon and syria . but monday 's attack will be seen a a serious escalation . the israeli appear to be testing the resolve of the iranian and their ally and signalling that they are serious about increasing pressure on their enemy . the israeli are looking at the fact that both iran and hezbollah have not been pushing a hard a some might expect . now they will see if iran and hezbollah are going to push back . there will be a response , but it may not be the one people expect . rather than missile , it may be some sort of cyber-attack . syria 's defence ministry said israeli aircraft targeted the iranian consulate building , which wa on a highway in the western mezzeh district of damascus , from the direction of the occupied golan height at about 17:00 local time ( 14:00 gmt ) on monday . syrian air defence shot down some of the missile they launched , but others made it through and `` destroyed the entire building , killing and injuring everyone inside `` , the ministry added . the ministry said work wa under way to recover the body and rescue the wounded from beneath the rubble , without saying how many casualty there were or naming any of them . photo and video from the scene showed smoke and dust rising from the remains of the collapsed multi-storey building . the iranian embassy next door did not appear to have sustained any significant damage . the iranian ambassador , hossein akbari , said israeli f-35 fighter jet `` brutally targeted my place of residence and the consular section of the embassy , along with iran 's military attache `` . he told iranian state tv that between five and seven people were killed , including some diplomat . later , the revolutionary guard put out a statement saying that seven of it officer were killed , including brig-gen mohammad reza zahedi and brig-gen mohammad hadi haji-rahimi , whom it described a commander and `` senior military adviser `` . iranian medium said zahedi , 63 , wa a senior figure in the quds force - the revolutionary guard ' overseas operation arm - and served a commander in lebanon and syria between 2008 and 2016 . haji-rahimi wa meanwhile identified a zahedi 's deputy . zahedi is one of the most high-profile iranian figure believed to have been killed by israel in the country 's long campaign of targeted assassination . the uk-based syrian observatory for human right , which relies on a network of source on the ground in syria , reported that eight people were killed - a high-ranking leader of the quds force , two iranian adviser and five member of the revolutionary guard . syria 's foreign minister faisal mekdad said he strongly condemned what he called `` this heinous terrorist attack `` , adding that it had killed `` a number of innocent people `` . in a telephone conversation with mr mekdad , iranian foreign minister hossein amir-abdollahian described the strike a `` a violation of all international obligation and convention `` and `` blamed the consequence of this action on the zionist regime `` , the iranian foreign ministry said . he also `` stressed the need for a serious response by the international community `` . a white house spokeswoman said u president joe biden wa aware of the report . in a briefing to journalist on monday , idf spokesperson rear adm daniel hagari said an apparent drone attack on a naval base in the southern israeli city of eilat wa `` a very serious incident `` . the drone wa `` made and directed by iran `` , he said . this attack followed suspected israeli strike on damascus and the northern city of aleppo last friday , which the syrian observatory for human right said killed 53 people , including 38 syrian soldier and seven member of the iran-backed lebanese armed group hezbollah . in january , another strike in mezzeh that wa blamed on israel killed five senior revolutionary guard and several syrian security personnel . israel ha previously acknowledged carrying out strike in syria to combat what it call iran 's `` military entrenchment `` , a well a shipment of iranian weapon to allied group which it proscribes a terrorist organisation . iran ha said revolutionary guard have been sent to syria to `` advise `` president bashar al-assad 's force in the country 's civil war , but it ha denied they have been involved in combat or established base .

Body Text: the israeli parliament ha approved a law giving the government the power to ban broadcast of tv channel including al jazeera , the qatari-owned network . prime minister benjamin netanyahu said he would `` act immediately `` to close the network 's local office . the u expressed concern over the move . with foreign journalist banned from entering gaza , al jazeera staff based in the strip have been some of the only reporter able to cover the war on the ground . the knesset , israel 's parliament , approved the bill allowing foreign network considered a threat to national security to be `` temporarily `` banned . the ban would be in place for a period of 45 day at a time , which could be renewed . the law would stay in force until july or until the end of significant fighting in gaza . `` al jazeera will no longer be broadcast from israel , `` mr netanyahu wrote on twitter/x , calling the network a `` terrorist channel `` . for year , israeli official have accused the network of anti-israeli bias . but their criticism of the broadcaster have intensified since the hamas attack of 7 october . authority claim it ha close link with hamas , which al jazeera vehemently denies . in a statement , al jazeera said : `` netanyahu could not find any justification to offer the world for his ongoing attack on al jazeera and press freedom except to present new lie and inflammatory slander against the network and the right of it employee . `` al jazeera hold the israeli prime minister responsible for the safety of it staff and network premise around the world , following his incitement and this false accusation in a disgraceful manner . `` the channel ha accused israel of deliberately targeting it staff . journalist including hamza al-dahdouh , the son of al jazeera gaza bureau chief wael al-dahdouh , have been killed by israeli strike . israel denies targeting journalist . qatar , where al jazeera is headquartered , is mediating talk between israel and which ha the narrowest of republican majority - to structure new ukraine support in the form of loan . to help cover the cost he suggested authorising the u government to seize and sell russian asset frozen since the start of the ukraine war . `` if we can use the seized asset of russian oligarch to allow the ukrainian to fight them , that 's just pure poetry , `` said mr johnson . an estimated $ 300bn ( £ 239bn ) in russian central bank asset have been frozen - although most of this is under european , not american , control . a an additional sweetener for his republican colleague , he also proposed tying the passage of ukraine aid to legislation ending a hold on new liquefied natural gas export authorisation . the hold wa imposed by the biden administration in january at the behest of environmental activist . this would n't be the first time republican have tried to tie ukraine assistance - which is opposed by a growing number of conservative voter and a small but vocal group of legislator - to an unrelated political priority for the party . in february , senate republican negotiated with democrat to construct a legislative package that included funding for ukraine along with conservative immigration reform and resource for border security . the deal collapsed , however , after republican presidential candidate donald trump voiced his opposition and his supporter in congress - including mr johnson in the house - followed suit . the white house say approved ukraine aid ran out at the beginning of the year and ha repeatedly warned that the nation is losing ground in it war against russia because of a lack of continued american backing . in the house of representative , pro-aid legislator have been gathering signature for a parliamentary procedure that would trigger a vote on a senate-approved measure that authorises new aid for ukraine and israel - essentially forcing mr johnson 's hand . the house speaker 's latest proposal may be a way to forestall such a direct erosion of his power to set the legislative agenda . a mr johnson grapple with how to help ukraine , however , he stand on unstable ground . the man who assumed the speakership after his predecessor wa ousted last year by a right-wing rebellion is facing similar unrest from his party 's hard-core right . his negotiated deal with democrat to avoid a government shutdown two week ago prompted one conservative firebrand , georgia congresswoman marjorie taylor greene , to file a motion for his removal . while she ha not taken step to force a vote on the matter , she ha warned that she will if mr johnson is n't ultimately replaced . later this month , republican membership in the house will drop to 217 - general , and six syrian were killed . the israeli military said it did not comment on foreign medium report . but an unnamed senior israeli government official told reuters news agency that those target in syria that it say are linked to iran and allied armed group which are armed , funded and trained by the revolutionary guard . the strike have reportedly been stepped up since the start of the war in gaza in october last year , in response to cross-border attack on northern israel by hezbollah and other iran-backed group in lebanon and syria . iran ha so far avoided direct confrontation defending the holy shrine `` - an apparent reference to a revered site on the outskirt of damascus believed to house the tomb of sayyida zeinab , the daughter of the first shia muslim imam . `` having achieve it goal and that this cowardly crime will not go unanswered . `` later , iran 's supreme leader also vowed to avenge the revolutionary guard ' death , which he described a a `` heavy loss `` for his country . `` the evil regime will be punished by the hand of our brave men . we will make them regret this crime and others like it , `` ayatollah khamenei said . iran 's mission to the united and had completed tour in bosnia and afghanistan with the british armed force before working a a security consultant . his family said he would be `` remembered a a hero `` who will `` never know the void he ha left `` . `` james wa always willing to lend a helping hand to anyone , even in the face of senseless violence , `` they said in a statement . speaking to the bbc , mr kirby 's cousin adam mcguire said he wa `` completely selfless `` and `` just wanted to help people `` , which is why he had gone to gaza . another cousin , amy roxburgh-barry , described him a a `` true friend `` who `` loved his mate , he loved his family . `` mr henderson wa the third british man killed . he had been in gaza for just over a week alongside with mr chapman and mr kirby . they were due to return home in day , the bbc understands . the three 's role a security adviser were to ensure the aid convoy travelling in gaza followed safety procedure and remained on the correct route . matthew harding , the non-executive director of the security company that employed them , said all three had extensive experience in risk management and were `` all highly trained , highly professional `` . he added that their death were `` a truly tragic loss to both u and indeed their loved one `` . prime minister rishi sunak spoke to mr netanyahu on tuesday evening about the strike . downing street said the prime minister told mr netanyahu he wa appalled by the incident and demanded a thorough and transparent investigation into their death . mr sunak said earlier he wa `` shocked and saddened `` and sent his thought to the friend and family of the victim . he added that aid charity should be `` praised and commended `` for their work , which they should be allowed to do `` unhindered `` . the dual us-canadian wa born in quebec and had served 11 year in the canadian armed force . he had been a volunteer in gaza since early march . mr flickinger 's parent told the bbc on thursday that their son had loved his job . `` the work married his talent , `` his father , john flickinger , said . `` his love for adventure and his desire to serve and help others . `` `` he wa such a good human being , `` his mother sylvie labrecque said . `` he wa extremely devoted to his work and his family . `` mr flickinger had recently settled in costa rica with his partner sandy and their 18-month-old son , named jasper . `` jasper will be a very good inspiration for u to stay strong , `` mr labrecque said . `` right now , we 're still in shock . `` u secretary of state anthony blinken called the aid worker `` hero `` who were `` simply trying to help fellow human being `` . he said washington had spoken directly to the israeli government and urged `` a swift , thorough and impartial investigation to understand exactly what happened `` . canadian foreign minister mélanie joly echoed the call for a full investigation , and said : `` strike on humanitarian personnel are absolutely unacceptable . . seven of the us-based food charity 's worker were killed on monday when leaving a warehouse in gaza . israeli prime minister benjamin netanyahu ha acknowledged that israel 's force hit `` innocent people `` . in his statement , mr andrés said he wa grieving for the victim ' family . `` these are people . . . angel , `` he wrote in a post on x , formerly twitter . `` they are not faceless . . . 's founder , mr andrés , saying he wa `` heartbroken `` over the death , white house press secretary karine jean-pierre said on tuesday . mr biden `` is grieving with the entire wck family `` , she said . mr andrés , a two-star michelin chef , established wck in response to the 2010 earthquake in haiti . the group ha provided meal in a host of war-torn place , including ukraine . it ha become one of the main supplier of desperately needed aid to gaza . the group ha named the seven killed : the three british national killed were part of wck 's security team , according to the group , while Body Text: a u military veteran ha refused to pay a fine for carrying a pro-hamas sign at a protest in south yorkshire . michael rabb , 73 , of boulder , colorado , wa arrested at the demonstration at proscribed organisation . but on tuesday , he told the judge he wa `` not going to pay `` the £ 1,000 fine . the ex-us navy fighter pilot also refused to pay £ 930 cost and a £ 400 surcharge . the court had earlier heard that rabb wa spotted at the protest outside sheffield city hall carrying a homemade sign which read `` stand with hamas , end israel , free palestine `` . hamas is proscribed a of the terrorism act to bring him to court a `` arbitrary `` . by any standard of `` decency `` he should be found not guilty , rabb said . following the guilty verdict , district judge annabel pilling told rabb that the fine wa `` designed to hurt `` . however , rabb responded by saying : `` no judge , i 'm not going to pay . i refuse to pay . `` judge pilling warned rabb that he had `` Body Text: the israeli military ha released the finding of it investigation into it attack on a convoy in gaza which killed seven aid worker . the israeli defense force ( idf ) say the vehicle were hit by missile after it drone operator mistakenly thought they were carrying hamas gunman . the idf say it ha dismissed two senior military officer and reprimanded two others . since the attack on 1 april , bbc verify ha been studying image of it aftermath , shared on social medium , to try to piece together what we know about the incident . the group of world central kitchen ( wck ) aid worker were travelling in three car - two of them armoured . they were part of a convoy delivering more than 100 tonne of food supply from a recently constructed pier to a warehouse in deir al-balah in central gaza , according to wck . it say their movement had been co-ordinated with the idf in advance but the investigation ha found that this information had not been shared with israeli drone operator tracking the convoy . the idf say they had spotted a gunman riding on the roof of a large aid lorry , that wa being escorted by the wck team . drone footage of this wa shown to journalist at an idf briefing on 4 april but ha not been released . the idf say the convoy wa tracked to a warehouse ( labelled ' a ' on the map ) where the aid lorry remained and four `` suv-type car `` emerged . it say one contained gunman - also shown to journalist in drone footage - and headed north but wa not targeted because it wa close to another aid facility ( labelled ' b ' ) . the three remaining vehicle , belonging to wck , headed south . the investigation say `` one of the commander mistakenly assumed that gunman were inside the accompanying vehicle and that these were hamas terrorist `` . the drone operator , the idf say , had `` misidentified `` one of the aid worker a a gunman - they thought he wa carrying a gun when he entered one of the car but he wa holding a bag . the idf ha not shown this footage . the car were then targeted . image of the three badly damaged vehicle emerged on social medium and have been analysed by bbc verify to work out where they were struck . they were located along a stretch of road and were 2.5km ( 1.5 mile ) apart , which suggests there wa more than one strike . the idf report confirms this . it say the first vehicle wa struck at 2309 , the second at 2311 and the third at 2313 . the wck head jose andres say those in the convoy had tried to call the idf during the attack . `` they were targeted systemically car by car . they attacked the first car . they were able to move in the second one . again this one wa hit . they were able to move in ( into ) the third one . `` `` it wa a direct hit . they tried to treat some of them and put them in another car in front . but they shelled the car , `` said a local resident , who said he had witnessed the strike . bbc verify pinpointed the location of the strike by matching visual clue in the photo of the vehicle with satellite image of this part of gaza . in one image of a heavily damaged toyota hilux , a well a the tree and fence beside the vehicle , a lone palm tree stand in a walled enclosure with a distinctive pattern of building surrounding it . using satellite image , these feature have been matched with a part of al-rashid road - which run along the coast in central gaza . a second vehicle wa pictured with a wck logo on it roof and a large hole in it . a pylon , a section of woodland , a low wall and two distinct roof can be seen in the background . bbc verify matched the scene to about 800m south of the first vehicle . a third damaged vehicle wa photographed in an area of open ground to the south , about 100m off the road.the wck say this third car wa a `` soft-skin vehicle `` - meaning not armoured . it wa about 1.6km south of the second vehicle and 2.5km of the first . the idf say drone-fired missile were used in the attack . this confirms the initial analysis from military expert who we sent image of the vehicle to on 2 april . chris cobb-smith , a former british army officer and ex-un weapon inspector , told u the attack wa probably the result of drone-launched spike missile . spike missile are a type of powerful weapon , usually launched against tank and other armoured vehicle . justin crump , a former british army officer who run sibylline - a risk intelligence company - agreed that the attack `` wa likely drone-launched and targeted `` . the idf said that the wck logo - on top of one of the vehicle - wa not visible at night to the drone operator . footage shown at the idf briefing appeared to confirm this , according to a bbc journalist who attended it . `` the nature of the logo and marking visible on the vehicle , while colourful and suitable for daytime recognition , would appear to stand out much less obviously at night depending on the exact nature of the system used `` , mr crump told u . wck had already shared the coordinate and journey detail of the aid convoy with the israeli military . the seven aid worker killed were named by wck a : image of the aid worker ' body were first posted on social medium just before 22:30 bst on 1 april . graphic video showed the body of five individual . two more body were recovered from deir al-balah later on , the palestine red crescent society said on x . wck logo were visible on bulletproof vest on at least three of the deceased . video also showed colleague from wck identifying the body . `` these are the people who brought the aid from the sea , `` one said , before cry out a he recognised a palestinian aid worker killed . additional reporting by merlyn thomas , osob elmi and joshua cheetham . this article , originally published on 2 april , ha been updated to reflect the finding of the idf investigation . we have asked the idf to release it drone footage of the incident . what do you want bbc verify to investigate ?

take concrete step to prevent civilian harm and ensure safety for aid worker or u policy in respect of gaza would change . this wa a significant shift in u policy - the first time that washington ha attempted to leverage american aid in order to influence the conduct of the war in gaza . seven people working for the food aid charity world central kitchen ( wck ) were killed in an israeli strike in gaza on monday . the wck convoy they were travelling in wa hit by an israeli air strike a it travelled south along the israeli-designated coastal aid route , just after they had unloaded more than 100 tonne of food from a barge at a warehouse in deir al-balah . the vehicle were around 2.5km ( 1.5 mile ) apart and all three were hit during the attack . israel 's military apologised and called the attack a tragic mistake . it ha promised a full investigation . the u national security council said it welcomed the step announced by israel , which it said `` must now be fully and rapidly implemented `` . u policy , it added , would be determined by the step israel took to protect `` innocent civilian and the safety of aid worker `` . on thursday , u secretary of state antony blinken said there would be a change of u policy if it did not see change from israel . the move to open israel 's northern border crossing with gaza in erez is particularly significant , after israel 's foreign minister eli cohen told israeli medium in november that there would be `` no more contact between israel and gaza `` . in another development , former u president donald trump said israel should get it war in gaza `` over with `` in order to achieve peace and `` stop killing people `` . mr trump - a staunch ally of israel - made the comment in a radio interview . he said that israel wa `` absolutely losing the pr war `` and should stop broadcasting video footage of it air strike in gaza . but he added that israel had to finish what it had started . mr trump , who is expected to be the republican party 's candidate in november 's presidential election , ha previously criticised joe biden for being insufficiently supportive of israel . mr netanyahu ha faced rising international and domestic anger at israel 's conduct in gaza . a long line of lorry filled with aid ha been backing up on the egyptian side of the border with rafah for month a they can only enter gaza after a complex and bureaucratic series of israeli check . the absence of adequate humanitarian supply ha forced jordan , the u and uk to drop aid from the air - the least effective way to deliver humanitarian supply . air drop have also proved dangerous - palestinian have been crushed when parachute fail and have drowned a they try to swim to pallet that have landed in the sea . a recent un-backed report offered evidence that the humanitarian catastrophe in gaza wa turning into a man-made famine . and the un 's most senior human right official , volker türk , recently told the bbc that there wa a `` plausible `` case that israel wa using starvation a a weapon of war in gaza . israel denies impeding the entry of aid or it distribution inside gaza , and blame un agency on the ground for failing to get the aid that is allowed in to the people who need it . more than 196 aid worker have been killed in gaza since october , according to the us-funded aid worker security database , which record major incident of violence against aid personnel . not all were killed while delivering aid . on thursday gps wa blocked across swathe of israel in order to disrupt missile and drone , a tension rose with iran . reservist have been called up to bolster air defence unit and the israel defense force also announced it wa halting all leave for soldier serving with combat unit . iran ha vowed to respond after a strike it belief israel carried out on it consulate building in syria on monday killed 13 people , including a senior general . much of the gaza strip ha been devastated during the israeli military operation that began after hamas-led gunman attacked southern israel on 7 october , killing about 1,200 people and seizing 253 hostage . more than 33,000 people have been killed in gaza since then , the territory 's hamas-run health ministry say .

sometimes misnamed district . this made them confusing to gazans seeking safety . expert say such mistake could violate israel 's international law obligation . the israel defense force ( idf ) ha rejected any assertion the warning were confusing or contradictory . in a statement , it said the alert analysed by the bbc were only one element of it `` extensive effort to encourage the evacuation
