circumstance do not permit . israel say it warning system is designed to help civilian flee danger a it continues it war against hamas . the system divide a map of gaza into hundred of numbered block . israel ha produced an interactive online map of the block that geo-locates user , showing their live location and which block number they are in . this idf post from late january show a social medium post on x with a link through via qr code to the master block map . but people we spoke to have described struggling to get online to access the system , a well a finding the block system difficult to understand , notwithstanding the error . the bbc analysed the idf 's arabic language social medium channel on facebook , x and telegram , where we found hundred of post containing warning . the same warning were often posted repeatedly . we also searched for leafleted warning which had been photographed and shared online . the idf say it ha dropped 16 million such leaflet over gaza . we have focused our analysis on warning issued since 1 december , which is when the idf launched it block system a a way of providing more precise instruction than previously , after coming under international pressure . we grouped all of the idf 's post and leaflet that we found after this date into 26 separate warning . the vast majority made reference to the master block system . the idf told the bbc it also warned of impending attack through pre-recorded phone message and live phone call . due to damage to gaza 's phone network we have not been able to compile data on these phone call . and our analysis of leaflet wa limited to those we could find photographed and shared online . the 26 separate warning we found contained specific information from the idf that people could use to escape area of danger . but 17 of them also contained error and inconsistency . these included : in addition , one warning listed neighbourhood a being in one district when they were actually in another . another mixed up the block number of two neighbourhood . and in a third , some block listed in the text were on the opposite side of gaza to those highlighted on the accompanying map . when we put these error to the idf , it did not respond to the issue we raised with the map specifically but said the text of post had been sufficiently clear . it also said that when arrow were used to direct people to safety , `` it is obvious that the arrow point to a general direction `` and reiterated that the key information had been provided in the text . these inaccuracy and error may violate israel 's obligation under international law to provide `` effective advanced warning `` , say janina dill , co-director of the oxford institute of ethic , law and armed conflict . if the majority of warning contain error or are unclear to the point that civilian ca n't understand them then , she say , `` these warning do not fulfil the proper function they have under international humanitarian law `` . this , add kubo macak professor of international law at the university of exeter , undermines their function to give `` civilian the chance to protect themselves `` . in december , saleh , a tech entrepreneur from gaza city , wa sheltering with his child and his in-law in nuseirat in central gaza - where , he say , there wa no electricity or phone signal and long period of internet outage . he saw people killed and others fleeing from a nearby school a it wa being shelled , but say he had not received any idf evacuation detail . eventually , he found someone with a sim card that allowed him to access data network in egypt and israel and came across an evacuation warning on an israeli government facebook page . `` there wa an evacuation order for several residential block - [ but ] we did n't know which block we lived in . this led to a big argument , `` salah say . salah could only access the internet intermittently , but he messaged his wife amani , who ha been in the uk since just before the war . she wa able to go online and access the idf 's master block map and pinpoint where her husband wa . but then , looking back at the specific evacuation warning on facebook , the couple realised the numbered block where salah wa staying wa shown cut in two - adding to the family 's confusion . eventually , salah decided to leave with the child . but some of his family stayed put - until fighting escalated further . when the bbc analysed the facebook evacuation warning salah had been trying to decipher , we found further point of confusion . in text , the post urged people to leave block 2220 , 2221 , 2222 , 2223 , 2224 and 2225 - all block that appear in the idf 's online master map . but in the accompanying map , the six numbered block had been lumped into one , and mislabelled a block 2220 . despite these inconsistency , israel presented it block warning system at the international court of justice in january a part of it defence against allegation by south africa that it is committing genocide . israel 's lawyer argued that it wa doing it utmost to protect civilian and had `` developed a detailed map so that specific area can be temporarily evacuated , instead of evacuating entire area `` . they presented one social medium warning in court a evidence - but the bbc ha found two error in it . block 55 and 99 were listed in the text of the post from 13 december but they were not shaded on the map . the idf told the bbc that when a block number is explicitly mentioned in text , the warning is sufficiently clear . israel 's lawyer also claimed that the idf , via it arabic twitter account , wa providing information on the location of shelter close to area being evacuated . but in all of the post and leaflet we analysed we did not see any warning providing name or exact location of shelter . bbc analysis ha also found the idf 's block system overall wa used inconsistently . nine of the 26 warning listed a mix of block number and neighbourhood name . another nine did n't mention block number at all . despite linking through to the online master map , they instead listed neighbourhood by name - which often sprawled over many numbered block . the bbc could not find a way to determine the exact block of these neighbourhood . the abdu family , which includes 32 people , also fled gaza city to central gaza early in the war . then , in december , they received a warning leaflet dropped from a plane . message on the family whatsapp group , which the bbc ha seen , chart their confusion a they argued for two day over what the leaflet meant . it contained a list of neighbourhood to evacuate , but the family could n't locate most of these place . the warning asked people to leave `` al-bureij camp and the neighbourhood of badr , the north coast , al-nuzha , al-zahra , al-buraq , al-rawda , and al-safa in the area south of wadi gaza . `` we located an al-zahra and a badr close by , but they are north of the wadi gaza riverbed . we could not find the neighbourhood of al-rawda or al-nuzha in the `` area south of wadi gaza `` . the abdu family struggled to decide what to do . should they stay and risk getting caught up in a fierce ground battle - or leave , and abandon the only shelter they might find ? some followed the warning to go to `` shelter in deir al-balah `` . but when they arrived they felt unsafe and decided to return . if they were going to die they would die together , they told u . satellite data on destruction in gaza - analysed by jamon van den hoek at oregon state university and corey scher of city university new york graduate center - show that the area of deir al-balah that the family fled to came under more intense attack during this period than the area that they had left . the idf told u it had cross-checked `` data regarding civilian presence and movement that followed these warning `` and that many people did receive and follow them . it said that warning had `` saved countless civilian life in the gaza strip `` .

Body Text: western government are coming under growing pressure to halt arm sale to israel over how it is waging the war against hamas in the gaza strip . israel is a major weapon exporter , but it military ha been heavily reliant on imported aircraft , guided bomb and missile to conduct what expert have described a one of the most intense and destructive aerial campaign in recent history . campaign group and some politician among israel 's western ally say arm export should be suspended because , they say , israel is failing to do enough to protect the life of civilian and ensure enough humanitarian aid reach them . on friday , the un human right council backed a weapon ban , with 28 country voting in favour , six against and 13 abstention . the u and germany - which account for the vast majority of israel 's arm import - both voted against . germany said it did so because the resolution did not explicitly condemn hamas . the war wa triggered by hamas 's attack on israel on 7 october , which killed about 1,200 people , mainly civilian , according israeli tally . more than 33,000 people have been killed in gaza , 70 % of them child and woman , the hamas-run health ministry say . israel insists that it force are working to avoid civilian casualty , accuses hamas of deliberately putting civilian in the line of fire and ha said there are no limit on aid delivery . the u is by far the biggest supplier of arm to israel , having helped it build one of the most technologically sophisticated military in the world . according to the stockholm international peace research institute ( sipri ) , the u accounted for 69 % of israel 's import of major conventional arm between 2019 and 2023 . the u provides israel with $ 3.8bn ( â£3bn ) in annual military aid under a 10-year agreement that is intended to allow it ally to maintain what it call a `` qualitative military edge `` over neighbouring country . israel ha used the grant to finance order of f-35 joint strike fighter , a stealth aircraft considered the most advanced ever made . it ha so far ordered 75 and taken delivery of more than 30 of the aircraft . it wa the first country other than the u to receive an f-35 and the first to use one in combat . part of the aid - $ 500m annually - is set aside to fund missile defence programme , including the jointly developed iron dome , arrow and david 's sling system . israel ha relied on them during the war to defend itself against rocket , missile and drone attack by palestinian armed group in gaza , a well a other iran-backed armed group based in lebanon , syria , iraq and yemen . in the day after hamas 's 7 october attack , president joe biden said the u wa `` surging additional military assistance `` to israel . since the start of the war , only two u military sale to israel have been made public after receiving emergency approval - one for 14,000 round of tank ammunition worth $ 106m and the other for $ 147m of component to make 155mm artillery shell . but u medium report that president joe biden 's administration ha also quietly made more than 100 military sale to israel , most falling below the dollar amount that would require congress to be formally notified . they are said to include thousand of precision-guided munition , small-diameter bomb , bunker buster and small arm . however , sipri 's report say that despite the delivery , the total volume of israeli arm import from the u in 2023 wa almost the same a in 2022 . one deal that is large enough to require congressional notification is the $ 18bn sale of up to 50 f-15 fighter jet , news about which emerged this week . congress ha not yet approved the deal . even though the aircraft would need to be built from scratch and would not be delivered immediately , the sale is expected to be hotly debated by mr biden 's democratic party , many of whose representative in congress and supporter are increasingly concerned by israel 's action in gaza . senator elizabeth warren ha said she is prepared to block the deal and ha accused israel of `` indiscriminate bombing `` in gaza . germany is the next biggest arm exporter to israel , accounting for 30 % of import between 2019 and 2023 , according to sipri . in 2023 , the european nation 's weapon sale to israel were worth â_x0082_¬326.5m ( $ 351m ; â£280m ) - a 10-fold increase compared with 2022 - with the majority of those export licence granted after the 7 october attack . the german government said in january that the sale comprised â_x0082_¬306.4m worth of military equipment and â_x0082_¬20.1m of `` war weapon `` . according to the dpa news agency , the latter included 3,000 portable anti-tank weapon and 500,000 round of ammunition for automatic or semi-automatic firearm . it also said that most of the export licence were granted for land vehicle and technology for the development , assembly , maintenance and repair of weapon . chancellor olaf scholz ha been a staunch supporter of israel 's right to self-defence throughout the war and , although his tone on israeli action in gaza ha shifted in recent week and there ha been some debate in germany , the arm sale do not appear to be at risk of suspension . italy is the third-biggest arm exporter to israel , but it accounted for only 0.9 % of israeli import between 2019 and 2023 . they have reportedly included helicopter and naval artillery . sale of `` arm and munition `` amounted to â_x0082_¬13.7m ( $ 14.8m ; â£11.7m ) last year , the magazine altreconomia cited national statistic bureau istat a saying . some â_x0082_¬2.1m of export were approved between october and december , despite the government 's assurance that it wa blocking them under a law which ban weapon sale to country that are waging war or are deemed to be violating human right . defence minister guido crosetto told parliament last month that italy had honoured existing contract after checking them on a case-by-case basis and ensuring `` they did not concern material that could be used against civilian `` . the uk 's export of military good to israel are `` relatively small `` , according to the uk government , amounting to only â£42m ( $ 53m ) in 2022 . the campaign against arm trade ( caat ) say that since 2008 , the uk ha granted arm export licence to israel worth â£574m ( $ 727m ) in total . much of those are for component used in us-made warplane that end up in israel . but the british government is coming under growing pressure to suspend even those export . prime minister rishi sunak ha said the uk ha a `` very careful export licensing regime `` and said israel must `` act in accordance with international humanitarian law `` . the uk government is also preparing an assessment that will advise on the risk of israel breaching international law in it action from early 2024 . but a senior government source told the bbc that an arm embargo on israel wa `` not going to happen `` . the government of canada , whose arm sale to israel were worth 21.3m canadian dollar ( $ 15.7m ; â£12.4m ) in 2022 , said in january that it had suspended approving new exit permit for weapon until it could ensure they were being used in accordance with canadian law . however , pre-existing permit remained valid . israel ha also built up it own defence industry with u help and now rank a the ninth-largest arm exporter in the world , with a focus on advanced technological product rather than large-scale hardware . it held a 2.3 % share of global sale between 2019 and 2023 , according to sipri , with india ( 37 % ) , the philippine ( 12 % ) and the u ( 8.7 % ) the three main recipient . the sale were worth $ 12.5bn ( â£9.9bn ) in 2022 , according to the israeli defence ministry . unmanned aerial vehicle ( uavs ) made up 25 % of those export , followed by missile , rocket and air defence system ( 19 % ) and radar and electronic warfare system ( 13 % ) , the ministry said . in september , just before the war began , germany agreed a $ 3.5bn deal with israel to buy the sophisticated arrow 3 missile defence system , which intercept long-range ballistic missile . the deal - israel 's largest-ever - had to be approved by the u because it jointly developed the system . israel is also home to a vast u arm depot set up in 1984 to pre-position supply for it troop in case of a regional conflict , a well a to give israel quick access to weapon in emergency . the pentagon shipped about 300,000 155mm artillery shell from the war reserve stockpile ammunition-israel to ukraine following the russian invasion . stockpiled munition at the depot have also reportedly been supplied to israel since the start of the gaza war .

2019 and 2023 , according to sipri . in 2023 , the european nation 's weapon sale to israel were worth € 326.5m ( $ 351m ; £ 280m ) - a 10-fold increase compared with 2022 - with the majority of those export licence granted after the 7 october attack . the german government said in january that the sale comprised € 306.4m worth of military equipment and € 20.1m of `` war weapon `` . according to the dpa news agency , the latter included 3,000 portable anti-tank weapon and 500,000 round of ammunition for automatic or semi-automatic firearm . it also said that most of the export licence were granted for land vehicle and technology for the development , assembly , maintenance and repair of weapon . chancellor olaf scholz ha been a staunch supporter of israel 's right to self-defence throughout the war and , although his tone on israeli action in gaza ha shifted in recent week and there ha been some debate in germany , the arm sale do not appear to be at risk of suspension . italy is the third-biggest arm exporter to israel , but it accounted for only 0.9 % of israeli import between 2019 and 2023 . they have reportedly included helicopter and naval artillery . sale of `` arm and munition `` amounted to € 13.7m ( $ 14.8m ; £ 11.7m ) last year , the magazine altreconomia cited national statistic bureau istat a saying . some € 2.1m of export were approved between october and december , despite the government 's assurance that it wa blocking them under a law which ban weapon sale to country that are waging war or are deemed to be violating human right . defence minister guido crosetto told parliament last month that italy had honoured existing contract after checking them on a case-by-case basis and ensuring `` they did not concern material that could be used against civilian `` . the uk 's export of military good to israel are `` relatively small `` , according to the uk government , amounting to only £ 42m ( $ 53m ) in 2022 . the campaign against arm trade ( caat ) say that since 2008 , the uk ha granted arm export licence to israel worth £ 574m ( $ 727m ) in total . much of those are for component used in us-made warplane that end up in israel . but the british government is coming under growing pressure to suspend even those export . prime minister rishi sunak ha said the uk ha a `` very careful export licensing regime `` and said israel must `` act in accordance with international humanitarian law `` . the uk government is also preparing an assessment that will advise on the risk of israel breaching international law in it action from early 2024 . but a senior government source told the bbc that an arm embargo on israel wa `` not going to happen `` . the government of canada , whose arm sale to israel were worth 21.3m canadian dollar ( $ 15.7m ; £ 12.4m ) in 2022 , said in january that it had suspended approving new exit permit for weapon until it could ensure they were being used in accordance with canadian law . however , pre-existing permit remained valid . israel ha also built up it own defence industry with u help and now rank a the ninth-largest arm exporter in the world , with a focus on advanced technological product rather than large-scale hardware . it held a 2.3 % share of global sale between 2019 and 2023 , according to sipri , with india ( 37 % ) , the philippine ( 12 % ) and the u ( 8.7 % ) the three main recipient . the sale were worth $ 12.5bn ( £ 9.9bn ) in 2022 , according to the israeli defence ministry . unmanned aerial vehicle ( uavs ) made up 25 % of those export , followed by missile , rocket and air defence system ( 19 % ) and radar and electronic warfare system ( 13 % ) , the ministry said . in september , just before the war began , germany agreed a $ 3.5bn deal with israel to buy the sophisticated arrow 3 missile defence system , which intercept long-range ballistic missile . the deal - israel 's largest-ever - had to be approved by the u because it jointly developed the system . israel is also home to a vast u arm depot set up in 1984 to pre-position supply for it troop in case of a regional conflict , a well a to give israel quick access to weapon in emergency . the pentagon shipped about 300,000 155mm artillery shell from the war reserve stockpile ammunition-israel to ukraine following the russian invasion . stockpiled munition at the depot have also reportedly been supplied to israel since the start of the gaza war .

Body Text: late on thursday night , the israel defense force ( idf ) convened a meeting for a group of international journalist at the defence ministry building in tel aviv . the idf then set out for u the result of their initial inquiry into the killing of seven aid worker in gaza . retired maj gen yoav har-even described how the idf 's drone operator mistook an aid worker carrying a bag for a gunman , and then targeted one of the world central kitchen vehicle with a missile . the idf then described how two people escaped that vehicle and got into a second car , which wa hit by another missile from a drone . the military confirmed that there were survivor from the second explosion , who managed to get into the third vehicle - which wa then also hit by a missile . by the end , all the aid worker were dead . the idf 's investigation concluded that the army unit involved had believed the vehicle they were tracking from the sky had been taken over by hamas gunman , and that they were not aware of the coordination procedure put in place between the military and world central kitchen for that evening . it also said they also did not know the car belonged to the charity , and the three air strike were in violation of the army 's own procedure . the evidence from the investigation ha been passed to the military advocate general - the israeli army 's top legal authority - to determine if there ha been any criminal conduct . in addition , the army ha sacked the major in charge of fire support . the brigade 's chief of staff , a colonel , ha also been sacked . the divisional commander , brigade commander and the general in charge of the idf 's southern command have been formally reprimanded . the idf sought to explain the context leading up to the fatal event of that evening . the aid worker had been overseeing the distribution of food aid that had arrived on a ship from cyprus and unloaded at a recently constructed jetty in the northern gaza strip . under coordination with the idf , the world central kitchen team were transferring these supply to a warehouse a few kilometre further south . during this process , the idf say their drone operator spotted a gunman riding on the roof of a large aid lorry that wa being escorted by the wck team . they played those of u at the briefing a somewhat blurry video - which ha not been released to the public - showing a figure holding a gun , on top of the lorry . at one point the gun is fired , showing up clearly on the slowed-down black and white footage . at this stage the military contact world central kitchen but they are in turn unable to reach the team on the ground - where phone communication is patchy and aid agency say they are prohibited by the idf from using radio . the drone footage also appears to confirm that at night , the sticker on the roof of the world central kitchen vehicle , with the charity 's logo , are not visible to the drone operator . the military then track the convoy , including the aid lorry , to a warehouse . then the convoy split - the aid lorry remains in the warehouse and four suv-type car emerge . one of those vehicle head north , and is then shown to contain gunman , with weapon clearly visible from the drone footage , a they emerge next to another aid warehouse . the idf say that these gunman were not targeted , because of their proximity to an aid facility . meanwhile , three remaining vehicle belonging to world central kitchen begin to head south . the drone team , the army say , now working under the assumption that they are dealing with hamas militant and not an aid convoy , had misidentified one of the aid worker a a gunman , and claimed to have seen them enter one of the three wck car . no footage of this moment wa provided , but the military investigation concluded that it wa a `` misclassification . . . they saw that it 's a rifle but at the end of the day it wa a bag `` . under the mistaken belief that one vehicle now contained a gunman , authorisation to fire a missile is sought , and granted by superior officer . at 23:09 the first vehicle is struck , two minute later the second , and at 23:13 the third final , fatal strike is launched . the military 's conclusion are that three major failing occurred :

Body Text: two senior israeli military officer have been sacked after seven aid worker were killed in missile strike in the gaza strip . the israel defense force ( idf ) called the killing of staff from world central kitchen ( wck ) a `` grave accident `` . drone operator did not follow rule and thought wck 's car were carrying hamas gunman , it inquiry say . wck called the idf 's apology `` cold comfort `` for the aid worker ' family and urged an independent investigation . the idf launched an internal investigation into the death after coming under intense international pressure to explain the circumstance . it finding were published on friday alongside an admission of `` serious failure `` and the announcement that an idf colonel and major were being dismissed a a result . three commander have been formally reprimanded for their overall responsibility in the strike , which the idf said were carried out in breach of army rule . the idf said those who carried out the attack could also face criminal prosecution . in the space of four minute on 1 april , seven people working for wck were killed when three missile destroyed their car one by one . the charity 's team had been authorised by the israeli military to help transfer aid supply from the coast to a warehouse , but a series of mistake and miscommunications on the part of the idf made them a target . in a briefing for journalist on how the incident played out , the idf said it drone operator identified what appeared to be a gunman on top of one of the aid truck being escorted by wck . after the aid convoy reached it warehouse destination , a car carrying what the idf said were gunman headed north , while the wck aid worker began driving south in vehicle marked with the charity 's logo . the investigation found those marking were not visible at night , and attempt to contact the aid worker failed . after a drone operator mistook a bag being held by an aid worker for a gun , the military unit began targeting it with missile strike . the idf 's internal investigation also found : the unit involved in the attack ha been suspended from duty and evidence ha been passed on to the military advocate general , the israeli army 's top legal authority , the idf said . in response , world central kitchen said the idf had taken `` important step forward `` by disciplining those involved in the attack but called for an independent investigation . a statement read : `` it is also clear from their preliminary investigation that the idf ha deployed deadly force without regard to it own protocol , chain of command and rule of engagement . `` we demand the creation of an independent commission to investigate the killing of our wck colleague . the idf can not credibly investigate it own failure in gaza . `` u secretary of state antony blinken said washington wa carefully reviewing the inquiry and would assess what step israel wa taking `` to ensure that something like this can never happen again `` . poland 's deputy foreign minister andrzej szejna demanded a criminal inquiry . one of the seven aid worker killed wa a polish national . the death have contributed to growing international anger at how israel is conducting the war , which ha led to call for country to stop supplying israel with weapon in recent day . on thursday , u president joe biden told israeli prime minister benjamin netanyahu that washington 's ongoing support wa contingent on more aid being allowed into gaza and additional measure being introduced to protect aid worker . israel later said it had approved the opening of two route into gaza for humanitarian delivery . it is not clear when these would be opened or under what condition . the erez gate in northern gaza will be reopened for the first time since the start of the war , and the israeli container port of ashdod - which is close to gaza - will accept humanitarian supply . more aid from jordan will also be allowed to enter via the kerem shalom crossing . there are serious concern about the welfare of gazans after aid organisation suspended their operation in the wake of monday 's attack . the united nation ( un ) ha warned an estimated 1.1 million people - half the population - are facing catastrophic hunger because of israeli restriction on aid delivery , the ongoing hostility and the breakdown of order . un secretary general antonio guterres said 196 aid worker had died since the conflict began and called for a `` meaningful increase `` in the amount of supply allowed into gaza . meanwhile , the head of hezbollah in lebanon - which is closely allied with iran - said tehran would soon respond to an air strike on it diplomatic compound in syria , which killed a senior general . israel is widely believed to be behind the strike . israel ha taken step to prepare for a potential iranian response , including blocking gps in much of the country in an effort to hinder guided missile and drone . on friday , hezbollah 's leader hassan nasrallah said : `` the iranian response is coming without a doubt . `` much of the gaza strip ha been devastated during the israeli military operation that began after hamas gunman attacked southern israel on 7 october , killing about 1,200 people and seizing 253 hostage . more than 33,091 people have been killed in gaza since then , the hamas-run health ministry say .

Body Text: a woman accused of supporting hamas in a speech given at a protest in brighton ha denied the offence at a court hearing.hanin barghouthi , of hove , is charged under the terrorism act with a single count of expressing an `` opinion or belief `` in support of a banned organisation.hamas is proscribed a a terrorist organisation by the uk government.the 22-year-old replied “ not guilty your honour ” when the charge wa put to her during a hearing at kingston crown court . the alleged offence relates to a four-minute speech that wa allegedly “ supportive of the action of hamas ” , a previous hearing at westminster magistrate ’ court heard.ms barghouthi , a student union woman ’ s officer , is accused of making the speech on 8 october , a day after hamas fighter entered israel.judge peter lodder kc granted m barghouthi , of eaton grove , hove , conditional bail until her trial begin on 10 june.under the bail condition , she is banned from obtaining international travel document or using a mobile phone not authorised by police unless in an emergency , and she must also live and sleep at her address each night.judge lodder said : “ if you break your condition or if you fail to attend court a required you will be committing an offence . ” follow bbc sussex on facebook , on x , and on instagram . send your story idea to southeasttoday @ bbc.co.uk or whatsapp u on 08081 002250 .

Body Text: the sudden decision by mcdonald 's to take over ownership of it branch in israel ha thrust the franchise company alonyal and it chief executive omri padan into the spotlight . mcdonald 's will buy back all of it israeli restaurant after global sale slumped due to a boycott of the brand over it perceived support for israel in it war against hamas in gaza . the fast-food giant us a franchise system which mean that individual operator are licensed to run outlet and employ staff . but the broader company came in for criticism after mr padan offered free meal to israeli force around the start of the israel-gaza war on 7 october . a boycott wa sparked after muslim-majority country such a kuwait , malaysia and pakistan issued statement distancing themselves from the firm for what they saw a support of israel . mr padan , however , is not new to controversy related to the israeli-palestinian conflict . in the 30 year the businessman ha been operating restaurant for mcdonald 's in israel , he ha been at the centre of a number of dispute . in 2013 , the israeli businessman angered israel 's settler movement when he refused call to open a branch of the fast-food chain in the settlement of ariel in the occupied west bank . mr padan 's company alonyal wa asked to set up a restaurant in a shopping centre but declined , saying the firm had a policy of staying out of the occupied territory . at the time , the firm said the decision had not been co-ordinated with mcdonald 's headquarters in the u . israel ha built about 160 settlement housing some 700,000 jew since it occupied the west bank and east jerusalem - land the palestinian want a part of a future state - in the 1967 middle east war . the vast majority of the international community considers the settlement illegal under international law , although israel dispute this . mr padan is one of the founder of the group peace now , which opposes all settlement and view them a obstacle to peace . peace now say he is no longer a member of the group , which wa founded in 1978 . a leader of the yesha council , the settler ' umbrella organisation , said at the time that mcdonald 's had gone from being a for-profit company to one with an `` anti-israeli political agenda `` . alonyal 's decision resurfaced in 2019 when mcdonald 's won a tender to run a restaurant and hot dog stand at israel 's ben-gurion airport . in response , several letter of protest were sent by settlement leader in the west bank that called on the finance and transportation ministry , a well a the israel airport authority , to block the move . protest were also held outside the fast-food chain 's restaurant in tel aviv . and on thursday , it wa abruptly announced that alonyal would sell the sprawling franchise back to the u food giant . the term of the deal were not disclosed by mcdonald 's , although a reputation management expert , who ha worked on behalf a number of large company but did not want to speak on the record , said that those outraged by the decision to offer free meal to israeli force may be `` angry that this deal make mr padan possibly a very rich man `` . they might be pleased though , about the effect the boycott ha had . mr padan 's departure come after mcdonald 's said that the israel-gaza conflict had `` meaningfully impacted `` performance in some overseas market in the fourth quarter of 2023 . for the unit that includes the middle east , china and india , sale growth stood at 0.7 % in the fourth quarter of 2023 - far below market expectation . at the start of the year , mcdonald 's chief executive chris kempczinski blamed the backlash on `` misinformation `` . the boycott wa also described a `` disheartening and ill-founded `` by the firm , which relies on thousand of independent business to own and operate most of it more than 40,000 store around the world . about 5 % are located in the middle east . the brand management expert said : `` i get it . they are buying back the franchise to regain control but i 'm not sure they have . `` they also questioned where the company might draw a line : `` doe this mean [ mcdonald 's ] will now need to act and offer deal in other area where reputational damage ha been caused ? `` on thursday , mcdonald 's said that it `` remains committed to the israeli market and to ensuring a positive employee and customer experience in the market going forward . `` it also thanked alonyal for building the brand in israel , while mr padan said : `` we are encouraged by what the future hold . `` bbc news did not receive further comment from mr padan or alonyal through mcdonald 's .

jihad terrorist organisation , wa rescued overnight from khan yunis and returned to israeli territory . `` they said his remains were located using `` precise `` intelligence . he wa buried in the khan younis refugee camp , at a site used by `` terror operative `` , a time of israel report said . information about the grave wa obtained about a week ago and confirmed on friday evening . hour six-day ceasefire at the end of november . his father , avraham , wa murdered in the kibbutz , the idf and isa said . mr katzir 's sister , carmit palty katzir , blamed israeli authority for her brother 's death in a post on social medium , saying he would have returned alive had they agreed a new truce deal . `` our leadership is cowardly and driven by political consideration , which is why Body Text: six month after the hamas attack on israel , war , disease , starvation and death ravage palestinian in gaza . israel is deeply divided , a it prime minister struggle to keep his promise of total victory . the united state , israel 's most essential ally , ha turned against the way it is fighting the war . with iran vowing vengeance for israel 's assassination of a leading iranian general in syria , and month of cross-border conflict with iran 's ally hezbollah in lebanon , the risk of an all-out middle east war are increasing . the statistic record the horror of the past six month . more than 33,000 gazans , a majority of whom were civilian , have been killed , according to the health ministry . according to save the child , 13,800 palestinian child in gaza have been subjected to sexual violence `` including rape , sexualised torture , cruel , inhuman and degrading treatment `` . it said there were `` reasonable ground `` to believe that the violence against hostage wa continuing . kibbutz nir oz is right on israel 's border with gaza . it feel like a time capsule still stuck in the horror of 7 october 2023 . just after first light on that morning , hamas broke through the wire . by the time the israeli army arrived in the early afternoon , a quarter of the 400 or so israeli who lived there had either been killed by hamas or taken hostage . ron bahat showed me around . he is a man in his 50 who grew up at nir oz . ron survived with his family through good luck and arm strong enough to hold shut the door of the safe room when hamas entered his house . we walked along the neat line of small house , with garden that are now overgrown . many had bullet hole or were burnt out and had not been disturbed since the body of the dead were recovered . ron pointed out the home of friend and neighbour who were killed or taken a captive to gaza . in one badly damaged house , a pile of neatly ironed child 's clothes had somehow survived the fire . the family who lived there did not . one grim irony is that nir oz is part of a left-wing movement whose member traditionally support the idea of peace with the palestinian . six month after hamas crossed into nir oz , ron is not ready to make any concession to gaza . `` look , i wish that there will be a leader to bring some prosperity there , because in the end we must have peace . but anyone who support hamas is an enemy . the moment they leave their weapon , the war will stop . the moment that israel leaf it weapon , we will not exist . that 's the difference . `` in nir oz , broken glass still crunch underfoot and gutted house smell of burnt wood and plastic . no-one is there to clean it up . a few of the surviving resident have come back on short visit , but most are staying away , living in hotel in central israel . yamit avital wa back for a few hour , showing around a friend . on that morning in october , she had been staying in tel aviv . her husband wa at home and the ruin of khan younis or gaza city , or the tent of around 1.4 million displaced civilian in rafah , in the way ron bahat showed me nir oz . that 's because international journalist ca n't report from gaza , a israel and egypt , in control of the border , have not allowed them in . the only exception ha been invitation-only , highly supervised trip organised by the israel defense force ( idf ) . i have been on one , to northern gaza in early november . only a month or so into the war , israeli firepower had already reduced the area to a wasteland . evidence is accumulating that both hamas and israel may have committed war crime . the international court of justice ( icj ) in the hague is investigating israel for `` plausible `` allegation of genocide against the palestinian in a case brought by south africa . the icj can not try a case against hamas , which is classified a a terrorist organisation by the u and uk , and many others , a it is not a state . israel reject the charge that it is guilty of genocide . for many of it citizen and supporter it is grotesque and offensive to allege that the state created after nazi germany murdered six million jew in the holocaust is itself committing genocide . one of israel 's lawyer , tal becker , told the justice in court in the hague that `` the appalling suffering of civilian , both israeli and palestinian , is first and foremost the result of hamas ' strategy `` . palestinian see the charge through a different lens , shaped by year of military occupation by israel . many palestinian believe israel ha already created an apartheid state that denies them the most basic right . in jerusalem at easter , a prominent palestinian christian political activist , dimitri diliani , told me that `` killing child is killing child . it doe n't matter who is the child that 's being killed . it doe n't matter who is doing the killing `` . `` i recognise the holocaust , but that doe not mean a green light for israel to commit genocide against my people or any other people . `` the icj 's deliberation will take year and israel 's accuser will have to prove intent to win their case . war and the death of civilian do not add up to genocide on their own . south africa 's legal team argues that statement like the one made by israel 's defence minister yoav gallant on 9 october show genocidal intent . `` i have ordered a complete siege on the gaza strip . there will be no electricity , no food , no fuel , everything is closed , `` he said after visiting the idf southern command in beersheba . `` we are fighting human animal and we are acting accordingly . `` israel wa forced by international pressure , especially from washington , to loosen aspect of the blockade that the minister envisaged . the amount reaching gaza were still grossly inadequate . six month later , gaza is facing imminent famine , according to the integrated food security phase classification ( ipc ) a body backed by government , the un and aid group to provide rigorous and apolitical information and analysis in a food emergency . oxfam report that 300,000 people trapped in the north have lived since january on an average of 245 calorie a day - the equivalent of a tin of bean . gaza 's humanitarian catastrophe ha also been recorded in detail by palestinian journalist , civilian posting on social medium , and the international organisation running the aid operation , whose staff are allowed to enter the territory . seven from the world central kitchen ( wck ) , which had been providing million of meal , were killed by the israeli army on 1 april . their death outraged president biden and other western leader who are staunch ally of israel . their condemnation of the killing left israel even more isolated . israel expects no sympathy from much of the world . but it ha come to expect support and understanding from powerful western ally . instead , they have rejected israel 's claim it doe not impede the movement of relief supply . president biden extracted unusually rapid concession from israel , which promised greater humanitarian access to gaza in a statement rushed out in the middle of the night here in jerusalem . perhaps he threatened to attach condition to the use of american weapon in gaza . the killing of the wck team seems to have been a tipping point for president biden , whose backing for israel ha been a constant throughout his long career in politics . supporting israel is still his firm principle , but the u is no longer prepared to turn that into a safety net for benjamin netanyahu and his extremist coalition partner . palestinian ask , with some anger and frustration , why it took the death of seven aid worker , including six westerner , to make a difference , after so many thousand of gazans had been killed . aid agency operating in gaza say the attack on the aid worker wa not an isolated incident , but the result of an engrained disregard for the life of palestinian civilian . president biden 's outrage might have been a long time coming but it could create a turning point in the war . over the next month or so , one way of assessing change is simply to count whether israel is killing fewer palestinian civilian , or whether increased food and medical aid can save gaza from famine . another test will be whether mr netanyahu defies american opposition and go ahead with a ground assault on rafah , where israel say the remaining organised unit of hamas must be destroyed . the u say that must not happen until israel can find a way to protect the life of almost 1.5 million palestinian who have taken refuge there . benjamin netanyahu ha delivered the `` mighty vengeance `` he promised israeli on 7 october . his other promise , of on , it is no longer considered unpatriotic to protest against the failure to end the war and free the hostage . israel 's division are wide open once more . mr netanyahu face searing accusation that his priority is his own political survival . to stay in power , he must preserve his coalition , which is built around the support of ultranationalist jewish party . they do not only oppose the mass release of palestinian security prisoner to buy the freedom of israeli hostage , without which a ceasefire will not happen . mr netanyahu 's two main ultranationalist ally , finance minister bezalel smotrich and national security minister itamar ben-gvir , go further . they both want palestinian to leave gaza so jew can settle there instead . the prime minister , renowned for his skill in the dark art of politics , is performing a balancing act to keep them happy while denying that mr smotrich and mr ben-gvir 's view reflect government policy . before october , israel 's division must have made it look vulnerable to hamas . six month on , the same schism within israel about the present and the future are making it harder to win the war . capturing or killing yahya sinwar , the hamas leader in gaza and mastermind of the 7 october attack , would give israel a chance to declare victory . but he is still alive , sending his response to proposal in successive round of ceasefire talk from wherever he is hiding . he is thought to be somewhere in the hamas tunnel network , protected by bodyguard and a human shield of israeli hostage . yahya sinwar must be disappointed that palestinian on the west bank , including east jerusalem have not risen up in support of gaza . some must be taking the long view , waiting to see how event unfold in gaza and the wider middle east . others are struggling to feed their family now that thousand of palestinian are no longer allowed to work in israel . some are scared . israel ha launched many deadly raid against armed group in the west bank , killing innocent bystander in the process and arresting thousand who are being held without trial . some palestinian farmer have been driven off their land after violent and sometimes deadly intimidation by extremist jewish settler . opinion poll show strong support among palestinian for the attack on 7 october , though many deny the evidence that hamas committed atrocity . at a noisy demonstration against the israeli in ramallah in the west bank , i asked joharah baker , a palestinian activist , whether the hamas attack had moved the palestinian any closer to independence free . that is what any people under occupation , under oppression , under colonial settler will do . `` according to the leading palestinian pollster , khalil shikaki , even those who dislike hamas and believe they have a palestinian nelson mandela waiting in an israeli jail . he is marwan barghouti , imprisoned since 2002 and serving five life sentence for murder . if he ran for president , the indication are that he would win easily . even though he is a leader of the rival palestinian faction , fatah , hamas put marwan barghouti 's name on the list of prisoner they want released in insisting that israel must be in control - in other word , an occupation . he ha rejected america 's proposal to replace israeli troop with a force from the palestinian authority , which administers part of the west bank . the american want a pa , revitalised , eventually to govern gaza . that would most likely require new leadership . current palestinian president mahmoud abbas is elderly and hugely unpopular . palestinian say he ha failed to fight corruption , failed to show sympathy for gaza , and failed to order the palestinian police to protect them from aggressive jewish settler while he continues security cooperation with israel . benjamin netanyahu ha also rejected joe biden 's idea of a grand bargain that would transform the middle east . in return for allowing palestinian independence , israel would be recognised by saudi arabia , and the saudi would get a nato-style defence agreement with the u . instead , the prime minister tell israeli that he is the only man who can save them from the mortal hazard of a palestinian state imposed by america . that is music for the ultranationalists in his government , who are much keener to keep the west bank and all of jerusalem than make a deal with saudi arabia . away from the conference room where leader discus the future , the war ha created another enormous obstacle to peace . palestinian and israeli have not ] question their humanity . we see similar development , unfortunately , also among palestinian , who see what is happening in gaza . `` and they say those who are targeting woman and child , 's isna news agency . he did not provide further detail a to what shape iran 's response would take . in a statement , israeli defence minister yoav gallant said the defence establishment had completed preparation to respond to any possible scenario . the idf ha halted all leave for soldier serving with combat unit and called up reservist to bolster air defence . israel ha also blocked gps signal across swathe of the country in order to disrupt missile and drone . medium outlet in israel have reported that some of the country 's embassy were evacuated over potential iranian attack . the bbc ha not independently verified those report and israel ha not confirmed them . in an apparent effort to prevent panic , a spokesman for the israeli army said there wa no need for people to buy generator , gather food or withdraw money . syria 's defence ministry said israeli aircraft targeted the iranian consulate building at about 17:00 local time ( 14:00 gmt ) on monday . syrian air defence shot down some of the missile , but others made it through and `` destroyed the entire building , killing and injuring everyone inside `` , the ministry added . iran 's revolutionary guard said that seven of it officer were killed in the strike , including brig-gen mohammad reza zahedi and brig-gen mohammad hadi haji-rahimi . photo and video from the scene showed smoke rising from the remains of the collapsed building . hour after the strike , people in tehran burned israeli and u flag in protest . on the day after the attack , ayatollah khamenei said israel would `` regret this Body Text: israel 's prime minister benjamin netanyahu say he ha set a date for a military offensive into rafah , despite growing warning that it could lead to high civilian casualty . more than a million palestinian are sheltering in the southern city after being forced to flee their home . mr netanyahu 's comment followed call by far-right government ally to step up military action against hamas . the prime minister 's popularity ha plummeted after six month of war . with negotiation with hamas still under way in egypt , mr netanyahu is being pushed to agree a hostage-prisoner swap and ceasefire deal by many israeli - a well a key international ally , including the u . but a discontent grows at home and abroad over how his government ha conducted the war , he is also facing call to ramp up operation against hamas by far-right leader he ha relied on for political support . mr netanyahu 's rule is backed by a coalition that includes far-right , ultranationalist party , some of whom are against the idea of making concession to hamas . they say the war must continue and believe the israeli military should go ahead with plan to launch an incursion into the southern city of rafah , where about 1.5 million palestinian are sheltering in tent and overcrowded camp . those call intensified after the israel defense force ( idf ) announced it wa pulling it troop out of khan younis , the largest city in southern gaza , effectively ending major ground operation in the area . itamar ben gvir , the far-right national security minister , warned mr netanyahu that if he `` decides to end the war without a broad attack on rafah to defeat hamas , he wo n't have a mandate to continue serving a prime minister `` . far-right finance minister bezalel smotrich told the prime minister `` we have to increase the pressure on hamas in gaza , which is the only way to bring back the [ israeli ] hostage and destroy hamas `` . speaking on monday after those intervention , mr netanyahu said : `` today i received a detailed report on the talk in cairo - we are constantly working to achieve our goal , first and foremost the release of all our hostage and achieving a complete victory over hamas . `` this victory requires entry into rafah and the elimination of the terrorist battalion there . it will happen - there is a date . `` the remark may be seen a an attempt to appeal to ally that sustain his coalition , a any offensive is unlikely to be imminent . mr netanyahu did not indicate which date he had decided on . the u is opposed to an assault on rafah , and the israeli government ha also been urged to halt the planned offensive in a joint statement signed by egyptian president abdul fattah al-sisi , french president emmanuel macron and jordan 's king abdullah ii . writing in france 's le monde newspaper , they warned the plan would have `` dangerous consequence `` and `` threaten regional escalation `` , adding : `` the war in gaza and the catastrophic humanitarian suffering it is causing must end now . they also said a recent un security council resolution calling for an immediate ceasefire and the release of all hamas-held hostage must be `` fully implemented without further delay `` . domestically , there have been large protest demanding an agreement to guarantee the release of the hostage . family say mr netanyahu ha not made their release a priority , and that the government 's strategy of putting military pressure on hamas to negotiate ha failed . the relative say time is running out to save the captive who remain alive . with talk involving intermediary in cairo ongoing , israeli defence minister yoav gallant suggested earlier this week that now wa the right time for a deal over hostage . on monday , a senior hamas official told the reuters news agency that israeli proposal had not met it demand , but the group said they would nevertheless be examined . `` there is no change in the position of the occupation [ israel ] and therefore , there is nothing new in the cairo talk , `` the hamas official , who asked not to be identified , said . `` there is no progress yet . `` william burn , the director of the cia , is attending the cairo talk . his presence underline the growing pressure from the u - israel 's main ally - for an agreement . in a separate development , israel reported that 419 aid truck had entered gaza on monday , including 330 truck carrying food - more than double the average 140 food truck a day in march . it follows u pressure on israel to alleviate humanitarian suffering in gaza . on tuesday , u defense secretary lloyd austin told a senate hearing that widespread famine in gaza would `` accelerate violence , and it will have the effect of ensuring that there 's a long-term conflict `` . `` it doe n't have to happen , `` he said , adding : `` we should continue to do everything we can , and we are doing this , to encourage the israeli to provide humanitarian assistance . `` however , an israeli promise to open the erez crossing to northern gaza , where hunger is most acute , ha not yet been carried out and official have not indicated when that could happen . the head of the un agency for palestinian refugee , unrwa , again warned of possible famine , saying far too little aid wa reaching gaza . philippe lazzarini also warned palestinian returning to the devastated city of khan younis about the threat of unexploded munition there following the israeli pullout . he told the bbc there might be thousand of such device in the rubble . some resident who have already gone back said they were unable to locate their home in the ruin . hamas attacked southern israeli border community on 7 october , killing 1,200 people and offensive in gaza since then , the hamas-run health ministry say . gaza is said to be on the brink of famine , with oxfam reporting that 300,000 people trapped in the north have lived since january on an average of 245 calorie a day . israel ha denied impeding the entry of aid or it distribution inside gaza , and ha accused un agency on the ground of failing to get the aid that is allowed in to the people who need it .

Body Text: an all-female group of charity volunteer from birmingham have sent gender-specific product to woman in gaza to help those in the region.the eight woman spent last week in a warehouse in egypt packing and loading about 3,000 hygiene kit on to a lorry , which is due to be driven across the rafah border into gaza.each kit includes five packet of sanitary towel , two tube of toothpaste , a toothbrush , body lotion , hand sanitiser , packet of wet wipe and shampoo.the eight woman have been working with the charity isra-uk . saraya hussain , from birmingham , who led the project , said handwritten message of `` love , peace and hope `` were included.seeing the lorry ready to go wa emotional for many of the volunteer , she said . `` one of the team described it a bittersweet , in that she felt proud that she wa able to do something but it equally felt like it wa so little . `` the product will be beneficial to everyone , including woman , to help them keep clean and give them a little bit of dignity a best a we can . `` m hussain said she had seen report emerging from gaza where woman were `` really suffering with their period `` and using `` old rag `` and `` chopping up old tent `` to cope . `` it 's not nice for anybody to have to do something like that , so here we are , `` she said . the all-female team at isra-uk embarked on a similar deployment to turkey last year following the earthquake in the region . `` what we learnt from that wa that largely in conflict and disaster area , woman 's need , their gender-specific need , are really often overlooked , `` m hussain said.she ha previously told how the group had decided to `` persevere `` with their trip despite the news of an israeli air strike killing seven world central kitchen aid worker on 1 april . m hussain said : `` to lose their life . . . and leave behind multiple family that are mourning and grieving for them in some of the worst circumstance ever is really quite worrying . `` the product Body Text: the israeli troop withdrawal from gaza announced on sunday wa greeted with widespread surprise , even a the israeli army and government have been at pain to stress that it ha no great significance . but to a world that ha watched the intensity of israel 's bombardment , the idea that there wa now just one brigade left in the entire enclave seemed to signify some major shift in the war . and then there wa the timing of the announcement - on the very day that marked the grim milestone of six month since the hamas-led assault on israel ignited this latest and bloodiest phase in the conflict between israel and the palestinian . `` do n't read too much into it , `` a spokesperson for the israeli prime minister 's office told journalist the next day . avi hyman stressed how small the distance involved are and that the israel defense force ( idf ) would therefore continue to be able to take whatever action it deemed necessary , with or without troop stationed inside gaza . a if to prove the point - just hour later , the israeli army said it `` eliminated `` a senior hamas operative , hatem al-ghamri , in an air strike . the israeli medium ha , however , responded very differently . in the widely read and right-wing israel hayom , the paper 's diplomatic correspondent ariel kahana tied the troop withdrawal to pressure on the israeli government to agree a ceasefire deal with hamas in the latest round of talk . `` the formal reason offered by israeli spokesperson for halting the war were operational in nature , but every intelligent person can see that the timing is hardly coincidental . ahead of critical talk , the israeli capitulation wa designed - without saying so explicitly - to signal to hamas that israel wa being very forthcoming with it from it perspective . `` ben caspit in the more centrist maariv newspaper wa even more forceful in his interpretation of the move . `` if you were to ask netanyahu ( and he wa asked ) , this wa done to prepare for the promised operation in rafah … there is a second explanation , one that ha been reported all over the world in every possible language . by that account , the 98th division 's withdrawal from khan yunis is linked to talk for a hostage deal . `` serious medium outlet around the world have reported that the conversation between president biden and prime minister netanyahu wa dramatic . biden led netanyahu to understand that he wa n't a pace away from victory , but a pace away from the final destruction of the alliance between israel and the united state . `` in public at least , mr netanyahu ha continued to ratchet up the rhetoric on rafah , saying that a date ha been set for the operation . his defence minister , yoav gallant , ha been more nuanced , telling army recruit that now is an `` opportune `` time to do a deal with hamas . but he stressed that a ceasefire would not be the end of the war : `` there will be difficult decision and we will be ready to pay the price in order to get the hostage back , and then return to fighting . `` the fighting is likely to continue , a mr gallant say , but the form it take may change substantially . with criticism of the way the war ha been conducted growing from israel 's most powerful ally , the u , the drawing down of force in gaza seems likely in part to be aimed at showing the biden administration that israel is listening to it concern over civilian casualty and life-threatening aid shortage . an end to bombardment that have reduced city to rubble , a ha been seen in the latest image from khan younis , may go some way to restoring the customary whole-hearted support for israel from washington . but that will undoubtedly be tested again , if the `` future operation `` that the israeli army say troop are being given rest and recuperation to prepare for mean a full-scale assault on rafah where israel belief hamas 's remaining military force are now based , among more than a million displaced palestinian . there may be a belief in the israeli government and military that a significant number of that population , squeezed into barely functioning shelter , may start moving back to their home now that the bulk of israeli troop is gone . but what palestinian have found on their return to khan younis is mass devastation , with many of their home reduced to rubble . they have described how gaza 's second city is now unliveable , not even fit for animal , a some have put it . meanwhile , the head of the un agency for palestinian refugee , unrwa , warned palestinian thinking of heading to khan younis about the threat of unexploded munition there following the israeli pullout . philippe lazzarini told the bbc there might be thousand of the device in the rubble . so a major exodus from rafah , which would make any israeli operation against hamas less likely to cause a new catastrophic toll of civilian casualty , may not be on the card . but the `` further operation `` may also relate to the conflict on israel 's northern front with hezbollah in lebanon . that confrontation ha been steadily escalating since 7 october . and there are fear that it could become far more intense , following the suspected israeli strike in damascus that killed several senior commander in iran 's powerful revolutionary guard last week . hezbollah is closely allied to iran and ha matched the rhetoric coming from tehran , vowing revenge . the israeli army ha recently said that it ha substantially strengthened it northern command . so , this too may have played a part in the troop withdrawal from gaza . whatever the true motif were - and they are likely to have involved a number of interlocking factor - it is unlikely that israel 's military engagement in gaza is anywhere close to coming to an end , with hamas fighter already having shown their capacity to regroup in area that had been subjected to the heaviest onslaught from the idf .

Body Text: it is all over in second . the aircraft slows , lift it nose and 12 , perfectly wrapped pallet of humanitarian assistance slide off the open ramp at the back . one minute ago , 10 tonne of food and water wa there , the next it wa floating gently by parachute in the southwesterly breeze , touching down on the northern shore of gaza . it seems so simple and straightforward . yet the delivery of aid by air is anything but simple . and it is far from uncontroversial . this wa the largest coalition airdrop of the war : 14 aircraft from nine nation delivering aid . the scale of the delivery wa timed to mark the end of ramadan . at a military airbase to the east of amman , the capital of jordan , we watched a aircrew from the uk , the u , the netherlands , germany , egypt , indonesia , uae and france were briefed by their jordanian counterpart . they need to know who is doing what and where , the airspace over gaza is small . each country ha it own drop zone , it own way of delivering aid . the whole operation is organised by the jordanian but everything ha to be signed off by the israeli . if the idf say no , then the plane do not take off . the turk were planning to join the coalition today but were vetoed at the last minute . the aid is stacked in vast open hangar : pile of flour , sugar , rice , bean , pulse , oil , and water . the uk ha it own corner where british serviceman and woman - both from the raf and the 47 air despatch squadron of the royal logistics corp - carefully pack their own pallet . everything is carefully weighed - each bundle can not be too light or too heavy . everything is packed deliberately to avoid damage on impact . rope and strap are measured precisely into place . few gift have been so carefully wrapped . the whole thing sits atop a thick slab of plywood . fork-lift truck load the pallet on to a400m , one of the raf 's biggest transport plane - the successor to the much-missed hercules c130s . each container slide along a rolling track on the deck of the plane . repeated check are made to ensure they will not jam . we take off and 40 minute later we are over the drop zone . and here is the next complication . the raf normally drop aid a low a 400ft , but the israeli have stipulated they must do so no lower than 2,000ft . that mean the parachute have a long time to get blown off course by the wind . that is why some airdrop in recent week have landed in the sea . on our flight the pilot warned u they would drop the container over the sea , but the southwesterly breeze would drift them back inshore . which is exactly what happens . job done and we return home . so none of this easy . the potential for error is huge . it is also not a very good way of delivering aid . the raf flight wa carrying about 10 tonne of aid . that is less than a single truck can carry across a border on the ground . so there is huge effort and expense , but marginal impact . the british military know this . but squadron leader lucy playle , the detachment commander in amman , said the cumulative impact wa beginning to tell , with around 1,500 tonne of aid delivered in the past month . `` this is a sustained effort , `` she said . `` we 've been here for three week now , and we are continually delivering aid . `` the people of gaza are very grateful for the effort that we are going to . and we will keep delivering and delivering , until we ca n't give them any more . `` some international aid charity say these flight are for show - to present an illusion that some country are contributing to the humanitarian effort . they say the airdrop are a symbol of the failure to get aid in by other mean , a distraction from that effort . they argue , correctly , that the airdrop will simply not meet the need on the ground . there are also risk . there is no way of organising the distribution on the ground . some gazans have been crushed stampeding for the pallet . others have drowned trying to grab those landing in the sea . some were even injured when container dropped on building . but the aircrew here in jordan insist they are making a difference , that they are filling a gap - not least while there is simply not enough aid getting through by road or sea . warrant officer adrian dibbs said : `` it 's not that much - but it is the effort that count , a in every little help . i am quite proud and privileged to be involved in this sort of a mission . ``

to present an illusion that some country are contributing to the humanitarian effort . they say the airdrop are a symbol of the failure to get aid in by other mean , a distraction from that effort . they argue , correctly , that the airdrop will simply not meet the need on the ground . there are also risk . there is no way of organising the distribution on the ground . some gazans have been crushed stampeding for the pallet . others have drowned trying to grab those landing in the sea . some were even injured when container dropped on building . but the aircrew here in jordan insist they are making a difference , that they are filling a gap - not least while there is simply not enough aid getting through by road or sea . warrant officer adrian dibbs said : `` it 's not that much - but it is the effort that count , a in every little help . i am quite proud and privileged to be involved in this sort of a mission . ``

Body Text: a truce between israel and the palestinian group hamas in gaza wa never going to be easy . week of talk have failed to produce agreement . but international pressure is growing . perhaps the biggest sign is the biden administration sending william burn , the head of the cia , for the latest round of talk in cairo . hamas ha , in public at least , stuck with it initial demand of a permanent ceasefire , the complete withdrawal of israeli troop and the return of displaced palestinian to northern part of the territory without restriction . israeli prime minister benjamin netanyahu meanwhile insists that israel will continue fighting until hamas is destroyed and hostage the group is holding are free . `` there 's a lot more american pressure on israel , and on egypt and qatar to put pressure on hamas . that 's obvious , `` said gershon baskin , who helped negotiate a deal with hamas for the release of israeli soldier gilad shalit in 2011 . `` the fact that the head of the cia showed up , which required all the negotiator to be there at the highest level . that 's indicative of increased american pressure . `` but that doe not mean a deal is at hand . israeli official have indicated willingness to make some concession amid intensifying frustration among the country 's main ally , including the u . earlier this week , the israeli defence minister , yoav gallant , suggested that now wa the right time for a truce . any deal is expected to see the release of some of the hostage captured in the hamas attack in return for palestinian prisoner being held in israeli jail , which wa the basis for a truce that led to a temporary pause in hostility in november . according to israeli authority , 133 people remain captive in gaza , although at least 30 have already been confirmed dead . under the latest u proposal , an initial phase of a six-week ceasefire would see hamas release 40 hostage who are alive , with the priority being given to female captive including soldier , men over the age of 50 and those with serious medical condition . israel would then release at least 700 palestinian , including about 100 who are serving life sentence for killing israeli , which ha proved controversial in israel in the past . but hamas ha reportedly told negotiator it is not holding 40 people in this category , raising the prospect that many more hostage than previously thought have died or that they could be in the hand of other armed group , such a palestinian islamic jihad . in israel , mr netanyahu 's room for manoeuvre is limited by pressure from different part of society and politics . while most of the israeli public remain supportive of the war , there are growing call for him to agree to a deal for the release of the hostage . the family have held large protest , accusing the prime minister of not making the captive ' return a priority and of being more concerned with his own political survival . call for mr netanyahu to resign are on the rise too . division have intensified within mr netanyahu 's governing coalition , which includes far-right , ultranationalist ally who refuse concession to hamas and insist the war must go on . finance minister bezalel smotrich told the prime minister that increasing pressure on hamas wa the only way to bring the hostage back and destroy the group , while national security minister itamar ben gvir explicitly threatened to bring down mr netanyahu himself if he did not go ahead with a much-promised offensive into the city of rafah , in southern gaza . israeli official insist it is essential to enter rafah , where , they say , hamas ha four operational brigade and it senior leader could be hiding . but virtually everyone outside israel is against an offensive in the city , where about 1.5 million palestinian are sheltering in tent , improvised shelter and overcrowded camp , over concern of the catastrophic impact it could have on civilian . in what could have been an attempt to counter domestic criticism , on monday , mr netanyahu said a date had already been set for a rafah operation , without giving detail . `` there 's a revolt going on right now in the government , and within [ mr netanyahu 's party ] likud , against netanyahu making any kind of deal that they do n't think should be made , `` mr baskin said . `` netanyahu is not a free actor . he 's a hostage himself within his own government . `` for it part hamas ha yet to give a formal response to the latest proposal , but said that while it wa interested in an agreement `` that put an end to the aggression on our people `` , the offer did not meet it demand . `` the israeli position remains intransigent , `` the group said in a statement . the white house described the group 's response a `` less than encouraging `` . a final decision will probably be made by yahya sinwar , the hamas leader in gaza who is thought to be hiding in tunnel surrounded by guard and hostage . but communication with him are difficult and said to involve several intermediary and take day . the group , mr baskin said , wa also demanding more say in which palestinian prisoner would be released and that it would not agree to any of them being deported to another country , issue that could present obstacle to negotiation . hamas also belief that without guarantee of a permanent ceasefire , israel will continue to attack the group once the hostage are released . it leadership ha witnessed growing international criticism of israel and may believe time is on their side to secure concession , despite the overwhelming and immediate need of gaza 's devastated civilian population . the war in gaza , israel 's response to the hamas attack on 7 october that killed about 1,200 people , ha killed more than 33,000 palestinian , according to the hamas-run health ministry , destroyed large part of the territory , and left many on the brink of famine . `` from my experience in dealing with these thing , the main difficulty are whether or not the main decision maker on both side is ready for a deal . that 's not clear , `` mr baskin said . `` it 's not clear that netanyahu is ready for a deal , it 's not clear that [ hamas political leader in gaza yahya ] sinwar is ready for a deal . but when they are , they will find the middle ground . `` perhaps unsurprisingly , a hamas spokesperson seized on mr netanyahu 's comment about setting a date for an attack on rafah , saying it raised question about the purpose of resuming negotiation .
