Body Text: organiser of the eurovision song contest have said that abuse and harassment of artist over israel 's participation in the competition is `` unacceptable and totally unfair `` . this year 's competition will take place in sweden in may , amid call for israel to be banned over the war in gaza . several contestant , including the uk 's olly alexander , have rejected call for them to boycott the show . and it ha been reported that israel 's eden golan ha faced death threat . the 20-year-old ha received several message directly to her instagram account , reported celebrity website walla celebs . the jerusalem post said the singer would arrive in malmo , sweden , with `` three time `` the usual number of security guard . in a statement , the european broadcasting union , which organises eurovision , acknowledged `` the depth of feeling and the strong opinion that this year 's eurovision song contest - set against the backdrop of a terrible war in the middle east - ha provoked `` . `` while we strongly support freedom of speech and the right to express opinion in a democratic society , we firmly oppose any form of online abuse , hate speech , or harassment directed at our artist or any individual associated with the contest , `` the statement continued . jean philip de tender , deputy director general of the european broadcasting union , added that the decision to allow israel 's participation wa `` the sole responsibility of the ebu 's governing body and not that of the individual artist `` . `` we urge everyone to engage in respectful and constructive dialogue and support the artist who are working tirelessly - on what is a music and entertainment show - to share their music with the world , `` he added . israel 's public broadcaster , kan , is a member of the ebu , giving it the right to participate in the contest . organiser have resisted call for it to be suspended , saying the show `` is not a contest between government `` . however , the ebu did force israel to change the lyric of golan 's song october rain , after deciding the original wa too political . the first version wa widely considered to be a reference the 7 october hamas attack on israel , with several lyric paying tribute to the victim . kan initially refused to change the song , saying it would prefer to withdraw from the contest - but israel 's president , isaac herzog , later called for `` necessary adjustment `` to ensure the country could participate . now renamed hurricane , the dramatic piano ballad is ninth favourite with bookmaker to win the competition . however , israel 's participation is unlikely to go unremarked when the contest take place next month . swedish police are preparing for multiple protest in malmo in the week of the competition , and nine competitor have called for `` an immediate and lasting ceasefire `` in gaza . the statement , signed by olly alexander , ireland 's bambi thug and danish entrant saba , among others , came in response to call for musician to boycott the show . `` we firmly believe in the unifying power of music , enabling people to transcend difference and foster meaningful conversation and connection , `` the artist wrote . one person who ha pulled out of the competition , however , is iceland 's long-running commentator , gísli marteinn . the tv personality and former politician , who ha helmed 15 edition of the song contest , announced his decision on instagram , citing the organiser ' `` lack of reaction `` to the situation in gaza . `` for me , eurovision is about atmosphere and joy , and i feel neither in this year 's competition , `` he wrote . sweden won last year 's eurovision song contest in liverpool , with pop star loreen taking home her second trophy for the stormy electro-ballad tattoo .

Body Text: apple ha been criticised after the palestinian flag emoji wa automatically suggested to iphone user who type `` jerusalem . `` both israel and the palestinian hold competing claim to the ancient city . tv presenter rachel riley , who is jewish , noted on social medium that national flag were not suggested for other capital . apple ha told the bbc that the change - which followed a recent software update - wa not intentional . the issue will be remedied in a future software update , apple say , but it is not known how rapidly this will happen . writing on x ( formerly twitter ) , m riley demanded that apple explain what had happened . `` showing double standard with respect to israel is a form of antisemitism `` , she argued . the issue , according to apple , relates to a feature called predictive emoji . iphones can suggest emojis when word are typed in message , and other apps . the note accompanying the latest io update say that it includes `` new emojis . `` the status of jerusalem is one of the thorniest dispute in the conflict between israel and the palestinian . israel see the whole of jerusalem a it eternal , undivided capital , while palestinian claim the eastern part a the capital of their hoped-for future state . east jerusalem , along with the west bank and gaza strip , were captured by israel from jordan and egypt in a war in 1967 , and have since been viewed internationally a occupied palestinian territory . this is not the first time a big tech company ha found itself embroiled in the bitter dispute between israel and the palestinian . last year rival tech giant meta had to apologise after a bug resulted in it adding `` terrorist `` to the biography of some instagram user describing themselves a palestinian . meta said it fixed a problem `` that briefly caused inappropriate arabic translation `` in some of it product .

defeated , sad mother who ha been suffering for six month because of the loss of my only daughter . `` at al-aqsa martyr hospital in the central town of deir al-balah , nidal abdeh wa filmed a he cradled the body of his young son , who he said had been killed in an israeli air strike along with his wife and their two other child . `` today is the first day of eid . our child have the right to people , `` he said . mohammed abu amer said he wa praying for a ceasefire , a hamas considers a proposal from mediator in cairo for a six-week pause in the fighting that would reportedly include the Body Text: oil price fell on monday after iran 's reprisal attack on israel over the weekend . brent crude - a key benchmark for oil price internationally - wa lower but still trading close to $ 90 a barrel . price had already risen in expectation of action by iran , with brent crude nearing a six-month high last week . analyst said the market would be looking to see how the conflict could affect global supply chain . oil price fluctuation can cause ripple effect across the world due to country being heavily reliant on the commodity , which is used to produce fuel such a petrol and diesel . fuel and energy price have been a major driver behind the higher cost of living worldwide in the past couple of year . when russia invaded ukraine in 2022 , oil price soared to $ 120 a barrel over supply fear a western nation imposed sanction on russia , one of the world 's major oil exporter . the jump led to not only higher price at the pump , but also countless other good a business adjusted their price to cover higher cost . analyst said israel 's reaction to the attack would be key for global market in the day and week ahead . israeli defence minister yoav gallant ha said the confrontation with iran is `` not over yet `` . his comment came after iran launched drone and missile towards israel at the weekend after vowing retaliation for an attack on it consulate in the syrian capital damascus on 1 april . israel ha not said it carried out the consulate strike , but is widely believed to have been behind it . at the end of last week , the price of brent crude touched $ 92.18 a barrel , the highest since october , but on monday it fell back to around $ 89.50 . the price of gold - often seen a a safe investment at time of uncertainty - also dropped . after hitting a record high of $ 2,431.29 an ounce on friday , gold fell back to $ 2,332.97 on monday . energy analyst vandana hari said the fall in the price of oil meant `` clearly , the oil market doe not see the need to factor in any additional supply threat at this point `` . but peter mcguire from trading platform xm.com said he expected the energy market to be volatile and predicted that oil price would surge if israel responded strongly to iran 's move . however , april larusse , head of investment at insight investment , said it wa likely that market would `` trade sideways until we have more information `` . `` unfortunately this situation in the middle east ha been going on for some time and the longer you have a bit of geo-political tension going on the more market wait to see and there is n't sort of a panic reaction a the first move , `` she told the bbc 's today programme . share market in the asia-pacific region slipped on monday a investor weighed the impact of the attack . the uk 's ftse 100 share index also fell marginally . rus mould , investment director at investment firm aj bell , said the market had `` started the week with relative calm `` . however , he said there wa a `` continuing nervousness among investor `` . `` the situation remains fraught and , beyond the geopolitical and humanitarian implication , a more widespread conflict in the middle east could see energy price surge and unpick central bank ' careful effort to bring down inflation , `` he added . iran is the seventh largest oil producer in the world , according to the u energy information administration , and the third-largest member of the opec oil producer ' cartel . analyst say that a key issue for the oil price going forward is whether shipping through the strait of hormuz will be affected . the strait - moderate force . he said the stab wound were consistent with having been caused by a kitchen knife with an 8in ( 20cm ) - long blade found on mr alid when he wa arrested . the court ha heard mr alid followed an `` extreme interpretation of islam `` and objected to iranian mr nouri converting to christianity . juror were shown police bodycam footage of his arrival at middlesbrough police station at about 06:30 on 15 october . a he wa led from the police van , mr ahmed spoke for several minute in arabic and , among religious rhetoric , said he wa following allah and acting for gaza . he also greatest `` , several time and resumed his religious speech . mr alid told police he carried out the two attack in support of palestine and in protest of israel and the gaza conflict . in his interpreter . due to his shouting the officer ended the interview , at which point mr alid stood up `` while shouting in arabic `` , the court heard . both officer pressed an urgent assistance button found a day later , and the israel defense force ( idf ) said he had been killed in a `` terrorist attack `` . amid the search for the boy , dozen of settler , some of them armed , raided mughayir . married in june , wa trying to prevent the settler from storming the family 's house . `` it wa n't the first time settler attacked u . but we were n't expecting a huge number of them , `` he said . on saturday . shaul golan , a photographer for the israeli newspaper yedioth ahronoth , said he wa attacked by a group of between 20 to 30 people , some of whom were armed and wearing idf uniform , a he hid under a table in one of the burned house while trying to cover the rampage . `` they beat me mercilessly , breaking my finger and taking my bag to burn all of the photography equipment inside , spread to other area . in the village of dayr dibwan , cctv video shared by yesh din , an israeli human right group which monitor west bank violence , showed masked settler entering a private garage and setting a vehicle on fire , while israeli soldier stand watching . responding to the footage , the idf said the incident wa being examined and that the soldier would `` be dealt with accordingly `` , reuters reported . in nearby beitin on saturday a 17-year-old boy , omar hamed , wa killed after being hit by a bullet in the head in an attack by a group of 30 settler who had been accompanied by israeli force , palestinian official said . it wa not clear whether he wa shot by israeli force or settler . after the boy 's body wa found , israeli authority warned people against revenge . but across the west bank , yesh din received report of attack on 10 village and town , with extensive damage to property and livestock . `` the attack were of an unprecedented scale . i ca n't remember a day when we saw so many place attacked at once . it wa a very violent day with hundred of settler , `` said ziv stahl , the group 's director . `` in many place there were soldier who were not only abdul rahman ban fadel and 21-year-old mohammad ban jamea - were shot dead during an attack by dozen of settler , many of them armed , near the town of aqraba , south-east of nablus in the northern `` he said in an interview published on the newspaper 's website . `` i laid on the floor , a every one of them kicked me in the head and stomach … they had hate in their eye . `` violence spread to other area . in the village of dayr dibwan , cctv video shared by yesh din , an israeli human right group which monitor west bank violence , showed masked settler entering a private garage and setting a vehicle on fire , while israeli soldier stand watching . responding to the footage , the idf said the incident wa being examined and that the soldier would `` be dealt with accordingly `` , reuters reported . in nearby beitin on saturday a 17-year-old boy , omar hamed , wa killed after being hit by a bullet in the head in an attack by a group of 30 settler who had been accompanied by israeli force , palestinian official said . it wa not clear whether he wa shot by israeli force or settler . after the boy 's body wa found , israeli authority warned people against revenge . but across the west bank , yesh din received report of attack on 10 village and town , with extensive damage to property and livestock . `` the attack were of an unprecedented scale . i ca n't remember a day when we saw so many place attacked at once . it wa a very violent day with hundred of settler , `` said ziv stahl , the group 's director . `` in many place there were soldier who were not only allowing them to do whatever they wanted but also providing them protection . we see that in a lot of case , but [ on saturday ] it wa caught on camera `` . on monday , two palestinian - 30-year-old abdul rahman ban fadel and 21-year-old mohammad ban jamea - were shot dead during an attack by dozen of settler , many of them armed , near the town of aqraba , south-east of nablus in the northern west bank , according to local official . the israeli military said it wa looking into the incident . `` we 're concerned that the settler might come back , `` salah ban jaber , the mayor of aqraba , said . `` the israeli army and police are not preventing them from attacking palestinian village and town . . . `` the settler are planning to push u out from our land . `` across the west bank , israeli raid killed three palestinian - 17-year-old yazan ishtayeh in nablus on monday , and mohammad shahmawi , 22 , and mohammad rasoul daraghmeh , 26 , a suspected hamas member , in tuba on friday . around 700,000 israeli live in 160 settlement alongside 2.7 million palestinian in the occupied west bank and east jerusalem , according to the settlement watchdog peace now . almost all of the international community regard the settlement a illegal , although israel dispute this . there are also about 160 so-called outpost , or small settlement which have been built without official approval and are considered illegal under israeli law . tension were already high before 7 october , when hamas launched a deadly attack on israel , sparking the war in gaza . since then , more than 460 palestinian have been killed in the west bank , according to the palestinian health ministry . those death includes armed fighter amid a rise in raid by the israeli military on palestinian town and village . in the same period , at least 13 israeli have been killed in the west bank , including two member of israel 's security force . human right group say incident of settler attack , and alleged involvement of the security force , are rarely fully investigated , with impunity virtually the norm . `` there 's no accountability , `` m stahl , from yesh din , said . the recent violence ha sparked concern from foreign government , and the u , israel 's main ally , ha imposed sanction on several israeli outpost and settler involved in attack on palestinian . on tuesday , the un human right office called on israeli security force to end what it called their active participation in and support for attack by settler in the west bank . additional reporting by alaa daraghme in the west bank and narinder kalsi in jerusalem

contacted by passenger who were diverted to another dubai airport , known a dubai world central , who described similar scene and a lack of proper meal and water . no death were reported in dubai , but an elderly man wa killed when his vehicle wa swept away in a flash flood in ra al-khaimah . although the rain in dubai had eased by tuesday evening , dubai international airport warned of further disruption , and said there wa crowding . the intense storm that began on tuesday morning and continued through most of the day forced the airport to suspend operation for 25 minute , divert several inbound plane and cancel a number of inbound and outbound flight . video posted on social medium showed aircraft ploughing through several inch of water that completely covered the airport 's apron and taxiway . `` we are currently experiencing significant disruption due to the weather and are continuously working with our emergency response team and service partner to restore normal operation a quickly a possible , `` it said on x , formerly twitter . emirate , one of the uae 's two flag carrier and the world 's largest international airline , told customer that check-in had been suspended at the airport for all flight until 09:00 on thursday . the chief executive of dubai airport , paul griffith , told local radio station dubai eye : `` in living memory , i do n't think anyone ha ever passenger just like me in this airport who have been waiting for 10 hour , 16 hour , some even for 24 to 30 hour . `` the uae 's national emergency crisis management authority did issue a warning before the storm , telling people to stay at home . the government also told it employee to work from home and private school were also advised to carry out remote learning . in oman , more than 1,400 people have been evacuated to shelter . school and government office have been closed a a precaution . on sunday , 10 schoolchildren aged between 10 and 15 and an adult were killed when their bus wa swamped by floodwater a it attempted to drive through a wadi in the al-mudhaibi area of sharqiya province , about 115km ( 70 mile ) south of the capital , muscat . three other child and the driver were rescued . two of them were reportedly airlifted to safety after being swept 600m ( 1,970ft ) from the bus . the sultanate 's council of minister said it wa `` filled with grief `` over the death and sent their condolence to the victim ' family . precipitation is scarce in oman . annual average rainfall range from 150 to 300mm in the north , with most falling in pre - and post-monsoon storm . in the hour that followed the flood , some social medium user wrongly attributed the extreme weather solely to recent cloud seeding operation in the country . cloud seeding , which is when plane spray cloud with particle to make rain , ha been going on in the united arab emirate for more than 10 year . however , expert say that at best it would have had a minor effect on the storm and that focusing on cloud seeding is `` misleading `` . `` the uae doe have an operational cloud seeding programme to enhance the rainfall in this arid part of the world , however , there is no technology in existence that can create or even severely modify this kind of rainfall event , `` said prof maarten ambaum from the university of reading . bbc weather meteorologist matt taylor also noted the storm had already been forecast . `` this wa already forecast to be a severe weather event . ahead of the event , computer model [ that do n't factor in potential cloud seeding effect ] were already predicting well over a year 's worth of rain to fall in around 24 hour . `` the impact were much wider than i would expect from cloud-seeding alone too - severe flooding impacting large area from bahrain to oman . `` the heavy rain also hit saudi arabia and bahrain , where video showed car stranded in flooded road . many factor contribute to flooding , but a warming atmosphere caused by climate change make extreme rainfall more likely . the world ha already warmed by about 1.1c since the industrial era began and temperature will keep rising unless government around the world make steep cut to emission . Body Text: apple ha released a partial update to it iphone software which stop the palestinian flag emoji being suggested when user type the word `` jerusalem `` . the issue had sparked controversy , with critic noting the name of other city do not prompt flag emojis to appear . both israel and the palestinian hold competing claim to the ancient city . apple previously told the bbc the flag 's appearance when jerusalem wa typed had been inadvertent . the issue , according to apple , related to unintended behaviour in a feature called predictive emoji . iphones can suggest emojis when word are typed in message , and other apps . user noticed the flag started being suggested after the company rolled out io 17.4.1 - the latest publicly available version of the software on which it mobile device run . critic such a tv presenter rachel riley had demanded apple explain why the flag appeared , particularly when other city do not produce flag emojis when typed . `` showing double standard with respect to israel is a form of antisemitism , `` she wrote on social medium . apple 's apparent resolution is currently only in the `` developer beta `` version of io 17.5 released on tuesday . the apple developer programme allows programmer building apps to sign up for early release of the software - called beta version - so they can test out apps they are building on them . in the new update no emoji is suggested when a user type `` jerusalem `` , in line with what happens with other city . it 's not clear when the update will be released more widely , either a a public beta , or a an finished update to the general public . the status of jerusalem is one of the thorniest dispute in the conflict between israel and the palestinian . israel see the whole of jerusalem a it eternal , undivided capital , while palestinian claim the eastern part a the capital of their hoped-for future state . east jerusalem , along with the west bank and gaza strip , were captured by israel from jordan and egypt in a war in 1967 . they have since been viewed internationally a occupied palestinian territory . there have been increased tension in the middle east since the 7 october hamas attack on israel , in which about 1,200 people , mostly civilian , were killed and more than 250 others were taken hostage . the subsequent israeli military operation in gaza ha killed 33,729 people , mostly civilian , according to the hamas-run health ministry .

Body Text: iran 's brazen attack directly targeting israel on saturday mean that the one thing president biden most feared and desperately sought to avert in the wake of the 7 october hamas attack ha happened - an escalation of the conflict to the wider region . for the u president , the tightrope he wa walking on the israel-gaza war ha got even thinner , a he seek to both de-escalate the situation and deter iran , while facing domestic pressure from both left and right over the relationship with israel . any ceasefire deal in gaza , meanwhile , hang in the balance . just two week ago , it appeared that the us-israel relationship - once the closest of close ally - wa in serious trouble . president biden wa expressing not just frustration but also outright anger at the lack of humanitarian aid getting into gaza and the killing of seven aid worker in a strike by the israel defense force . the level of disagreement wa such that the administration made clear it could reconsider it stance towards israel , and possibly even withhold arm export . but iran 's action at the weekend seems to have changed all that . the barrage of more than 300 missile and drone fired at israel prompted a highly successful , hand-in-glove military action by the u and israel to defend the country . the co-ordinated action ha seemingly rekindled some of the old warmth . and the white house will now be hoping it can capitalise on that to influence israel 's response . official are not so naive a to think there will be no response at all , but they want it calibrated in such a way that it can be viewed a an act of restraint . but the weekend 's joint military success also mask a fundamental and worrying change in the regional situation , according to former u envoy dennis ross , a 40-year veteran of u diplomacy in the middle east . iran 's direct retaliation against israeli territory for the targeting of it elite quds force officer in a strike on the iranian consulate in syria ha `` rewritten the rule `` of the israel-iran relationship , he say , further destabilising an already precarious situation . iran ha spent year building up proxy force sworn to israel 's destruction , while funding and arming palestinian group including hamas , a well a the shia militant group hezbollah in lebanon . but saturday marked the first time since the islamic revolution in 1979 that iran ha attempted to launch a direct attack on israel . and so , no matter how you spin the success of the military technology that effectively neutralised iran 's action , a rubicon ha been crossed . that , say mr ross , mean there wa a `` failure of deterrent `` towards iran . mr biden now face an uncomfortable paradox , he say . the president ha to simultaneously lower the temperature with iran , but at the same time , make tehran understand there is a cost to it action . in the wake of saturday 's attack , the white house made clear it would not join any israeli military retaliation against iran , while asserting it commitment to israel 's security remained `` ironclad `` . iran 's direct involvement in the current war will also make reaching a ceasefire deal in gaza and the release of hostage kidnapped by hamas significantly harder . american diplomat have been working around the clock to get israel to agree to a six-week pause in fighting to allow for the release of both hostage from gaza and palestinian prisoner in israeli jail . the agreement would also facilitate the movement of desperately needed aid into gaza , where starvation is looming . before the weekend , they had israel 's buy-in and the pressure wa on hamas . all that is now in jeopardy a the world wait to see how israel will respond . the domestic complication for the president are meanwhile ever present . there 's pressure from part of the left to distance himself from israel ; and accusation from the right of weakness in not standing up to iran forcefully enough . `` i understand that in an election year . one want to keep thing contained . it 's perfectly understandable , `` say mr ross , who played a key role in the middle east peace process in both the george hw bush and clinton administration . `` but by the same token , we have an iran that took a step that it had n't taken before . and by taking that step it is showing a readiness to cross certain threshold and the more they cross certain threshold , they get more used to doing that . and the region becomes far more dangerous a a result . `` all this of course is ripe with the potential for misunderstanding and miscalculation . one misstep could set off a chain reaction that could quickly spiral out of control . the region is a notorious tinderbox and could catch light even further at any time . the world is holding it breath .

Body Text: the united state and the european union say they are looking at imposing further sanction on iran , after it attack on israel at the weekend . u treasury secretary janet yellen said she expected to take action `` in the coming day `` , while eu foreign policy chief josep borrell said the bloc wa working on it . israel ha urged it ally to sanction tehran 's missile programme . united nation sanction over the programme expired in october . those sanction had been linked to a wider deal to limit iran 's nuclear programme . however a number of country including the u , eu and uk maintained sanction and added new one . the israeli military 's chief of staff , lt gen herzi halevi , said on monday that the iranian attack would not go unanswered . iran 's first-ever direct attack on israel on saturday saw a wave of more than 300 missile and drone fired from iran , iraq , syria and yemen , with most being downed by israel and it ally . tehran said the attack wa retaliation for a presumed israeli air strike on it consulate in syria on 1 april , in which 13 people were killed . so far , israel appears to have countered with only a diplomatic offensive . it foreign minister urged more than 30 country to impose sanction on iran 's missile programme . it ha also called for the islamic revolutionary guard corp ( irgc ) - a major military , political and economic force in iran - to be designated a terrorist organisation , something the u ha already done but the uk ha not . speaking on tuesday , u treasury secretary m yellen said : `` with respect to sanction , i fully expect that we will take additional sanction action against iran in the coming day . `` we do n't preview our sanction tool . but in discussion i 've had , all option to disrupt terrorist financing of iran continue to be on the table . `` she said iran 's oil export were `` a possible area we could address `` , adding : `` clearly , iran is continuing to export some oil . there may be more that we could do . `` m yellen said the u wa already using financial sanction to isolate iran and disrupt it ability to fund proxy group and support russia 's war in ukraine - including by targeting more than 500 individual and entity . existing u sanction on iran already ban nearly all american trade with the country . u national security advisor jake sullivan said later that the new sanction would target `` iran including it missile and drone program `` a well a the revolutionary guard and the iranian defence ministry . `` we anticipate that our ally and partner will soon be following with their own sanction , `` he added . `` these new sanction and other measure will continue a steady drumbeat of pressure to contain and degrade iran 's military capacity and effectiveness and confront the full range of it problematic behaviour . `` mr borrell , the eu 's top diplomat , said some member state had asked for sanction against iran to be expanded . he said he would send a request to the eu 's diplomatic service to `` start the necessary work related to the sanction `` . israeli foreign minister israel katz welcomed the `` positive trend towards the adoption of sanction `` in a post on x , formerly twitter . world leader have urged restraint in a bid to avoid a major escalation in the middle east , following the latest attack . u president joe biden - who ha repeatedly declared his support for israel is `` ironclad `` - ha said he belief israel should declare victory in this episode and `` take the win `` . in a phone call on tuesday evening , uk prime minister rishi sunak warned israeli prime minister benjamin netanyahu against a further escalation in it response . `` he stressed that significant escalation wa in no one 's interest and would only deepen insecurity in the middle east . this wa a moment for calm head to prevail , `` a downing street spokesperson said . the g7 group of the world 's seven largest advanced economy wa now `` co-ordinating a diplomatic response `` , they added . iran ha indicated that it deems the matter `` concluded `` unless israel retaliates - with iran 's president ebrahim raisi warning that `` the slightest action against iran 's interest will definitely be met with a severe , extensive and painful response `` . russia - an ally of iran - ha also urged restraint , the kremlin said on tuesday following a call between russian president vladimir putin and president raisi . `` vladimir putin expressed hope that all side would show reasonable restraint and prevent a new round of confrontation fraught with catastrophic consequence for the entire region , `` the kremlin said .

Body Text: benjamin netanyahu ha told uk foreign secretary lord cameron that israel would `` make it own decision `` over how to respond to an iranian attack . he said his government would `` do everything necessary to defend itself `` during talk the british government had hoped would help prevent escalation . mr netanyahu ha repeatedly vowed to retaliate to the unprecedented missile and drone assault at the weekend . lord cameron told him any response should be `` smart `` and limited . speaking to reporter in jerusalem after the meeting with mr netanyahu , lord cameron said he wa there to `` demonstrate our solidarity `` after iran 's `` appalling `` attack . he continued : `` we hope that anything israel doe is a limited and a targeted and a smart a possible . `` it 's in no-one 's interest that we see escalation and that is what we said very clearly to all the people i 've been speaking to here in israel . `` after the meeting , the israeli prime minister said : `` i want to make it clear - we will make our own decision , and the state of israel will do everything necessary to defend itself . `` mr netanyahu 's remark will reinforce the belief in western capital that israel is set to take action against iran and there is a limit to how often they can call for restraint . israel is more than aware of concern in europe and the united state about the war escalating in the region . however , western leader may take comfort from the fact that israeli leader are trying to exploit the diplomatic support they have gained after iran 's attack , which ha seen international condemnation and the promise of new sanction on tehran . it is possible mr netanyahu may not want to destroy that alliance with an act of retaliation that plunge the region into a full-scale war . lord cameron is one of several western foreign minister who are expected to visit israel in the coming day a part of a diplomatic drive to prevent that from happening . before meeting mr netanyahu , lord cameron held talk with israeli president isaac herzog and israeli foreign affair minister israel katz . the uk foreign secretary also visited the occupied palestinian territory to meet mohammad mustafa , the prime minister of the palestinian authority . g7 minister are gathering in italy , where lord cameron will push for co-ordinated sanction on iran . earlier , he accused tehran of being `` behind so much of the malign activity `` in the middle east and called for other country to adopt measure designed to restrict iran 's influence . the u and european union are considering further sanction , and israel is calling on it ally to designate the islamic revolutionary guard corp ( irgc ) - a major military , political and economic force in iran - a a terrorist organisation . the israeli government ha repeatedly vowed to retaliate after iran sent more than 300 drone and missile towards israel in an unprecedented direct attack overnight on saturday . almost all the projectile were intercepted by israel 's air defence system , with the help of the uk , u , france , and jordan . iran 's direct attack on israel wa carried out in response to a strike in syria on 1 april which killed senior iranian military figure . israel ha not publicly confirmed it wa behind the attack , but is widely believed to have been . on tuesday evening , uk prime minister rishi sunak spoke to mr netanyahu and warned that `` significant escalation will only deepen instability in the region `` , adding : `` this is a moment for calm head to prevail . `` lord cameron will seek to reinforce mr sunak 's call for restraint during his visit to israel , and put more pressure on it leader to do more to allow humanitarian aid into gaza - but he is walking a delicate diplomatic line . the foreign secretary will not want to appear to be hectoring an ally which ha just been subject to an unprecedented attack on it soil . that is why lord cameron is also talking about the need for hamas to release hostage and the importance of western power imposing yet more sanction on iran . his presence in jerusalem is a show of support and solidarity - but also an attempt to warn israeli leader that any significant escalation would be against their interest and the world 's .

there say . aviva never imagined that nearly five month after she said goodbye to her husband in gaza , he would still be held captive there enduring brutal condition . `` i 'm not speaking . i 'm screaming and need help from the whole world to help take keith out and all the hostage , `` she said . `` i wa there for 51 day . i know what it 's like and when i try and imagine keith being thrown into the corner , on a mattress on the floor , with no human right at all . it break my heart , and he 's not there for a day and not for two day . i 'm back for nearly five month , `` she said . in her first interview with a british medium outlet , the 62-year-old spoke not knowing if keith , an american-israeli grandfather , wa still alive . `` it 's terrible . i 'm broken up into piece . it 's very hard to handle the situation to think about them being there , to see what i saw , going through what i went through with terrorist that were so mean to u , and so brutal , and that keith is still there . `` we do n't know anything about him . we do n't even know that he 's alive . and it 's difficult for me to think that he 's alone with the terrorist . `` hamas attacker broke into aviva and keith 's home and dragged them away , breaking keith 's rib and shooting him in the hand . once in gaza , the couple were moved from place to place 13 time . `` one of the time they took u down to a tunnel and there wa no oxygen there . and they just left u there . and i ca n't explain what the feeling wa . `` not being able to breathe and you know that it might be your last hour . there wa just no oxygen so they just left u . they went up to the ground to the fresh air and they just left usâ_x0080_ ¦ we felt like we kind of died . `` at other time they stayed in house , kept with little food in the dark and ordered not to stand or talk for day . aviva is clear that some of the female hostage she wa held with were sexually assaulted by the hamas men holding them . `` i wa there and i saw the girl coming after those thing happened and telling u what happened . . . one of the day one of the girl went to the toilet , and when she came back , i could see on her face that something happened and i got up and i gave her a hug and the terrorist came in and started screaming . `` after a couple of hour she came and she told u she said ' he touched me ' and that wa one of the terrible moment because i felt that i could n't even look after this little girl . she 's just a child . she could be my child . and the only thing i could do wa look at her in the eye because we were n't allowed to hug , we cried inside . `` on another occasion one of the gunman badly beat a female hostage , aviva said . `` he pulled up her hair and pushed her on the floor . she fell with the gun [ pointing ] into her face and he said ' one more word and i 'm going to kill you ' . `` even though she put her finger in her ear aviva could still hear the hostage being hit . on the 50th day the hamas gunman told her she wa being released ; she begged them not to leave her husband behind . `` they did n't even let me go and say goodbye to keith until i pushed them . i said ' i 'm going to say goodbye ' . i told him to be strong for me and i 'll be strong for him . and i 'm happy that i did that because i 'm sure that he think about that sentence . `` throughout her captivity aviva believed her son shai had been killed when hamas stormed the kibbutz . `` on the bus on the way back , i told the social worker that i think i 'm going to faint because they 're going to tell me that shai died . and she came back after 10 minute and told me you have four child . and i wa just the happiest person . `` keith still doe n't know that shai survived . aviva is distraught that her husband and the other hostage have n't been released and belief hamas is `` getting the pleasure of them being there and seeing u suffer `` . `` they feel like they 've won . they are playing game . `` she want international mediator including the u , qatar and egypt to do more . `` i think that qatar need to understand they need to be much stronger to help to get them out . and if they do , i think it will be the best thing for them because people in the whole world will look at them a strong and the u need to stand strong and help because we need helpâ_x0080_ ¦ i think that everybody the whole world need to do more . `` on wednesday , qatari pm sheikh mohammed bin abdulrahman al thani said long-running talk for a truce and the release of hostage were `` going through a sensitive stage with some stalling , and we are trying a much a possible to address this stalling `` without giving more detail . the u say hamas rejected the latest proposal put to it , which included an initial six-week ceasefire that would see the group release 40 hostage who are alive , with the priority being given to female captive including soldier , men over the age of 50 - which would include 64-year-old keith - and those with serious medical condition . the deal `` would achieve much of what hamas claim it want to achieve `` , said u state department spokesman matthew miller . but hamas reportedly told negotiator it wa not holding 40 hostage in this category . israeli official had previously said they believed about 133 hostage were still in gaza with more than 30 of them presumed dead . hamas also want a permanent ceasefire , the complete withdrawal of israeli troop and the return of displaced palestinian to northern gaza without restriction . prime minister benjamin netanyahu meanwhile ha insisted that israel will continue fighting until hamas is destroyed . aviva is only too aware that a talk drag on without agreement , more of the hostage may already be dead . `` i 'm starting to lose my hope . and i 'm sure that keith is too . when i wa there i used to think to myself i 'd rather be dead than what i 'm going through and i 'm sure keith think that too . ``

Body Text: tourist stranded in dubai 's major airport say they are `` desperate for food `` and are running low on water a flood cause disruption and chaos in one of the world 's busiest transport hub . passenger who have spoken to the bbc say they have been waiting for hour at dubai 's two major international airport , with little information or support provided to them . about 290 flight to and from dubai international airport on wednesday have been cancelled , according to flight aware data at 21:00 gmt ( 22:00 bst ) . there have been a further 440 delayed flight , the data showed . it come after record rainfall caused flood in gulf state , leading to the death of 20 people . james and elizabeth devine , from cambridge , have been stuck at the wrong connecting airport in dubai with their six-month-old son after their flight back home from a wedding in sydney wa diverted . it landed at dubai world central airport , more than 80km ( 40 mile ) away from their intended destination , dubai international airport . mr devine , a 30-year-old software engineer , and mr devine , a 29-year-old primary school teacher , are part of a party of nine from the uk . they 've been `` living on duty free `` and say water is in short supply . `` the restaurant are closed , `` mr devine said . `` the only food we have is from duty free so it 's like they have n't provided any food for infant or young child , there 's no nappy , so we 're like handing-off nappy to people . `` the weather condition have forced dubai international airport - the world 's second busiest - to divert dozen of inbound plane and cancel a number of flight . `` we are currently experiencing significant disruption due to the weather and are continuously working with our emergency response team and service partner to restore normal operation a quickly a possible , `` it said on x , formerly twitter . emirate , a major international airline headquartered in dubai , ha suspended check-in for passenger departing from dubai until thursday , due to `` operational challenge `` caused by the bad weather . despite the chaos , the couple said passenger have kept arriving at the airport . `` we are all stuck in this poorly resourced airport , `` mr devine said , `` there are hundred if not thousand of people here `` . `` they had to open duty free so we could eat some food but it 's running out . `` andrew and kate golding navigated `` floating car `` to get inside dubai international airport and have now been there for 12 hour . `` i 'm trying to get on another flight , `` andrew , 62 , told bbc news . `` my wife , kate is standing in another queue a we 're trying to hedge our bet . `` the couple from kent were on holiday to celebrate kate 's 60th birthday , a trip andrew say she will now `` never forget `` . `` it ha been worse i think than anyone expected , but the system within the airport ha completely fallen apart and emirate , which i consider to be one of finest airline - no staff , no information , no coordination , no professionalism , no care - no disaster planning at emirate , it 's weird - big company normally plan for these event . `` `` it 's been total chaos . `` `` people are sleeping in the lounge , on the floor , food packet everywhere . it 's just been a pretty filthy experience really . `` bbc news ha contacted emirate for comment . elsewhere at the airport , anne wing , from rotherham , south yorkshire , is with her husband and three child hoping to fly to london heathrow . they arrived at the airport at 08:00 local time ( 04:00 gmt ) for their 11:25 flight , and were initially told it had been delayed by an hour . `` we have spoken to no-one from emirate since 08:00 this morning , `` she said . `` passenger were shouting and rioting at the connection desk , there were no staff to be seen . `` `` it horrific , we are squashed in like animal - it is dangerous and inhumane , `` she added . `` it absolutely ridiculous here `` . she said her family have n't eaten since lunch time , and all that ha been provided are some `` small carton of water `` . margaret mcarthur , 73 and her husband derek , 75 , from monifieth near dundee in scotland , are in dubai for a two-day stopover and were supposed to be heading on to tokyo today . they were due to fly from dubai international airport on wednesday morning but their flight wa delayed and hour later , they still have n't been given an alternative flight . `` we meant to fly at 07:50 this morning , and we have been at the airport since 06:15 , `` mr mcarthur said . `` we have been here for 13 hour so far . no food and had only a coffee . there are no facility where we were told to stay . `` the couple say they are `` desperate for food `` and that no voucher have been issued to passenger . `` we do n't know what is happening , `` mr mcarthur said , adding that communication with their airline ha been poor . matt weir is a teacher in dubai and ha lived there for 10 year . he said it wa mid-afternoon on tuesday when he noticed a large , ominous cloud stretching across the sky . `` at 3pm the sky went pitch black and apocalyptic - that 's when i took that picture of the sky a i saw the storm come in , `` he told the bbc . the cloud 's appearance wa followed by torrential rain : `` when i got back to my house it looked like i 'd just got out of the bath `` . since then , mr weir said `` dubai ha been left under water - some place are a good metre and more under water , thousand of house are completely flooded . `` mr weir said his home wa unaffected , but `` my neighbour ' house just two door down is totally flooded . `` `` there are also collapsed road with car fallen through . . . a lot of the shopping mall have completely leaked too . `` footage from the centre of dubai show dozen of submerged vehicle on a flooded part of sheikh zayed road , a well a long traffic jam elsewhere on the 12-lane highway . mr weir said that though menacing cloud had been superseded by blue sky by wednesday , `` so much is still under water and infrastructure ha collapsed `` . on tuesday the uae experienced it largest rainfall event since record began 75 year ago . the national centre of meteorology announced that 254.8mm ( 9.7in ) had fallen on khatm al-shakla , in the emirate of al-ain , over less than 24 hour . the country average 140-200 mm of rainfall per year , while dubai typically receives only 97mm . the monthly average for april is only about 8mm . the heavy rain also hit saudi arabia and bahrain . many factor contribute to flooding , but a warming atmosphere caused by climate change make extreme rainfall more likely . the world ha already warmed by about 1.1c since the industrial era began and temperature will keep rising unless government around the world make steep cut to emission . additional reporting by rozina sini , james kelly , andrã©e massiah and ugc have you been affected by the flooding in dubai ? get in touch by emailing haveyoursay @ bbc.co.uk . please include a contact number if you are willing to speak to a bbc journalist . you can also get in touch in the following way : if you are reading this page and ca n't see the form you will need to visit the mobile version of the bbc website to submit your question or comment or you can email u at haveyoursay @ bbc.co.uk . please include your name , age and location with any submission .

Body Text: qatar is reassessing it role a a mediator between israel and hamas , the country 's prime minister ha said . qatar ha had a key role - along with egypt and the u - in trying to secure a ceasefire between israel and hamas and the release of israeli hostage . but sheikh mohammed bin abdul rahman al thani said doha had been exploited and abused and wa being undermined by those trying to score political point . he also said the current peace talk were in a `` delicate phase `` . attempt to secure a ceasefire have been delicate and largely unsuccessful , but the link qatar ha with all side - including close tie to hamas - are regarded a crucial to achieving any breakthrough . mediator have proposed a six-week truce during which hamas would free 40 woman , child and elderly or sick hostage - an offer hamas publicly rejected over the weekend . qatar is now openly questioning chance of those talk succeeding and say it is re-evaluating it role a a mediator . sheikh mohammed - who also serf a qatar 's foreign minister - said it effort were being undermined by politician seeking to score point . `` unfortunately , i mean , we have seen that there ha been an abuse of this mediation and an abuse of this mediation in favour of narrow political interest , `` he said at a news conference in doha on wednesday . `` this mean that the state of qatar ha called for a comprehensive evaluation of this role . we are now at this stage to evaluate mediation and also evaluate how the party engage in this mediation . `` he did not identify any individual , but some critical voice from within the u congress have accused qatar of not putting enough pressure on hamas to make concession . the u accused the palestinian armed group of being `` the obstacle to a ceasefire `` after it rejected the latest ceasefire offer . with new fear that the damaging war in gaza could escalate into a wider regional conflict , a tension rise between israel and iran , the qatari premier warned against the expansion of the conflict and called on the wider international community to assume it responsibility and stop the war . meanwhile , the israeli military said 14 israeli soldier had been injured , six of them severely , by anti-tank missile and drone launched from lebanese territory towards a village in northern israel . the iran-backed lebanese armed group hezbollah said it had fired on a military target in the arab al-aramshe area in retaliation for recent israeli strike that had killed hezbollah commander and other fighter . hezbollah - which like hamas is proscribed a a terrorist organisation by israel , the u , uk and other country - ha been exchanging fire with israeli force almost every day along the border since the start of the war in gaza . that conflict erupted when hamas gunman carried out an unprecedented attack on southern israel on 7 october , killing about 1,200 people , mainly civilian , and taking 253 others back to gaza a hostage . more than 33,800 people have been killed in gaza , the majority of them woman and child , during israel 's military campaign to destroy hamas and release the hostage , according to the territory 's hamas-run health ministry . a week-long ceasefire in november saw 105 hostage - most of them woman and child - freed in return for some 240 palestinian prisoner in israeli jail . israeli official say 133 hostage are being held in gaza - including four taken captive before the war - but that more than 30 of them are dead . on saturday , hamas put out a statement saying it wa ready to agree a `` serious and true `` hostage exchange deal with israel but rejected what wa currently on the table . it also reaffirmed that it wa sticking to it demand for a permanent ceasefire that would lead to a full withdrawal of israeli troop from gaza and the return of displaced palestinian to their home . israel 's mossad intelligence agency , whose director is leading the israeli negotiating team , said on sunday that hamas 's stance showed that it leader in gaza , yahya sinwar , `` doe not want a humanitarian deal and the return of the hostage , is continuing to exploit the tension with iran , and is striving to unite the sector and achieve a general escalation in the region `` . u state department spokesman matthew miller said on monday : `` the bottom line is hamas need to take that deal and they need to explain to the world and to the palestinian people why they are n't taking it . `` last week , a senior israeli official told u medium that hamas had informed mediator that it did not have 40 living hostage who meet one of the criterion laid out in the latest ceasefire proposal - child , woman , including soldier , men over the age of 50 and those with serious medical condition . a senior hamas official , meanwhile , said it needed a ceasefire to be under way to provide `` enough time and safety `` to locate all the hostage . sheikh mohammed also called on the international community to `` assume it responsibility and stop this war `` , warning that that civilian in gaza faced `` siege and starvation `` , with aid being used a a `` tool for political blackmail `` . a un-backed assessment said last month that 1.1 million people - half the population - were facing catastrophic hunger and that famine wa imminent in northern gaza . the un ha blamed israeli restriction on aid delivery , the ongoing hostility and the breakdown of order . israeli prime minister benjamin netanyahu 's office said on wednesday that he `` rejected the claim of international organisation regarding famine in gaza `` and insisted israel wa `` going above and beyond in the humanitarian sphere `` . the israeli military also announced that food aid had entered gaza from israel 's ashdod container port for the first time , with eight un world food programme lorry transporting flour via the israeli-controlled kerem shalom crossing with the south of the territory on wednesday . a new crossing with northern gaza wa also opened last week a israel sought to meet the demand made by u president joe biden following an israeli air strike in gaza on 1 april that killed seven world central kitchen aid worker . `` in the 12 day following my call with prime minister netanyahu , 3,000 truck with food and supply moved into gaza - a daily increase of over 50 % from the week prior , `` mr biden wrote on x , formerly twitter , on wednesday . however , the un agency for palestinian refugee ( unrwa ) , which is the largest humanitarian organisation in gaza , said in a report on tuesday that there had been `` no significant change in the volume of humanitarian supply entering gaza or improved access to the north `` . according to figure published by unrwa , an average of 185 lorry entered gaza per day via kerem shalom and the egyptian-controlled rafah crossing between 5 april - the day after mr biden spoke to mr netanyahu - and 15 april , the latest available date . the daily average wa 168 in the seven day between 29 march and 4 april , according to the data . a senior un humanitarian official also warned on tuesday that it wa still struggling to prevent famine even though there had been some improvement in the co-ordination of aid delivery with israel . `` it 's much bigger than simply bringing in flour and baking a few loaf of bread . it is really complex , `` andrea de domenico noted . `` water , sanitation and health are fundamental to curb famine . `` cogat , the israeli defence ministry body that is co-ordinating aid delivery to gaza , said 700 lorry load of supply were waiting to be collected on the palestinian side of kerem shalom . `` we scaled up our capability . all the un did wa make up excuse , `` it added . in a separate development on the ground in gaza on wednesday , the israeli military said it troop and aircraft had `` eliminated a number of terrorist and destroyed terrorist infrastructure `` in the centre of the territory . palestinian medium reported that there had been intense bombardment and fighting in and around nuseirat refugee camp , where 11 member of the al-nouri family were reportedly killed in a strike on their home on tuesday . the israeli military also said it force had carried out a raid `` to apprehend terrorist hiding in school `` in the northern town of beit hanoun . a number of hamas and palestinian islamic jihad operative were detained and others who resisted were killed , it added . four people were reportedly killed on tuesday when a house in beit hanoun wa hit and significantly damaged , according to the un . one man in neighbouring jabalia told bbc arabic 's gaza lifeline radio service : `` we were shocked by the advance of the occupation [ israeli ] force , which surrounded the entire area and arrested young men , woman and child . the force evacuated u from the area , killed people in beit hanoun , entered the shelter school , and arrested those inside them . `` `` this is how our life ha become unbearableâ_x0080_ ¦ whenever and wherever we walk , tank always shower u with shell . ``

Body Text: if dubai is the ultimate instagram city , then this wa the week the filter came off . over an unprecedented 48 hour , the sky over the united arab emirate darkened and torrential storm washed away dubai 's picture-perfect image . about 25cm ( 10in ) of rain - but dubai 's weather infrastructure wa unprepared for the worst rain since 1949 . in many way , few modern city would have coped with the size of the deluge that hit dubai this week . the city 's top attraction - largely indoors to protect from the searing heat - struggled to handle the sudden influx of water . caroline seubert , 29 , from the uk , wa with her husband at a shopping centre when the storm hit . `` the mall wa flooded , ceiling were collapsing , `` she said . `` we were told to leave , but the metro wa shut and the taxi were not running . `` we were stranded , had to sleep in the mall lobby overnight . `` matt weir , a british teacher who ha been based in dubai for 10 year , said `` people were aware `` a storm wa coming but the force of it left `` neighbourhood under water `` . while the forecast look more typically blue and sunny for the week ahead , some storm remain possible - and with road and other infrastructure still crippled , dubai 's ruler are counting the cost . the uae 's president sheikh mohammed bin nahyan issued a public order for `` authority to quickly work on studying the condition of infrastructure throughout the uae and to limit the damage caused `` . government employee have been told to work from home until the end of the week , while private firm have been encouraged to do the same . school across the country have been shuttered . so far , the official death toll in the uae is just one person - an elderly man who died when his vehicle wa swept away in ra al khaimah , according to local medium . some of the worst disruption ha been at dubai international airport , the world 's second busiest , where nearly 90 million people - more than the population of germany - are expected to pas through in 2024 . it is an important hub for travel to the gulf and connecting flight heading further afield - but witness say it ha descended into bedlam after the flood . a flooded taxiway meant plane were unable to reach the runway to take off and passenger were left stranded in the terminal building . the country 's state-owned airline emirate wa forced to stop accepting check-in passenger at all . while it ha since re-opened check-in , it say many passenger `` are still waiting to get on flight `` . jo reilly is among the traveller left in limbo . the 41-year-old wa flying back to the uk from vietnam via dubai with her daughter holly , 13 , and ruby , nine , when the storm struck . after two-and-a-half hour circling over the gulf waiting for a chance to land , they eventually landed at another dubai airport , before being told in the middle of the night to get on a bus to head for their original destination . she told bbc news her daughter `` were practically crushed in a stampede a hundred of desperate people were fighting for a seat on the coach `` . once they eventually reached dubai international airport , the situation wa no better . jo said : `` we asked can we have water , can we have food ? nothing . there 's nothing here . people are really , really in a bad way . `` we 've been told it 's sunday night the earliest we can get home and apparently we 're quite lucky to have that option . `` emirate are saying there are no hotel room so i said , ' oh , so we 're just to carry on sleeping on the floor ? ' and they said , ' yes , go make yourself comfortable over there ' and pointed to the corner of the check-in area . `` jonathan finchett , also from the uk , described `` apocalyptic `` scene in the airport , where people were arriving to find their flight had been cancelled . he told bbc news he saw family `` barricading themselves behind a circle of luggage trolley to keep themselves safe because they did n't feel that safe because there wa absolutely no staff `` . queue at ticket desk were `` pure chaos `` , he said , adding : `` there were hundred of people stampeding towards this , like a crush . all of a sudden you had woman screaming saying they could n't breathe . `` emirate said it appreciated `` how difficult it is for everyone affected `` and that schedule were returning to normal . dubai international airport said : `` a much a possible , we 've been providing necessary assistance and amenity to affected guest but due to road blockage , it 's taken longer than we would have liked . `` a for how thing are now in the city , jordache ruffels said thing had `` practically returned to normal `` after swift action by the authority . `` there 's a sense of unity and togetherness in time like this , `` he added . the storm hit a dubai - home to 3.5m people - which would be unrecognisable to the 100,000 resident who called it home in the 1970s , before the oil boom . there is also an annual influx of 14m tourist , including the influencers and celebrity seeking luxury hotel and glamorous backdrop ( uk reality tv star joey essex and james argent were among those caught up in the disruption ) . it modern image run alongside a strong regulatory and political control of medium content where even foreign publication can be censored before distribution . some people living in dubai that the bbc ha spoken to in recent day asked to remain anonymous out of fear of repercussion . matthew hedge is an academic researcher who ha authored a book on the uae . in 2018 , he wa detained and tortured there after being falsely accused of spying . he told bbc news he ha spoken to uae resident who are angry about the lack of preparedness for these flood , and who know extreme weather is a long-term issue facing the country . mr hedge continued : `` they have absolutely no way to legitimately or safely voice their concern . if they do they will be punished and repressed . `` he also said he feared for the country 's poorer migrant worker - . justin crump , a former british army officer who run risk intelligence company sibylline , agreed that the debris seen in the picture wa probably from a missile booster `` with the warhead having detached and presumably gone on to achieve it mission - this is the motor which fall to earth `` . `` the booster ha attachment point typically used to connect to an aircraft and it general size suggests it may have been an air-launched system , `` crump said . although we can not yet independently verify the exact type of missile , it is known that israel ha developed this type of weapon . `` israel ha previously used such weapon in syria , so this is well within their capability , `` crump added . some iranian official and medium have confirmed there wa an attempted strike but are downplaying the significance of it . there have been no report of casualty . iran 's far news agency say explosion were heard near an army base and air defence system were activated . explosion heard in the isfahan area were `` due to air defence firing at suspicious object `` and there wa no damage , a state medium channel quoted a general a saying . the semi-official tasnim news agency , which is close to the powerful islamic revolution guard corp military wing , posted a video of a nuclear facility in isfahan which did not show any sign it had been hit . the international atomic energy agency ha confirmed there wa no damage to iran 's nuclear site . hossein dalirian , a spokesman for iran 's national centre of cyberspace , said there had been `` no air attack from outside border `` . he said israel had `` only made a failed and humiliating attempt to fly quadcopters [ drone ] `` which had been shot down . iran imposed restriction on commercial flight in the hour immediately after the strike but they have now been lifted . explosion were also reported overnight in iraq and syria - where armed group backed by iran operate - but it is unclear if they were directly linked to the isfahan strike . the syrian defence ministry said an air defence site in the south of syria had been hit by an israeli missile in the early hour of friday morning local time . israel ha not confirmed it wa behind the strike . isfahan province is a large area in the centre of iran which take it name from it largest city . the region is home to significant iranian military infrastructure , including a large air base , a major missile production complex and several nuclear facility . israel would usually tell the u in advance about military action , but italy 's foreign minister antonio tajani told reporter at the g7 meeting in capri that washington had only been `` informed at the very last minute `` . speaking at the summit , u secretary of state antony blinken refused to be drawn on the attack , saying only that the u had `` not been involved in any offensive operation `` . this latest strike come less than a week after iran launched hundred of missile and drone at israel , an incident seen a a dramatic escalation in tension . despite it vast scale and unprecedented nature , iran 's attack wa largely unsuccessful , with the vast majority of projectile shot down by israeli air defence with the help of the u , uk and other ally . that unprecedented attack on israeli soil wa in response to a strike against a building on an iranian diplomatic compound in syria on 1 april . whether iran will seek to respond . bbc security correspondent frank gardener describes the scale of friday 's attack a limited and potentially designed to ensure the conflict go no further . israeli prime minister benjamin netanyahu will come under competing pressure from some of his own general and political ally to push back against iran , according to bbc international editor jeremy bowen . conflict . this flare-up in hostility come against the backdrop of the war in gaza , where the israeli military is fighting iran-backed hamas . some of the response from within israel have highlighted called for him to be sacked , and said his remark had ridiculed and embarrassed israel . the uk government said it would not speculate on the strike , but said israel should avoid `` significant escalation `` while exercising it `` right to self-defence `` . european commission president ursula von der leyen called on all side to refrain from further action . there are concern a worsening conflict in the middle east could disrupt oil supply . brent crude , the international benchmark for oil price , rose by 1.8 % to $ 88 a barrel after the attack . oil price had jumped by a much a 3.5 % initially but the price stabilised when it became clearer the strike wa limited . the price of gold - which is often seen a a safe investment at time of uncertainty - briefly came close to a record high before falling back to nearly $ 2,400 an ounce .

Body Text: israel 's benjamin netanyahu ha vowed to reject any sanction on the country 's military , after report that the u plan to cut aid to one unit . `` i will fight it with all my strength , `` the prime minister said on sunday . earlier , the axios news site said the u would target israel 's netzah yehuda battalion over alleged human right violation in the occupied west bank . the bbc understands any move would come under a u ban on aid to foreign unit credibly implicated in violation . when asked last week about report that u military aid to the israel defense force ' ( idf ) unit could be cut over allegation of human right abuse in the occupied west bank , secretary of state antony blinken said : `` i 've made determination ; you can expect to see them in the day ahead `` . washington - israel 's main ally - ha never suspended aid to an idf unit before . the israeli military said netzah yehuda wa operating in accordance with international law . `` following publication about sanction against the battalion , the idf is not aware of the issue , `` the military is quoted a saying by reuters news agency . `` the idf work and will continue to work to investigate any unusual event in a practical manner and according to law . `` israel 's defence minister yoav gallant called on the u to withdraw it intention to sanction netzah yehuda , saying the world wa watching the tie between the u and israel more closely than ever . `` any attempt to criticise an entire unit cast a heavy shadow on the action of the idf , `` a statement from mr gallant read , adding `` this is not the right path for partner and friend `` . on saturday , axios cited three u source with knowledge of the issue a saying that mr blinken wa expected to announce measure against netzah yehuda within day . it said the move would be over alleged abuse in the west bank , including one incident in which a palestinian-american man , 80-year-old omar assad , died after being bound and gagged by israeli soldier during a search in the west bank in january 2022 . at the time the u called for a `` thorough criminal investigation and full accountability `` in the case . the idf later said it regretted mr assad 's death and that the netzah yehuda commander would be `` reprimanded '' over it . it added that two soldier would barred from serving in senior position for two year , but would not be prosecuted . it said mr assad 's death had been caused by a pre-existing medical condition . mr assad 's family , many of whom are based in the u , condemned the decision to close the case . all the alleged violation took place before the 7 october hamas attack on israel from the gaza strip . any decision to bar an idf unit from u military assistance would be made under the `` leahy law `` , sponsored in 1997 by then-senator patrick leahy . it prevents u funding or training being used for foreign military unit credibly implicated in gross human right violation . last year , a group of u official known a the `` israel-leahy vetting forum `` looked into at least a dozen allegation made against israeli unit , including the netzah yehuda battalion , a former senior u official told the bbc . `` we believed that in most case , these were un-remediated - in other word , the perpetrator had not been properly held to account , `` said josh paul , former director of the office of congressional and public affair in the state department 's bureau of political-military affair , which oversees u arm transfer . `` when we tried to advance these recommendation to the secretary [ of state ] we were never able to get them through the political level , `` he added . mr paul resigned from his position in november in protest at what he saw a a lack of accountability over weapon transfer to israel . asked whether the recommendation he mentioned had since reached mr blinken 's desk , he cited the recent medium report suggesting they had . formed in 1999 , netzah yehuda is a special men-only unit where ultra-orthodox jew serve . earlier this week , the state department imposed sanction on israeli far-right activist ben zion gopstein . it said his organisation , lehava , had `` engaged in destabilising violence affecting the west bank `` .

Body Text: the white house ha condemned `` blatantly antisemitic `` statement during ongoing student protest against the war in gaza . a protest at columbia university entered a fifth day , deputy press secretary andrew bates said student had the right to peaceful protest . but he denounced `` call for violence and physical intimidation targeting jewish student `` . more than 100 student were arrested at the new york university this week . the arrest came after police cleared a protest encampment at the elite institution . college campus across the u have been rocked by demonstration for month . the white house statement on sunday came after video posted online appeared to show some protester expressing support for the 7 october attack . `` while every american ha the right to peaceful protest , call for violence and physical intimidation targeting jewish student and the jewish community are blatantly antisemitic , unconscionable , and dangerous , `` the statement read . `` and echoing the rhetoric of terrorist organisation , especially in the wake of the worst massacre committed against the jewish people since the holocaust , is despicable . `` separately , president joe biden also denounced `` blatant antisemitism `` on college campus , without directly referencing any one university . `` even in recent day , we 've seen harassment and call for violence against jew . this blatant antisemitism is reprehensible and dangerous - and it ha absolutely no place on college campus , or anywhere in our country , `` he said in a statement marking the jewish passover holiday . new york mayor eric adam said he wa `` horrified and disgusted with the antisemitism being spewed at and around the columbia university campus `` . the mayor said new york police would arrest anyone found to to be breaking the law . on sunday , cnn reported that a rabbi associated with the university sent a message to 300 jewish student advising them to keep away from campus in light of the unrest . `` it deeply pain me to say that i would strongly recommend you return home a soon a possible and remain home until the reality in and around campus ha dramatically improved , `` the message said , according to cnn . the columbia barnard hillel - a jewish campus organisation associated with columbia and it sister college , barnard - said it did not think jewish student should leave the university . but it called on the university and city authority to do more to protect student . the clearing of the protest encampment on thursday wa described a an `` extraordinary step `` by columbia university president dr nemat shafik , who said it wa necessary to provide a safe environment . among the participant in the protest wa the daughter of minnesota politician ilhan omar , who ha been suspended from her college . dr shafik had earlier faced member of congress to defend columbia 's effort to tackle antisemitism . demonstration against the war in gaza continue to take place across the u , and at event attended by u president joe biden . pro-palestinian protester recently blocked major road across the country , restricting access to airport including chicago 's o'hare international and seattle-tacoma international , a well a the golden gate bridge in san francisco and brooklyn bridge in new york .
