Body Text: the un 's top court is hearing israel 's response to a case brought by south africa seeking an emergency halt to it offensive in rafah . south africa ha also accused israel of genocide in the gaza war.israel , which ha called south africa 's case `` wholly unfounded `` and `` morally repugnant `` , responded on friday accusing south africa of bringing `` biased and false claim `` . the word of the international court of justice ( icj ) have been subject to intense scrutiny since south africa brought it case and it ’ s centred around the use of the word “ plausible ” in the ruling.in january , the icj delivered an interim judgement - and one key paragraph from the ruling drew the most attention : “ in the court ’ s view , the fact and circumstance . . . are sufficient to conclude that at least some of the right claimed by south africa and for which it is seeking protection are plausible . ” this wa interpreted by many , including some legal commentator , to mean that the court had concluded that the claim that israel wa committing genocide in gaza wa “ plausible ” . this interpretation spread quickly , appearing in un press release , statement from campaign group and many medium outlet , including the bbc.in april , however , joan donoghue , the president of the icj at the time of that ruling , said in a bbc interview that this wa not what the court had ruled.rather , she said , the purpose of the ruling wa to declare that south africa had a right to bring it case against israel and that palestinian had “ plausible right to protection from genocide ” - right which were at a real risk of irreparable damage . the judge had stressed they did not need to say for now whether a genocide had occurred but concluded that some of the act south africa complained about , if they were proven , could fall under the united nation ’ convention on genocide.let ’ s look at the background of the case and how the legal dispute unfolded.the icj wa set up to deal with dispute between the nation of the world relating to international law.that mean law that are agreed between nation , such a the genocide convention , a key measure agreed after world war two to try to prevent such mass slaughter again.last december , south africa launched an attempt at the icj to prove that , in it view , israel wa committing genocide in relation to how it wa perpetrating the war against hamas in the gaza strip.it alleged that the way israel had prosecuted the war wa “ genocidal in nature ” because , according to the south african case , there wa an intention to “ destroy palestinian in gaza ” . israel absolutely rejected these allegation , saying the entire case misrepresented what wa happening on the ground.south africa would need to show the court clear and hard evidence of an alleged plan to commit genocide . israel , for it part , would have a right to examine those claim one by one and argue that it action , in a dreadful urban war , were legitimate self-defence against hamas , which is designated a a terrorist group by dozen of country . that full case could take year to prepare and argue.so south africa asked the icj judge to first issue “ provisional measure ” . that ’ s the icj ’ s term for a court injunction - an order from a judge to freeze a situation , to prevent any harm being done , before a final court finding can be reached . the court wa asked to order israel to take step to “ protect against further , severe and irreparable harm to the right of the palestinian people ” . over two day lawyer for both country argued over whether palestinian in gaza had right that the court need to protect.the ruling , to which 17 judge contributed ( with some of them disagreeing ) , came on 26 january . “ at this stage of the proceeding , the court is not called upon to determine definitively whether the right which south africa wish to see protected exist , ” said the icj . “ it need only decide whether the right claimed by south africa , and for which it is seeking protection , are plausible . “ in the court ’ s view , the fact and circumstance . . . are sufficient to conclude that at least some of the right claimed by south africa and for which it is seeking protection are plausible . ” having decided that palestinian in gaza had plausible right under the genocide convention , it concluded that they were at real risk of irreparable damage - and israel should take step to prevent genocide from occurring while these critical issue remain in question.the court did not rule whether israel had committed genocide - but did it wording mean that it wa convinced there wa a risk of that happening ? this is where the dispute over what the court actually meant then took off.in april , some 600 british lawyer including four former supreme court justice , signed a letter to the uk prime minister , asking him to stop arm sale to israel and referring to “ a plausible risk of genocide ” . that triggered a counter-letter from uk lawyer for israel ( uklfi ) . the 1,300-strong group said the icj had only ruled that gaza palestinian had a plausible right to be protected from genocide - in other word , that it had been dealing with a complex and somewhat abstract legal argument.the dispute continued in more letter and interpretations.many in the first group described uklfi ’ s interpretation a “ empty wordplay ” . the court , they argued , can not have been solely concerned with an academic question - because the stake were far higher than that.and , of all place , the debate crystallised in legal sparring before a uk parliamentary committee , debating the question of arm export to israel.lord sumption , a former uk supreme court justice , told the committee : “ i think it is being suggested [ in the uklfi letter ] that all that the icj wa doing wa accepting , a a matter of abstract law , that the inhabitant of gaza had a right not to be subjected to genocide . i have to say that i regard that proposition a barely arguable . ” not so , responded natasha hausdorff of uk lawyer for israel . “ i respectfully insist that reading a finding of plausible risk that israel is committing genocide disregard the court ’ s unambiguous statement , ” she replied.a day later , joan donoghue - now retired from the icj - appeared on the bbc ’ s hardtalk programme and explicitly tried to end the debate by setting out what the court had done . “ it did not decide - and this is something where i 'm correcting what 's often said in the medium . . . that the claim of genocide wa plausible , ” said the judge . “ it did emphasise in the order that there wa a risk of irreparable harm to the palestinian right to be protected from genocide . but the shorthand that often appears , which is that there 's a plausible case of genocide , is n't what the court decided . ” whether there is any evidence of such terrible harm is a question the court is far from deciding .

Body Text: israel 's soldier are sharing footage of palestinian detention in the occupied west bank , despite the army 's pledge to act on previous misconduct revealed by the bbc . legal expert say have been disciplined or suspended in the event of `` unacceptable behaviour `` . it did not comment on the individual incident or soldier we identified . international law say detainee must not be exposed to unnecessary humiliation or public curiosity , yet human right expert say the posting of detention footage doe just that . in february , bbc verify reported on idf soldier ' misconduct on social medium during the war in gaza which began after a 7 october hamas attack on israel , which killed about 1,200 people . more than 252 others were taken hostage . more than 34,000 people have since been killed by israel 's offensive in gaza , the territory 's hamas-run health ministry say . during our earlier investigation , we noticed - and began looking into - a similar pattern of behaviour in the west bank , which ha experienced a spike in violence over the same period . despite the bbc 's previous reporting on israeli soldier ' social medium misconduct , and the military 's subsequent promise to act on our finding , a former israeli soldier , ori givati , say he is far from shocked to hear that this activity is continuing . a spokesperson for breaking the silence - an organisation for former and serving israeli soldier which work to expose alleged wrongdoing in the israel defense force ( idf ) - mr givati added that in fact he believed current far-right political rhetoric in the country is encouraging it further . `` there are no repercussion . they [ israeli soldier ] get encouraged and supported by the highest minister of the government , `` he said . and he say this play into a mindset that the military already subscribes to . `` the culture in the military , when it come to palestinian , is that they are only target . they are not human being . this is how the military teach you to behave . `` israel ha built about 160 settlement housing some 700,000 jew since it occupied the west bank and east jerusalem - land the palestinian want a part of a future state - in the 1967 middle east war . the majority of the international community considers the settlement illegal under international law , although israel dispute this . our analysis found that the 45 social medium video and photo that we examined were posted by 11 soldier of the kfir brigade , which is the largest infantry brigade in the idf and mainly operates in the west bank . all 11 are , or were , serving soldier , and did not hide their identity on social medium . four are from a kfir brigade reservist battalion - the 9213 - whose area of operation appears to be in the northern part of the west bank , according to our analysis of their social medium video . we asked the idf about the action of the individual soldier we have named and whether they have been disciplined , but they did not respond . we also attempted to contact these soldier on their public social medium account to put our finding to them . one appears to have blocked u and the others did not reply at the time of writing . the most prolific of these soldier post under the name yohai vazana . many of his video show his battalion entering home at night and detaining palestinian - often binding their hand and blindfolding them . woman are seen panicking a they are filmed without their headscarf . mr vazana - a self-proclaimed `` digital creator `` whose forearm bear tattoo saying `` never forget never forgive , 7/10 `` - often refers to his operation a `` hunt `` . his military insignia , visible in the video , suggests he carry the rank of sergeant major . he ha posted 22 video and photo on facebook and tiktok , from what appear to be bodycam footage of patrol , showing the detention of palestinian . tiktok confirmed that two video we highlighted , which had not been taken down on it platform , have now been removed for violating it guideline which `` make clear that we do not tolerate content that seek to degrade victim of violent tragedy `` . meta , the company that owns facebook , explained that it is reviewing the content and will remove any video that violate it policy . this photo , a screenshot from one of yohai vazana 's video , show member of his battalion forcefully entering a home and posing in front of a palestinian woman with a child . fellow soldier ofer bobrov feature in a number of shot with mr vazana . caption on his video often include the hashtag `` 9213 `` , suggesting he is from mr vazana 's battalion . mr bobrov 's video of his military operation are posted alongside clip of soldier dancing and partying , getting ready for patrol , and other snippet from their everyday life . one video posted on 12 february on tiktok includes several photo of a detainee blindfolded and bound on the floor a a soldier pose with the israeli flag behind him . another soldier from the same battalion , who go by sammy ben online , ha posted eight video and one photo of palestinian detainee on instagram . the detained palestinian are frequently shown blindfolded and restrained , having been forced to either lie on the floor , or squat , with their hand bound behind their back , in what are often referred to by military and law enforcement a `` stress position `` . mr ben say in the post that he and his fellow soldier have detained `` terrorist `` and claim to have found hamas flag on them . israel - like the uk , u and other country - proscribes hamas a a terrorist organisation . in one video , mr ben , who ha also served with idf force in gaza , mock two detained palestinian , ordering them to say : `` am yisrael chai `` , meaning `` the people of israel live `` . ori dahbash is another member of the same battalion who ha posted footage of military operation in the west bank , including a photo of a detainee that ha also been shared by mr vazana . expert said the footage posted by the soldier could violate international law . dr mark elli , executive director of the international bar association , called for an investigation into the incident in the footage , and for the idf to discipline the soldier involved . international human right lawyer sir geoffrey nice , who worked with the international criminal tribunal for the former yugoslavia ( icty ) between 1998 and 2006 , agreed with dr elli , but wa sceptical anyone would be held to account for their action . in response to our investigation , the idf replied : `` the idf hold it soldier to a professional standard … and investigates when behavior is not in line with the idf 's value . in the event of unacceptable behavior , soldier were disciplined and even suspended from reserve duty . `` additionally , soldier are instructed to avoid uploading footage of operational activity to social medium network . `` the idf 's response did not acknowledge that it had pledged to act on our earlier finding on similar social medium misconduct , in gaza . mr givati , former israeli commander in the west bank , said he felt ashamed and disgusted by israeli soldier ' treatment of detainee . `` we should treat them with the same dignity that we would like to be treated with , `` he told the bbc . he said the behaviour reflected how he felt israeli society view palestinian , and called into question it claim to abide by international law . `` we have no future a a society if we continue behaving this way , `` he said . what do you want bbc verify to investigate ?

freedom ; antisemites can not destroy u . `` he told bfmtv . `` so we 're asking the community to light the candle this sabbath evening and come to the synagogue if you can . `` mr teillet said two investigation were under way - into an arson attack on a place of worship and into the use of a police weapon outside the building.although the officer wa currently in custody , the prosecutor said that video footage indicated he had used his gun `` according to condition allowed by the internal security code `` . interior minister gérald darmanin visited the synagogue and praised police for europe , ha seen a surge in antisemitism since hamas attacked southern israel last october leading to the current war in gaza.earlier this week a memorial in paris that honour 3,900 men and woman who helped rescue jew during the nazi occupation of france in world war two wa daubed with red-painted hands.president emmanuel macron said defacing the wall undermined the memory of france 's hero and it victim of the holocaust.france ha the third largest jewish community in the world , after israel and the u . the head of france 's council of jewish institution ( crif ) , yonathan arfi , said that `` setting a synagogue on fire - that 's intending to intimidate every jew `` . another leading figure in the jewish community , elie korchia , thanked police for their quick response to `` a new antisemitic drama in our country `` . the president of rouen 's union of muslim , imam bachar el sayidi , visited the synagogue on friday in a message of solidarity : `` we firmly condemn what ha still on the run .

pfa ) called for a vote to exclude israel at fifa 's congress in bangkok on friday , which wa supported in the room by the jordanian fa.fifa president gianni infantino said it wa a matter for the fifa council to make a decision on , following a legal assessment . `` how much more must the palestine football family suffer for fifa to act with the same severity and urgency a it did in other case ? `` pfa president jibril rajoub said . `` doe fifa consider some war to be more important than others and some victim to be more significant ? `` i ask you to stand on the right side of history . the suffering of million , including thousand of footballer , deserves a much . if not now , then when ? mr president , the ball is in your court . `` the war in gaza began after a 7 october hamas attack on israel , which killed about 1,200 people . more than 252 others were taken hostage . more than 34,000 people have since been killed by israel 's offensive in gaza , the territory 's hamas-run health ministry says.shino moshe zuares , the president of the israel football association , said : `` we are facing a cynical political and hostile attempt by the palestinian association to harm israeli football . `` seven month after the terrible day , when football match can not be played in large part of israel , north and south , and over 130 israeli are still being held in gaza , it is injustice that even in these circumstance we find ourselves fighting for our basic right to be part of the game . `` infantino said a legal assessment of the allegation made by the pfa would be undertaken urgently , with the fifa council convening an extraordinary congress in late july to address the issue . `` football should not and should never become a hostage for politics and always remain a vector for peace , a source of hope , a force of good , uniting people rather than dividing , `` infantino said . `` this legal assessment will have to allow for input and claim of both member association . the result of this analysis and the recommendation which will follow from this analysis will subsequently be forwarded to the fifa council . `` infantino ha played down the prospect of legal threat over plan for a 32-team men 's club world cup next summer.the world governing body face a legal threat from player ' union fifpro and the world league association if it continues with plan to host the tournament.earlier this month , fifpro and the wla said the global football calendar is `` beyond saturation `` and that `` player are being pushed beyond their limit `` . speaking at fifa 's 74th congress infantino said he hoped fifpro and the wla should stop this `` futile debate `` . `` even with the new club world cup of fifa with 32 team and 63 match every four year , fifa is organising around 1 % of the game of the top club in the world , `` he said . `` all other match , 98 , 99 % , are organised by the different league , association , confederation , by all of you , - and that 's good . `` but here come the thing - the one or two per cent of match that fifa organises is financing football all over the world . `` manchester city and chelsea are among the 12 european representative at the expanded club world cup , to be held in the usa between 13 june and 15 july 2025 . `` the revenue that we generate are not just going to a few club in one country . the revenue that we generate are going to 211 country all over the world . `` there is no other organisation that doe that . so i hope these figure - which you can of course check and calculate - should probably stop this futile debate which is really pointless . `` infantino said 70 % of fifa 's member association `` would have no football `` without without the governing body 's resource .

which israel seized last week - should `` open immediately `` . israel and egypt blame each other for it closure . the pier is expected to provide access for 90 truckloads of aid at first , increasing to 150 once it is fully operational.british personnel have been working with u counterpart aboard rfa cardigan bay to build and operate the pier.the u began building the floating base week ago to facilitate the delivery of aid to gaza a israel continues it military campaign against hamas.hundreds of tonne of aid arrived in cyprus on wednesday where it wa screened before being loaded on to ship for delivery to the pier.smaller u military vessel - capable of carrying between five and 15 lorry of aid - then transported it to the floating pier , which is several hundred metre long and fixed to the beach in gaza.the lorry travelled along the pier before dropping off the aid at a marshalling yard on the beach.authorities said that the un , primarily the world food programme , would be responsible for the onward distribution of aid.the israeli offensive began after hamas gunman burst into southern israel on 7 october , killing 1,200 people and taking 252 others back to gaza a hostages.more than 35,000 palestinian have been killed since then , according to the hama-run health ministry figure . mr kirby also said that 17 u doctor who had been stuck in gaza since israel took control of the rafah crossing had been able to leave . they were evacuated on friday through the kerem shalom crossing , u diplomat are quoted a saying . that crossing wa also shut by israel last week , but later reopened.deliveries to gaza have considerably slowed down . sending aid by land can be dangerous , with convoy at time looted by gang and mobbed by desperate civilians.in april , seven aid worker from the organisation world central kitchen were killed by an israeli drone strike .

in a country which once prided itself on strong enthusiastic participation in this exercise . recent election , including the contest in 2021 which brought raisi to the presidency , were also marked by the systematic exclusion of moderate and pro-reform rival by the oversight body . “ early presidential election could provide khamenei and the upper echelon of the state with an opportunity to no indication of the state being ready and willing to take such a step . ” but , even within raisi ’ s rank , there appears to be no obvious successor . “ there are different camp within this conservative group , including individual who are more hardline and others regarded a more pragmatic , ” point out hamidreza azizi , a visiting fellow at swp , the berlin-based think tank . he belief decision-making authority in the islamic republic lie with the supreme leader . foreign policy , especially in the region , is the preserve of the islamic revolution guard corp ( irgc ) who wield growing power.the president didn ’ t call the shot month ago when iran confronted unprecedented tension with it arch-enemy israel over the devastating israel gaza war . it triggered a dangerous watch , the islamic republic wa also shaken by an extraordinary wave of protest sparked by the death in custody in september 2022 of 22-year-old mahsa amini who wa detained by morality police for allegedly violating iran ’ s strict dress code.weeks before the unrest , raisi had ordered a tightening of iran ’ s “ hijab and chastity law ” which obligated woman to behave and dress modestly including wearing a headscarf . but the protest spearheaded by a young generation of woman , lashing out against a raft of restriction imposed on their life , mainly focused their fury on the real source of power , the supreme leader and the system itself . human right group say hundred were killed in the crackdown and thousand detained . “ having been elected with the lowest recorded turnout in presidential election in iranian history , raisi did not have the popular mandate of his predecessor rouhani , “ say shabani in reference to the reformist leader hassan rouhani whose initial popularity wa partly fuelled by the 2015 landmark nuclear deal which fell apart when president trump unilaterally pulled the u out three year later . indirect talk between president biden ’ s administration and raisi ’ s team made little progress . “ he avoided much of the ire which wa directed at rouhani by opponent of the islamic republic , partly because he wa simply seen a less case to the world and find way to ease the punishing impact of sanction . during the urgent diplomacy around the israel-gaza war , he wa the voice on the phone and the face at meeting with iran ’ s ally , a well a with arab and western foreign minister anxious to calm and contain tension . “ he wa a useful channel to pas message , ” commented a senior western diplomatic source . “ but it tended to be quite formulaic since power did not lie in the foreign ministry . ” “ the sudden death of a president is normally a consequential event but , despite being seen a a potential supreme leader , he lacked political support and any clear political vision , ” maintains analyst esfandyar batmanghelidj , ceo of the bourse and bazaar think tank . “ but the political operator who got him elected will Body Text: medical worker in israel have told the bbc that palestinian detainee from gaza are routinely kept shackled to hospital bed , blindfolded , sometimes naked , and forced to wear nappy – a practice one medic said amounted to “ torture ” . a whistle-blower detailed how procedure in one military hospital were “ routinely ” carried out without painkiller , causing “ an unacceptable amount of pain ” to detainees.another whistle-blower said painkiller were used “ selectively ” and “ in a very limited way ” during an invasive medical procedure on a gazan detainee in a public hospital.he also said critically ill patient being held in makeshift military facility were being denied proper treatment because of a reluctance by public hospital to transfer and treat them . one detainee , taken from gaza for questioning by the israeli army and later released , told the bbc his leg had to be amputated because he wa denied treatment for an infected wound.a senior doctor working inside the military hospital at the centre of the allegation denied that any amputation were the direct result of condition there , but described the shackle and other restraint used by guard a “ dehumanisation ” . the israeli army said detainee at the facility were treated “ appropriately and carefully ” . the two whistle-blower the bbc spoke to were both in position to assess the medical treatment of detainee . both asked to remain anonymous because of the sensitivity of the issue among their colleagues.their account are supported by a report , published in february by physician for human right in israel , which said that israel ’ s civilian and military prison had become “ an apparatus of retribution and revenge ” and that detainee ’ human right were being violated - in particular their right to health . concern over the treatment of sick and injured detainee have centred on a military field hospital , at the sde teiman military base in southern israel.the field hospital wa set up by israel ’ s health ministry after the hamas attack specifically to treat gazan detainee , after some public hospital and staff expressed a reluctance to treat fighter captured on the day of the hamas attacks.since then , israeli force have rounded up large number of people from gaza and taken them to base like sde teiman for interrogation . those suspected of fighting for hamas are sent to israeli detention centre ; many others are released back to gaza without charge.the army doe not publish detail of the detainee it is holding . patient at the sde teiman hospital are kept blindfolded and permanently shackled to their bed by all four limb , according to several medic responsible for treating patient there.they are also made to wear nappy , rather than use a toilet.israel ’ s army said in response that handcuffing of detainee in the sde teiman hospital wa “ examined individually and daily , and carried out in case where the security risk requires it ” . it said that nappy [ diaper ] were used “ only for detainee who have undergone medical procedure for which their movement is limited ” . but witness , including the facility ’ s senior anaesthiologist , yoel donchin , say both the use of nappy and handcuff are universal in the hospital ward . “ the army create the patient to be 100 % dependent , like a baby , ” he said . “ you are cuffed , you are with diaper , you need water , you need everything – it ’ s dehumanisation ” . dr donchin said there wa no individual assessment of the need for restraint , and that even those patient who were unable to walk – for example , those with leg amputation – were handcuffed to the bed . he described the practice a “ stupid ” . two witness at the facility in the early week of the gaza war told u that patient there were kept naked under the blankets.one doctor with knowledge of condition there said prolonged cuffing to bed would cause “ huge suffering , horrible suffering ” , describing it a “ torture ” and saying patient would start to feel pain after a few hours.others have spoken of the risk of long-term nerve-damage . footage of gazan detainee released after interrogation show injury and scarring around their wrist and legs.last month , israel ’ s daily haaretz newspaper published allegation made by a doctor at the sde teiman site that leg amputation had been carried out on two prisoner , because of cuffing injuries.the allegation were made , the paper said , in a private letter sent by the doctor to government minister and the attorney-general , in which such amputation were described a “ unfortunately a routine event ” . the bbc ha not been able to independently verify this allegation.dr donchin said that amputation were not the direct result of cuffing and had involved other factor – such a infection , diabetes or problem with blood vessel . israeli medical guideline stipulate that no patient should be restrained unless there is a specific security reason for doing so , and that the minimum level of restraint should be used.the head of the country ’ s medical ethic board , yossi walfisch , after a visit to the site , said all patient had a right to be treated without being handcuffed , but that the safety of staff prevailed over other ethical consideration . “ terrorist are given proper medical treatment , ” he said in a published letter , “ with the aim of keeping restraint to a minimum and while maintaining the safety of the treating staff . ” many gazans detained by israel ’ s army are released without charge after interrogation.dr donchin said complaint from medical staff at the sde teiman military hospital had led to change , including a shift to looser handcuff . he said he insisted on guard removing restraint before any surgical procedure . “ it ’ s not pleasant to work there , ” he said . “ i know it ’ s against the ethical code to treat someone cuffed in the bed . but what ’ s the alternative ? is it better to let them die ? i don ’ t think so . ” but report suggest the attitude of medical staff towards detainee vary widely , in both military and civilian hospital . a whistle-blower who worked at the sde teiman field hospital back in october , shortly after the hamas attack on israel , described case of patient being given inadequate amount of painkiller , including anaesthetic.he said a doctor once refused his request that an elderly patient be given painkiller while they were opening up a recent , infected amputation wound . “ [ the patient ] started trembling from pain , and so i stop and say ‘ we can ’ t go on , you need to give him analgesia ’ , ” he said.the doctor told him it wa too late to administer it.the witness said such procedure were “ routinely done without analgesia ” resulting in “ an unacceptable amount of pain ” . on another occasion , he wa asked by a suspected hamas fighter to intercede with the surgical team to increase the level of morphine and anaesthetic during repeated surgeries.the message wa passed on , but the suspect again regained consciousness during the next operation and wa in a lot of pain . the witness said both he and other colleague felt there wa a sense in which it had been a deliberate act of revenge.the army said in response to these allegation that violence against detainee wa “ absolutely prohibited ” , and that it regularly briefed it force on the conduct required of them . any concrete detail of violence or humiliation would be examined , it said . a second whistle-blower said the situation at sde teiman wa only part of the problem , which extended into public hospital . the bbc is calling him “ yoni ” to protect his identity.in the day that followed the 7 october attack , he said , hospital in southern israel were faced with the challenge of treating both wounded fighter and wounded victim , often in the same emergency departments.hamas gunman had just attacked israeli community along the border fence with gaza , killing about 1,200 people and kidnapping some 250 others . “ the atmosphere wa extremely emotional , ” yoni said . “ hospital were completely overwhelmed , both psychologically and in term of capacity . ” “ there were instance where i heard staff discus whether detainee from gaza should get painkiller . or way to perform certain procedure that can turn the treatment into punishment . ” conversation like this were not uncommon , he said , even if actual instance appeared very rare . “ i have knowledge of one case where painkiller were used selectively , in a very limited way , during a procedure , ” he told the bbc . “ the patient did not receive any explanation of what wa going on . so , if you put together [ that ] someone is undergoing an invasive procedure , which involves even incision , and doesn ’ t know about that , and is blindfolded , then the line between treatment and assault thins out . ” we asked the health ministry to respond to these allegation , but they directed u to the idf . yoni also said that the sde teiman field hospital wa not equipped to treat severely injured patient , but that some of those held there in the early month of the war had fresh gunshot wound to the chest and abdomen.he said at least one critically ill man wa kept there because of a reluctance by public hospital to accept his transfer for treatment , adding that doctor at the base were “ frustrated ” by the situation.sufian abu salah , a 43-year-old taxi driver from khan youis , wa one of dozen of men detained during raid by israel 's army and taken to a military base for questioning.he said soldier carried out severe beating during the journey and also on arrival at the base , where he wa denied treatment for a minor wound on his foot , which then became infected . “ my leg got infected and turned blue , and a soft a a sponge , ” he told the bbc.after a week , he said , the guard took him to hospital , beating him on his injured leg on the way . two operation to clean his wound did not work , he told the bbc . “ afterwards , they took me to a public hospital , where the doctor gave me two option : my leg or my life . ” he chose his life . after they amputated his leg , he wa sent back to the military base , and later released back to gaza . `` this period wa mental and physical torture , ” he said . “ i can ’ t describe it . i wa detained with two leg and now i have only one . every now and then , i cry . ” the idf did not respond to the specific allegation about sufian ’ s treatment , but said the claim of violence towards him during his arrest or detention “ were unknown and will be examined ” . in the day after the 7 october attack , israel ’ s health ministry issued a directive that all gazan detainee should be treated in military or prison hospital , with the sde teiman field hospital created specifically to fill this role.the decision won the backing of many in israel ’ s medical establishment , with yossi walfisch , praising it a the solution to “ an ethical dilemma ” , which would remove responsibility for treating “ hamas terrorist ” from the public health system.others have called for the closure of sde teiman , describing the situation there a “ an unprecedented low point for the medical profession , and medical ethic . ” “ my fear is that what we ’ re doing in sde teiman won ’ t allow a return to the way it wa before , ” one doctor told the bbc . “ because thing that looked unreasonable to u before , will look reasonable when this crisis is over . ” yoel donchin , the anaesthesiologist , said medical staff at the field hospital sometimes gathered together to cry over the situation there . “ the moment our hospital close , ” he said , “ we ’ ll celebrate . ” additional reporting by : naomi scherbel-ball , gidi kleiman , aisha kherallah

Body Text: israeli defence minister yoav gallant ha rejected the arrest warrant sought by the international criminal court 's prosecutor for him and prime minister benjamin netanyahu.mr gallant said military campaign to eliminate hamas , during which at least 35,640 people have been killed in gaza , according to the territory 's hamas-run health ministry.mr khan accused the hamas leader of crime against humanity and war crime including extermination , murder , the taking of hostage , rape and torture.for the israeli leader , the accusation included deliberate attack on civilian , and the use of starvation a a weapon of war , a well a extermination and murder . `` international law and the law of armed conflict apply to all , `` mr khan said . `` no foot soldier , no commander , no civilian leader - no-one - can act with impunity . ” in a statement , mr gallant insisted that israeli force were fighting in gaza “ in accordance with international law , while taking unprecedented measure to facilitate humanitarian aid ” . “ i stand with , support , and commend our troop , who are defending our people and fulfilling the extraordinary privilege and obligation of defending ourselves , by ourselves , ” he said.he added : “ the attempt made by the icc prosecutor karim khan to turn thing around will not succeed - the parallel he ha drawn between the hamas terrorist organization and the state of israel is despicable . ” mr gallant reiterated that israel wa not a signatory of the rome statute , the icc ’ s founding treaty , and did not recognise it authority . “ karim khan 's attempt to deny the state of israel the right to defend herself and ensure the release of the hostage held in gaza must be rejected explicitly . ” there wa no immediate response from mr khan to the remark or to the statement made by mr netanyahu , who denounced the warrant application for him and mr gallant a a “ moral outrage of historic proportion ” . hamas - which is proscribed a a terrorist organisation by israel , the u , uk and other country - demanded the “ cancellation of all arrest warrant issued against leader of the palestinian resistance ” and denounced what it called mr khan 's `` attempt . . . to equate the victim with the executioner `` . the group also complained that the application for warrant against mr netanyahu and mr gallant had come “ seven month late ” , and that other israeli political and military leader had not been named alongside them . the israeli government also urged on tuesday “ the nation of the civilised , free world - nation who despise terrorist and anyone who support them - to stand by israel ” . “ make sure the icc understands where you stand , ” spokesman tal heinrich told a briefing . “ oppose the prosecutor 's decision and declare that , even if warrant are issued , you do not intend to enforce them . because this is not about our leader . it 's about our survival . `` the u ambassador to israel , jack lew , said there wa no comparison between `` action taken by a democratic government here with the behaviour of a terrorist organisation that is fighting in a way that ha created these condition `` . “ i do n't think that a day ha gone by that i have n't worked with either the prime minister or the defence minister or somebody in their immediate circle on how you get humanitarian assistance to starving people , `` is no moral equivalence between a democratic state exercising it lawful right to self-defence and the terrorist group hamas . `` italy ’ s foreign minister , antonio tajani , said it wa “ truly singular , i would say unacceptable , to equate a government legitimately elected by the people in a democracy with a terrorist organisation ” . and czech prime minister petr fiala described the to attend the public mourning sessions.typically , government employee and schoolchildren attend such event en masse , while others take part out of patriotism , curiosity or to witness historic the servant of the disadvantaged `` . some resident in tehran received text urging them to attend wednesday 's ceremony , the afp news agency reported.footage carried by state tv showed street filled according to israeli tallies.more than 35,000 palestinian in gaza have so far been killed by the israeli military in response , gaza 's hamas-run health ministry say . also on wednesday morning , israel announced it would recall it envoy to ireland and norway `` for urgent consultation `` . `` i am sending ireland and norway a clear message : israel will not back down against those who undermine it sovereignty and endanger it security , `` foreign minister israel katz said . `` today ’ s decision sends a message to the palestinian and the world : terrorism pay , `` he said . `` after the hamas terror organisation carried out the largest massacre of jew since the holocaust , after committing heinous sexual crime witnessed by the world , these country chose to reward hamas and iran by recognizing a palestinian state , `` mr katz said . `` this distorted step by these country is an injustice to the memory of the victim of 7/10 , a blow to effort to return the 128 hostage , and a boost to hamas and iran 's jihadist , which undermines the chance for peace and question israel ’ s right to self-defence . `` hamas , which control gaza and is currently at war with israel , said wednesday 's announcement would be a `` turning point in the international position on the palestinian issue `` . in a statement to afp , bassem naim , a senior hamas figure , said the `` brave resistance `` of the palestinian people wa behind the move.hamas 's rival , the palestinian authority ( pa ) - which control part of the israeli-occupied west bank - said norway , spain and ireland had demonstrated their `` unwavering commitment `` to `` delivering the long overdue justice to the palestinian people . `` addressing the `` people of israel `` , mr harris said : `` ireland is resolute and unequivocal in recognising the state of israel and israel ’ s right to exist securely and in peace with it neighbour . `` `` let me be clear that ireland condemns the barbaric massacre carried out by hamas on 7 october last , `` he said.mr harris called for the release of hostage taken by hamas `` to the arm of their loved one `` , but added that `` hamas is not the palestinian people `` . `` a two state solution is the only way out of the generational cycle of violence retribution and resentment , `` he said.tánaiste micheál martin said that ireland 's decision wa a `` clear and immutable statement of our deeply-held belief that there can be no peace in the middle east until the israeli and palestinian people alike enjoy the same right to self-determination , statehood , peace , security and dignity `` . he added that the move wa not `` a hostile act towards the state of israel `` . `` we acknowledge the heartbreak , loss and anguish of the israeli people , `` he said . green party leader eamon ryan said that ireland had “ learnt the hard way , that violence against innocent civilian to try and achieve political aim , can , and must never win `` . `` whether that be a car bomb on the street of omagh or jerusalem , be that a rocket landing in tel aviv , or a no warning blast in a birmingham pub , be that an assault on the kibbutz , or a bomb it sovereignty and security `` and a `` damaging to our bilateral relation `` . it said the israeli government ha recalled it ambassador in dublin dana erlich `` temporarily for consultation `` . `` we are disappointed by the irish government 's decision on recognition , which follows worrying initiative and statement in recent month , `` it said in a statement . dup mp ian paisley said the irish government 's move wa an attempt to appeal to the `` extreme element in irish society `` . in a statement , he said : `` the announcement by the dublin prime minister to recognise the state of palestine - even though he could not identify that state accurately on a map - will unfortunately only play into the hand of extremist , anti-jewish and anti-israel faction . `` ireland should brace itself for a run of abuse against people and business associated with israel , `` he continued . `` what is atrocious is that the announcement this morning did not have one word of condemnation of hamas terrorism on 7 october . `` however , taoiseach simon harris and tánaiste micheál martin both condemned the `` barbaric massacre `` carried out by hamas last october in their public statements.both leader also called again for the release of all hostage in gaza . in a statement , sinn féin president mary lou mcdonald td said the recognition `` must be the first step in the Body Text: the funeral of an aid worker killed in an air strike in gaza ha taken place in cornwall.jim henderson , 33 , wa among seven aid worker who died in the israeli attack in april.one of his brother , matt , said : `` he 's achieved so much in his life in a short period of time . `` cousin , helen moran , spoke on behalf of mr henderson 's parent and thanked the hundred of people who gathered to pay their respect at truro cathedral . m moran said : `` the family ha been deeply moved by the outpouring of support during this difficult time . `` this support ha been a source of comfort and a reminder of the impact jim had upon so many people . `` a son , a fiance , a brother and a friend , leaving u at such a young age is always a tragedy . `` to lose someone of james 's extraordinary character and decency overshadows the pain . `` about 700 people attended his funeral . several bearer of mr henderson 's coffin were in the royal marine 40 commando unit with him and paid tribute before the service began at 12:00 bst.jordan mcgrath worked alongside mr henderson in a counter-insurgency operation in afghanistan in 2012 . he said : `` you could always look to jim for reassurance or strength if you needed it . he wa a real pillar of the troop . `` it wa brilliant to know you 've got guy like jim with you . `` he wa incredible . he just embodied what it meant to be a royal marine commando - courage , determination , unselfishness . `` andrew campbell wa also deployed to afghanistan with mr henderson . he said : `` jim had the heart of a warrior , the soul of a humanitarian . `` it wa in his nature to help people who could n't help themselves . `` daniel christopher birks , who trained mr henderson in 2010 and led the troop he wa assigned to in afghanistan , said : `` he wa such a tower of strength , kind of like the model recruit . `` mr henderson 's role a a security adviser for the world central kitchen wa to ensure an aid convoy travelling in gaza followed safety procedure and remained on the correct route.the former royal marine had been in gaza for just over a week . mr henderson 's brother dan said : `` i do n't really think we knew how wide a scope of jim 's friend and people that he had real connection with until something like this happens . . . it make u very proud . `` the family had asked people who wanted to pay their respect to line the route and join them in the cathedral.bishop hugh nelson said the service marked a farewell and `` the celebration of a good life well-lived `` . childhood friend harry-james mill described mr henderson a `` a force to be reckoned with , an absolute warrior , an incredible friend `` . `` although we bid farewell to you let u take solace in knowing that you will never truly leave u for a long a we carry you in our heart . `` you will always be by our side . `` james henderson - our friend , our brother , our hero - you will live on , and your legacy will forever shine bright . `` rest in peace , dear friend , we will never forget you . `` follow bbc cornwall on x ( formerly twitter ) , facebook and instagram . send your story idea to spotlight @ bbc.co.uk .

Body Text: ireland , norway , and spain have announced they will formally recognise a palestinian state from 28 may.spain and ireland said the decision wa not against israel nor in favour of hamas , but rather in support of peace . israel reacted angrily , warning the move would mean more instability in the region and recalling it ambassador to all three country . both hamas and it rival , the palestinian authority , have welcomed the recognition . norway wa first to make it announcement wednesday in a move co-ordinated with the other two countries.prime minister jonas gahr støre said in an address that the move wa `` in support of moderate force that are on a retreating front in a protracted and cruel conflict `` . `` this is an investment in the only solution that can bring lasting peace in the middle east , `` he added , referring to the so-called two-state solution which would see an israeli and a palestinian state existing peacefully next to each other.ireland and spain followed suit soon after . `` today , we state clearly our unambiguous support for the equal right to security , dignity , and self-determination for the palestinian and israeli people , `` irish foreign minister micheál martin said.the country 's taoiseach ( prime minister ) simon harris later stressed that `` hamas is not the palestinian people `` . `` today 's decision to recognise palestine is taken to help create a peaceful future , `` he said . mr harris 's comment were echoed by spanish prime minister pedro sanchez , who said the move wa `` not against israel , is not against the jew `` . `` it is not in favour of hamas , which is something that ha been said . this recognition is not against anyone , it is in favour of peace and coexistence . `` israel reacted to the announcement with fury . prime minister benjamin netanyahu denounced the move by ireland , norway and spain a a `` reward for terrorism `` and said it would not bring peace.foreign minister israel katz said he wa ordering the immediate return of the israeli ambassador to all three country for `` consultation `` . `` israel will not go over this in silence - there will be other serious consequence , `` he said . mr katz also said the three country ' ambassador in israel will be summoned for `` reprimand talk `` , during which they will be shown a video of the abduction of female israeli soldier on 7 october . hamas , which control gaza and is currently at war with israel , said wednesday 's announcement would be a `` turning point in the international position on the palestinian issue `` . in a statement to afp , bassem naim , a senior hamas figure , said the `` brave resistance `` of the palestinian people wa behind the move.hamas 's rival , the palestinian authority ( pa ) - which control part of the israeli-occupied west bank - said norway , spain and ireland had demonstrated their `` unwavering commitment `` to `` delivering the long overdue justice to the palestinian people `` . also on wednesday , the israeli military approved the return of israeli citizen to the site of three settlement in the occupied west bank , which they had been banned from entering since 2005.israel 's parliament had voted to allow it citizen to return in march last year , but military permission wa needed for the bill to be enforced.most of the international community considers the settlement illegal under international law , though israel dispute this . the issue of palestinian statehood ha vexed the international community for decade . since the 7 october attack , israeli prime minister benjamin netanyahu ha doubled down on his opposition to such a plan , saying the creation of a palestinian state would compromise israel 's security . about 1,200 people were killed in the unprecedented attack on 7 october , when hamas gunman burst into israel . they took 252 others back to gaza a hostages.since then , more than 35,000 people , mostly civilian , have been killed in israel 's gaza offensive , according to the hamas-run health ministry.most of the world already recognises the state of palestine . earlier this month , 143 of the 193 member of the united nation general assembly voted in favour of it joining the un , something only state can do.before wednesday 's announcement , 17 european country recognised the state of palestine and most of those took the decision in 1988 when they were part of the soviet bloc . most other european country , and the u , still believe recognition should come only a part of a long-term two-state solution to the conflict.a white house spokesperson said u president joe biden wa a `` strong supporter `` of the two-state solution , and believed `` a palestinian state should be realised through direct negotiation , not through unilateral recognition `` . slovenia and malta have also said recently that they were considering a formal recognition . norway 's prime minister also said on wednesday that he hoped the recognition of palestinian statehood by the three country would bring renewed momentum to the peace talk . long-running negotiation in cairo aimed at securing a truce and further hostage release are currently stalled.meanwhile , the humanitarian situation in gaza continues to deteriorate . earlier this week , the un said food distribution in the southern gaza city of rafah had been suspended due to a lack of supply and insecurity . the chief prosecutor of the international criminal court ( icc ) recently applied for arrest warrant for mr netanyahu and hamas 's leader in gaza , yahya sinwar , for war crime . both israel and hamas have condemned the move . israel say an offensive in rafah is needed to eliminate hamas but the international community ha warned against it , saying it will greatly exacerbate the humanitarian crisis in gaza . correction 14 june 2024 : this article previously reported that before wednesday 's announcement , nine european country supported palestinian statehood . this ha been amended to make clear that 17 european country had recognised the state of palestine to this point .

Body Text: a fighting and suffering continues in gaza , and violence grows in the west bank , prospect of the palestinian people gaining their own state might seem further away than ever.several european country are pressing ahead with formally recognising the existence of a palestinian state , but they will not overcome the reality that such ambition still face huge obstacles.however , tuesday 's action by ireland , spain and norway , announced last week , will put pressure on other country in europe - including the uk , france and germany - to follow them in supporting palestinian self-determination . “ this is extremely significant , ” one arab diplomat said . “ it reflects european frustration with the israeli government ’ s refusal to listen . `` and it put pressure on the eu to follow suit . ” but israeli minister insist this will encourage hamas and reward terrorism , further reducing the chance of a negotiated settlement.most country - about 139 in all - formally recognise a palestinian state . on 10 may , 143 out of 193 member of the united nation ’ general assembly voted in favour of a palestinian bid for full un membership , something that is only open to state . palestine currently ha a kind of enhanced observer status at the un , which give them a seat but not a vote in the assembly . it is also recognised by various international organisation including the arab league and the organisation of islamic cooperation.a minority of european country already recognise a palestinian state . they comprise hungary , poland , romania , the czech republic , slovakia , and bulgaria which adopted the position 1988 ; and others including sweden and cyprus.but many european nation - and the united state - say they will recognise a palestinian state only a part of a long-term political solution to the conflict in the middle east . this is often referred to a the `` two-state solution `` where both israeli and palestinian agree to have their own state with their own borders.european country and the u differ over when they should recognise a palestinian state . ireland , spain and norway say they are doing so now to kick-start a political process . they argue there will be a sustained solution to the current crisis only if both side can aim at some kind of political horizon . these country are also responding to domestic political pressure to show more support for palestinians.in the past , the position of many western country wa that palestinian statehood should be a prize for a final peace agreement . but lord cameron , the uk foreign secretary , and some other european country have in recent month shifted their position , saying the recognition of palestinian statehood could come earlier , to help drive momentum towards a political settlement . in february , french president emmanuel macron said : “ the recognition of a palestinian state is not a taboo for france . ” and earlier this month , france supported palestinian membership of the un in the general assembly vote.the u ha privately discussed this issue with european ally , but is more cautious and want a clearer sense of what the policy would mean in practice . so the key debate behind the scene is about when these holdout country should recognise a palestinian state : when formal peace talk begin between israeli and palestinian , when israel and saudi arabia normalise diplomatic relation , when israel fails to undertake certain action , or when the palestinian take certain action . in other word , they want recognition of the state of palestine to be a big moment designed to achieve a diplomatic outcome . “ it is a big card that western country have to play , ” one western official said . “ we don ’ t want to throw it away . ” the problem is that recognising a palestinian state is largely a symbolic gesture if it doe not also address the vital concomitant question . what should the border be ? where should the capital be located ? what should both side do first to make it happen ? these are difficult question that have not been agreed - or even answered - satisfactorily for decades.as of last week , a few more country in europe now believe there should be a palestinian state.supporters will cheer the move , opponent will decry it . the grim reality for palestinian on the ground is unlikely to change .

Body Text: the brother of israeli hostage naama levy ha said the family ’ s decision to release new harrowing video of the moment his sister and other female hostage were kidnapped is to remind the world and world leader that they need to push for a deal to secure their release.nineteen-year-old naama and six other young woman were taken by hamas gunman from the nahal oz military base on 7 october , where they were serving a observer monitoring surveillance camera of the nearby gaza perimeter fence.in a hamas video previously seen around the world when she wa taken to gaza , naama wa shown with blood around the crotch of her trouser , with her hand tied and ankle cut.now , the family of naama and four of the other woman have decided to release further video footage filmed by the body camera worn by the hamas kidnapper . it show the moment they seized and tied up the teenager , having killed others at the base . warning : this article contains detail some reader may find disturbing . in the three minute of video , the gunman can be seen screaming at the woman , some still in their pyjama , most of whom have bloody face . they are tied up against a wall before being bundled into a jeep with obvious injuries.the gunman tell them in arabic : “ you dog , we will step on you . . . we will shoot you all . ” one say in english : `` you 're beautiful . `` naama , her face covered in blood , say to them in english : “ i have friend in palestine . ” she had previously been part of an israeli-palestinian peace initiative . her family have called her “ a peace seeker ” . naama ’ s brother , amit , is on a visit to london to campaign for his sister ’ s release . he said the indirect talk between israel and hamas to secure a gaza ceasefire and hostage release deal were in “ a very bad place ” . “ we hope that this video will encourage all side to get back to the table and understand that it ’ s an unbearable humanitarian issue that need to be solved , ” he told the bbc . “ this might be the last chance to save them . ” amit said that when he saw the video released on thursday it wa a “ very hard watch . . . seeing my little sister with such a . . . such a look in her eye ” . “ i never imagined i would see her this frightened and hurt , ” he added.but he also said he took strength from the video . “ we feel like she 's handling the situation like the true superhero she is , like a hero fighting for her life . ” of the seven female observer at nahal oz who were kidnapped , one – noa marciano - wa killed in gaza . the israeli military said troop found her body in a building near gaza city ’ s al-shifa hospital in november.another , ori megidish , wa rescued by israeli force during an operation inside gaza at the end of october.teenagers liri albag , 18 , karina ariev , 19 , daniela gilboa , 19 , and agam berger , 19 , are still being held along with naama . they have been hostage for 229 days.after seeing the video of naama with bloodied trouser when she wa kidnapped , and hearing the testimony of other hostage , her family are fearful about the risk of sexual assault . “ it ’ s very , very hard for u . it 's a fear ever since 7 october that doe n't leave me , doe n't leave anyone in the family , ” amit said . “ we realise that there is . . . there is a chance , maybe even a good chance , that naama and other girl and men are being harassed . and it 's a fear that is painful in way that are indescribable . we just have to keep fighting for her to get out of this hell . ” naama ’ s mother , ayelet , said in a statement : “ we only see in that video a fraction of the horrible thing that are going on in their surrounding in the shelter . “ she is terrified and wounded , there is fear in her eye , and she is saying what she can , she is begging for her life . “ the top priority is to bring her home , bring them all home now . ” the hostage and missing family forum said : “ the disturbing video ha been the reality of agam , daniela , liri , naama , karina , and 123 other hostage for 229 day . “ the video is a damning testament to the nation 's failure to bring home the hostage . the israeli government must not waste even one more moment and it must return to the negotiating table today . ” israeli prime minister benjamin netanyahu said he wa “ shocked ” by the footage and promised to do everything to bring the hostage home . “ the brutality of the hamas terrorist only strengthens my determination to fight with all my strength until the elimination of hamas , to ensure that what we saw tonight will never happen again , ” he wrote on x , formerly twitter.in a statement , hamas said the video footage had been “ manipulated ” and that it “ can not be verified ” .

Body Text: iran 's late president , ebrahim raisi , ha been buried in his home city of mashhad , four day after he wa killed in a helicopter crash.the 63-year-old hard-line cleric wa laid to rest in the holy shrine of imam reza , a revered figure in shia islam.tv picture showed large crowd gathered in one of the north-eastern city ’ s main street ahead of the ceremony.seven other people died in sunday 's crash during bad weather in iran 's mountainous north-west.they include raisi ’ s foreign minister , hossein amir-abdollahian , 60 , who wa buried on thursday at the shah abdol-azim shrine in rey , a southern suburb of the capital tehran.acting president mohammad mokhber , who will serve until an election is held on 28 june , wa present there to make preparation for the burial . ebrahim raisi ’ s burial at the gold-domed imam reza shrine - a memorial to the eighth shia imam - which is considered the holiest in iran , came after three day of ceremony elsewhere.state medium described thursday 's event a “ historic ” , while mashhad ’ s mayor wa quoted a saying that “ three million mourner ” had attended - a figure almost equal to the city ’ s entire population.earlier , thousand also turned out to watch his coffin being driven through the eastern city of birjand , where raisi had been the representative to the assembly of experts.on wednesday , leader and other dignitary from the country ’ s ally and neighbour attended a commemorative event in tehran.also present were representative of the so-called “ axis of resistance ” , a loose network of armed group which receive iranian weapon , training and funds.they included the political leader of the iran-backed palestinian armed group hamas , ismail haniyeh , the deputy secretary-general of lebanon ’ s hezbollah movement , naim qassem , the spokesman of yemen 's houthis , mohammed abdulsalam , and the head of iraq 's paramilitary popular mobilisation force , faleh al-fayad.senior western official were noticeably absent from the ceremony , reflecting their country ’ strained relation with iran.iran ’ s supreme leader , ayatollah ali khamenei , also led prayer for those killed . `` [ the president ’ s death ] wa a difficult issue for u , but the iranian nation will turn this bitter incident into an opportunity , ” he told the speaker of lebanon ’ s parliament , nabih berri.raisi wa close to the 85-year-old supreme leader , who is the ultimate authority in the islamic republic , and wa widely seen a a potential successor.tens of thousand of people have taken part in the funeral procession in recent day , which the government and state medium have portrayed a demonstration of national unity . `` how do i find someone like him ? i 'm really worried about that , `` mohsen , a cleric from qom , told afp news agency at wednesday ’ s funeral procession in tehran . `` a far a i know , we do n't have anyone of his stature . `` civil servant ali mousavi-nejad , said the presence of so many people “ sends a message to the enemy of the revolution ” . however , many more people have stayed at home , with some even celebrating the president ’ s death despite prosecutor warning that they could face prosecution.millions despised raisi for overseeing the deadly crackdown on the “ woman , life , freedom ” protest that erupted in 2022 , a year after he took office.he also faced call for an international investigation into his alleged role on the `` death committee `` which ordered the mass execution of political prisoner in the 1980s.his time a president will also be remembered for a deepening economic hardship and an unprecedented direct military confrontation with israel last month , which raised fear of a regional war.a female student , who took part in the protest two year ago , told the bbc : “ people are so happy . most of them are wearing white or bright colour and smiling at each other . ” “ the image they keep showing to the world [ is ] that we ’ re all sad , that we loved him . but it isn ’ t true . ” she added : “ today , when i attended my class , there wa a big banner of his face in the university ’ s main hallway . and the student would show the middle finger to his picture . ” the student also said the street of tehran were `` full of security patrol `` to deter protest or celebrations.hadi ghaemi , the director of the us-based center for human right in iran ( chri ) advocacy group , said raisi ’ s death should not be exploited to further crack down on civil society . “ raisi wa a pillar of a system that jail , torture , and kill people for daring to criticize state policy , ” he said . “ his death ha enabled him to escape being held accountable for his many crime and the state ’ s atrocity committed under his rule . ” iranian authority say they are still investigating what caused the helicopter crash in which he died.officials have said the aircraft - a decades-old , us-made bell 212 - hit a mountainside a it flew to the north-western city of tabriz in fog and heavy rain.raisi wa travelling with amir-abdollahian , the governor of east azerbaijan province , malek rahmati , and tabriz ’ s friday prayer leader , ayatollah mohammad ali al-e hashem , a well a the head of the presidential security team and the helicopter ’ s three crew following the inauguration of two dam on the border with azerbaijan .

Body Text: humanitarian assistance in gaza ha been “ systematically paralysed ” by restriction imposed by the warring party there , warns the norwegian refugee council.the organisation said 2,000 aid truck were stuck on the egyptian side of the rafah border crossing , which ha been closed since israel ’ s military launched an operation against hamas in the southern city of rafah on 6 may.suze van meegen , nrc ’ s head of operation for gaza , said palestinian were being “ actively deprived ” of much-needed shipment of medicine , tent , water tank , sanitary product and other basics.the israel defense force ( idf ) say it ha opened new crossing , paved road and fixed water pipe to ease the suffering of palestinian , and claim one million displaced people have evacuated from rafah , ahead of the fighting . m van meegen said : “ the city of rafah is now comprised of three entirely different world : the east is an archetypal war zone , the middle is a ghost town , and the west is a congested mass of people living in deplorable condition . ” she also claimed that some palestinian had been displaced up to nine time since the conflict began in october . “ people have no choice but to put their faith in so-called ‘ humanitarian safe zone ’ designated by the force that have killed their family member and destroyed their home . ” satellite image show how area previously covered with tent and makeshift shelter have been cleared since israel ’ s military operation in rafah started . there is also growing evidence of destruction of building and infrastructure in the city . idf spokesman rear admiral daniel hagari said force were operating in a “ targeted and precise ” way to eradicate remaining hamas battalion . “ hamas terrorist are waging war while embedding themselves inside and under civilian area in rafah - because hamas want gazan civilian to be caught in the crossfire . we don ’ t . ” amos harel , a defence journalist with the israeli newspaper haaretz , said force were making significant progress in taking control of the city and the philadelphi corridor , a narrow strip of land that run along the border with egypt . “ by now they ’ ve covered more than half of the philadelphi corridor and they didn ’ t see any serious hamas opposition in that area , ” he said . harel also belief israel ha been given a green light by the u to continue it military advance further into rafah , despite president joe biden having previously warned against going into “ population centre ” . “ it ’ s quite clear that the american are no longer trying to prevent israel from occupying rafah . so the israeli may proceed carefully and not too quickly . but it ’ s less of a question of whether the israeli are going to occupy rafah . it ’ s quite clear that they are . ” the international court of justice ( icj ) is expected to rule on friday whether the idf ’ s operation in rafah should be halted.south africa submitted the request to the un ’ s top court this month , a part of a case it filed in december that accused israel of genocide against the palestinian . israel ha accused south africa of presenting biased and false claims.an israeli government spokesman said : `` no power on earth will stop israel from protecting it citizen and going after hamas in gaza . ” there ’ s also been intense fighting in the north of gaza , especially around jabalia , where 27 patient and staff are refusing to leave the al-awda hospital despite israeli soldier ordering them to evacuate.most of the occupant have been moved following four day of military action around the hospital , but the deputy director , mohammed salha , told the bbc : “ i had a clear discussion with the israeli officer and i said to him i will not evacuate the hospital . if you can ’ t provide ambulance , sorry , i will not evacuate . ” the bbc understands that 14 staff member remain , along with 11 patient and two parent of child who are patient . mr salha added : “ if we evacuate , these patient will be lost , they will not get the health service they need . ” he said there wa only rainwater to drink and they were considering cutting meal to one per day to save food.he also said the hospital ’ s source of power wa running short . “ we are using a small generator a couple of hour a day to charge the battery in the hospital . ” “ we do not have any more clean water . the israeli force destroyed our filter system two month ago . we are completely dependent on company and organisation delivering fresh water , but because of the siege they are not getting through . ” eid sabeh , the nursing director at the nearby kamal adwan hospital , said his wa the only medical facility open to patient in the north gaza governorate.but he warned : “ the health situation at the hospital is catastrophic , especially with the imminent depletion of medical supply and the fuel needed to operate the generator . ” mahmoud al-sharif , who life in jabalia ’ s refugee camp , said the idf wa targeting civilian home and had besieged the al-awda hospital . “ the situation on the ground is dire , with the army besieging several area in jabalia and it camp , and we hear nothing but gunfire , ” he added.the idf wrote on x , formerly twitter , that it force were attempting to “ eliminate terrorist , and locate and destroy underground infrastructure ” .

Body Text: more than 200 university staff have signed an open letter in support of student pro-palestinian protesters.the academic at durham university have called on management to `` constructively Body Text: the family of a man who wa killed in an israeli air strike in gaza said their love for him wa “ deep , endless and eternal ” . john chapman , from poole , dorset , wa part of the security team delivering food with world central kitchen ( wck ) . he along with five other men and one woman were killed when their convoy wa hit in a missile strike on 1 april.his wife , tarnia , said he wa `` a fine example of a husband , of a father and of a really good human being ” . the former soldier had been working for solace global a a security contractor escorting a food convoy . he had previously worked with the royal marine and special boat service.wck said it convoy had been attacked by israel upon leaving a warehouse , killing seven and sparking an international outcry.the charity said the victim were british , polish , australian , palestinian and also included a dual us-canadian citizen . mr chapman and his wife have three adult children.their daughter fern , 24 , said : “ i will remember him a the best dad i could have ever asked for . there ’ s no one that compare to him and the love that he gave to all of u so , so strongly . “ the first thing that anyone remembers about him , especially u a a family , is his humour and his joke . i think we all adopted that throughout our life with him a well . ” spencer chapman , their son , said : “ i ’ m conflicted with such a variety of emotion , from sadness to pain , to deep , deep anger . “ it ’ s just such a waste . not his life , it ’ s a waste that it wa taken . and in such an unjust way . ” mr chapman said : “ i have been so blessed to have known his love , his strength , his kindness , his generosity , his loyalty , his humour . the list is endless . ” the 57-year-old ’ s funeral is due to take place on saturday . follow bbc south on facebook , x , or instagram . send your story idea to south.newsonline @ bbc.co.uk or via whatsapp on 0808 100 2240 .

Body Text: the body of three more israeli hostage have been recovered from gaza , the israel defense force ( idf ) have said.they are those of hanan yablonka , michel nisenbaum and orion hernandez , it said in a statement.the idf said the men 's body were recovered from the northern town of jabalia overnight in a joint operation with israel 's domestic intelligence agency.it come one week after three other hostage ' body were retrieved from gaza . the dead hostage were among 252 people who were taken captive when hamas gunman attacked israel on 7 october , killing about 1,200 people.there are about 125 still held in gaza , israel say . hanan yablonka , 42 , and orion hernandez , 32 , were killed after fleeing from the site of the nova music festival which wa ambushed by the gunman . more than 360 mainly young people were killed at the festival . michel nisenbaum , 59 , wa last heard of on his way to get his four-year-old granddaughter who wa with her father at an army base on the gaza border.orion hernandez wa the boyfriend of shani louk , whose body wa among the three recovered last week.israeli prime minister benjamin netanyahu posted on x : `` we have a national and moral duty to do everything we can to return our hostage - the living and the deceased - and that is what we are doing . `` israel relaunched an offensive on jabalia two week ago , month after pulling out , saying hamas force had regrouped there.the attack on 7 october triggered an israeli military campaign throughout the gaza strip with the declared aim of destroying the group and freeing the hostages.at least 35,800 palestinian have been killed in the war , according to gaza 's hamas-run health ministry .
