Body Text: when is a ceasefire not a ceasefire ? according to the israeli army , when it ’ s a “ local , tactical pause of military activity for humanitarian purpose ” . israel ’ s humanitarian aid coordinator for gaza set out the detail of the scheduled daily pause in fighting between 08:00 and 19:00 local time , along a key route running north from the kerem shalom crossing point , where aid is waiting to be delivered.the announcement almost immediately triggered a furious political assault from far-right government minister – and a rapid defence from israel ’ s army , insisting that it did not signal an end to the fighting in southern gaza , or any change to the entry of humanitarian aid.the fact that this announcement ha proved so explosive highlight the increasingly fraught situation of israel ’ s prime minister , caught between the cost of his vague and so far unattainable military goal of dismantling hamas and bringing home the hostage , and the political ally he relies on to stay in power . agency will still need to coordinate their movement with the israeli army , and the gaza director for the world food programme , matt hollingworth , said the test would be whether that coordination became smoother and faster a a result.but he also said that coordination wa only part of the obstacle agency faced in delivering aid inside gaza.sunday 's announcement `` doesn ’ t resolve the issue of insecurity and criminality , ” he said . “ and this is the most dangerous area of the gaza strip right now for moving aid . ” aid agency reported over the weekend that the continuing war wa fuelling acute malnutrition in part of gaza.israel is under pressure – from ngo , ally and it own high court – to get more aid into gaza.but prime minister benjamin netanyahu face stiff opposition from two far-right cabinet colleague , who say they will bring down his government if he agrees to end the war , and who see aid delivery a delaying israel ’ s victory.they reacted furiously to today ’ s announcement , with internal security minister , itamar ben-gvir , describing “ whoever made this decision ” a “ evil ” and “ a fool ” . finance minister , bezalel smotrich , said that humanitarian aid helped keep hamas in power and risked putting “ the achievement of the war down the drain ” . that the army could issue this message on a day when israel wa burying eleven of it soldier , he said , wa a symptom of the leadership giving too much weight to international opinion and not enough to the force on the ground.both men have threatened to bring down mr netanyahu ’ s coalition government if he end the war , a america wants.but pressure over the cost of that war are rising at home too . israel ’ s parallel conflict with hezbollah in lebanon ha escalated in recent day , highlighting the broader risk of continuing the war with their hamas ally . last night , large crowd turned out to protest in tel aviv , calling on mr netanyahu to end the conflict in gaza and sign a deal to return 120 israeli hostage home.and the funeral of eleven soldier , killed in gaza over the weekend , are again pulling into focus question over how the stated war aim of israel ’ s prime minister can be achieved.mr netanyahu ha promised “ total victory ” against hamas . he ha framed the current operation in rafah a an assault on the group ’ s last remaining battalion in gaza – necessary to destroy it , he says.but it ’ s clear that even dismantling hamas a a structured military organisation doe not mean an end to the conflict entirely . israeli force still face guerrilla operation by hamas fighter in area they have previously cleared.and there ’ s no sign that the group ’ s key leader – yahya sinwar and mohammed deif – have been killed or captured.for mr netanyahu , ending the war is likely to bring a fresh battle for his own political survival.the division laid bare today between his army and his ally highlight the tension between rhetoric and reality in this war.and the tension mr netanyahu face in straddling them : caught between the promise of “ total victory ” and the prospect of a `` forever war `` .
title: military ‘ pause ’ on gaza road inflames division in israeli government

Body Text: israel ’ s prime minister benjamin netanyahu ha dissolved his six-member war cabinet , a widely expected decision that follows the departure of centrist opposition leader benny gantz and his ally gadi eisenkot.israeli medium report that sensitive issue about the war with hamas in gaza will now be decided by a smaller forum.since mr gantz quit eight day ago over what he said wa the lack of strategy for the war , there have been call from far-right minister to take his place.by dissolving the war cabinet , mr netanyahu avoids a tricky situation with his coalition partner and international allies.a spokesman for the israel defense force ( idf ) said that , a far a it wa concerned , it would not affect the chain of command . mr gantz and mr eisenkot joined a national unity government with mr netanyahu ’ s right-wing coalition day after the start of the war in october.the two former idf chief of staff announced their resignation on 9 june , with mr gantz saying that the prime minister ’ s leadership wa “ preventing u from approaching true victory ” . immediately afterwards , far-right national security minister itamar ben-gvir said he had written to mr netanyahu to demand that he be added to the war cabinet.on sunday night , mr netanyahu reportedly informed minister that he had decided to dissolve the decision-making body rather than bring in new member . “ the [ war ] cabinet wa in the coalition agreement with gantz at his request . a soon a gantz left - there is no need for a cabinet anymore , `` he said , according to the jerusalem post.haaretz reported that some of the issue previously discussed by the war cabinet would be transferred for discussion in the 14-member security cabinet , which includes mr ben-gvir and fellow far-right finance minister bezalel smotrich.it said sensitive decision would be addressed in a “ smaller consultation forum ” , which wa expected to include defence minister yoav gallant , strategic affair minister ron dermer and the chairman of the ultra-orthodox shas party , aryeh deri . the three men were in the war cabinet along with the prime minister , mr gantz and mr eisenkot.the idf 's chief spokesman , rear admiral daniel hagari , insisted on monday that such move would not affect it operation . `` cabinet member are being changed and the method is being changed . we have the echelon , we know the chain of command . we 're working according to the chain of command . this is a democracy , ” he told reporters.the israeli military launched a campaign in gaza to destroy hamas in response to an unprecedented attack on southern israel on 7 october , during which about 1,200 people were killed and 251 others were taken hostage.more than 37,340 people have been killed in gaza since then , according to the territory 's hamas-run health ministry . there have been further sign of strain in the israeli government in the past day , with mr netanyahu and his far-right minister criticising a decision by the idf to introduce daytime “ tactical pause in military activity ” near the southern gaza city of rafah to allow more delivery of humanitarian aid.the pause are meant to allow lorry to collect aid from the israeli-controlled kerem shalom border crossing , south-east of rafah , and then travel safely to reach the main north-south road inside gaza . supply have been held back at the crossing point since israel began an operation in rafah last month.but mr ben-gvir decried the policy a foolish , while israeli medium quoted mr netanyahu a saying : “ we have a country with an army , not an army with a country . ” the idf responded by saying that the pause did not mean the fighting in southern gaza would stop , which created confusion over what exactly wa happening on the ground.the un agency for palestinian refugee ( unrwa ) , which is the largest humanitarian organisation in gaza , reported that fighting wa continuing in rafah and elsewhere in the south on monday and that “ operationally nothing ha changed yet ” . the idf meanwhile said that it troop were “ continuing intelligence-based , targeted operation in the area of rafah ” . it added that they had located weapon , struck structure rigged with explosive and eliminated “ several terrorist ” in the tal al-sultan area.with little sign of progress towards a full ceasefire in gaza , there have been new warning from the israeli military that the lower-level conflict with the lebanese armed group hezbollah is now threatening to spiral into a wider war . following a recent intensification in exchange of fire , a key u diplomat is returning to the region to try to reduce tension on the israel-lebanon border .
